Fighting Style (Dour Destroyer).name: Fighting Style (Dour Destroyer)
Fighting Style (Dour Destroyer).description:
At 2nd level, you adopt a style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again. You gain a second fighting style at 13th level.

Available Fighting Styles

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.421HHdOx4hMJBMZM]{Fighting Style: Offense}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zxZyl87cNHyrbjDE]{Fighting Style: Shielded}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.kkkm2IqVTKCWeZj5]{Fighting Style: Great Weapon Fighting}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.TZ526QHkhPhGyfE3]{Fighting Style: Inevitable}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Weaponized Evolution: Shield.name: Weaponized Evolution: Shield
Weaponized Evolution: Shield.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 2 or 4

Your weaponized evolution actually is not only a weapon, but also acts as a shield that confers a +2 bonus to AC while it is "drawn." If you assign only 2 points, it needs to grow from your shield arm and cannot be drawn from any other place on your body. If you assign 4 points, you can draw the organic shield from another part of your body, potentially allowing you to use it in conjunction with another shield. However, you may benefit from a maximum of two shields at a given time, at least one of which must be gained from this customization, and suffer disadvantage on attack rolls while protected by more than one shield.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

Weaponized Evolution: Shield.name: Weaponized Evolution: Shield
Weaponized Evolution: Shield.description: If you assign 4 points, you can draw the organic shield from another part of your body, potentially allowing you to use it in conjunction with another shield. However, you may benefit from a maximum of two shields at a given time, at least one of which must be gained from this customization, and suffer disadvantage on attack rolls while protected by more than one shield.

Oath of Destruction: Improved Devouring.name: Oath of Destruction: Improved Devouring Instrument
Oath of Destruction: Improved Devouring.description:
Starting at 7th level, your instrument can hold the abilities of an additional two uncommon magic weapons for a total of the abilities of four uncommon magical weapons held. Alternatively, the instrument may hold the abilities of one rare magic weapon instead of the abilities of two uncommon magic weapons. Your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.iDGWTA4sLAe6GKYt]{instrument of entropy} could, for example, hold the abilities of one rare and two uncommon magic weapons or hold the abilities of two rare magic weapons.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.BCBJ3r8hDf3eCVtx]{Oath of Destruction} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Maneuver: Take the Hit.name: Maneuver: Take the Hit
Maneuver: Take the Hit.description:
When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one forge die to reduce the damage by the number you roll on your forge die + your Constitution modifier. Additionally, opportunity attacks you perform against the target until the end of your next turn receive a bonus equal to the result of your forge die.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.WW97cWeTjikBQKkD]{Dweorg Prowess} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

utility.condition: another creature damages you with a melee attack

Mutation Surge.name: Mutation Surge
Mutation Surge.description:
At 3rd level, when you choose this archetype, the mutation of your body progresses further and goes beyond the mere evolution to deploy tools of destruction or protection and allows you to quickly adjust to issues you face on the fly. These quick mutations are taxing and they are represented by a number of mutation surges. Your underworld monstrosity level determines the number of mutation surges you have, as shown in the Mutation Surge column of the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.RboRpWCTH5iNHRUz]{Underworld Monstrosity} table. You can spend these surges to fuel various class features. You begin knowing three of them: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.fTWxlsqoAz9oTtxF]{Mutating Flurry}, @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.yTIwLKmgDI3aNJuy]{Chaos of Limbs} and @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.MYgpfWiA3o8gHAdd]{Weird Movement}. You learn more as you gain levels in this class. When you spend a mutation surge, it is unavailable until you finish a long rest, at the end of which your body regenerates its rapid response mutation capability.

Many of the "Mutation Surge" features that you gain utilize Mutation Surges. They have been configured to use the correct number of points, but you will need to adjust the Item that they use to point to this Mutation Surge feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.6vMre8fEO864VyYg]{Highly Mutagenic Arsenal}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.40S0O6B5dwOiMkMK]{Highly Mutagenic Form} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.t8qMfFLB4fdErBeL]{Hunter in the Dark}

Oath of Elimination: To Bleed but Dust.name: Oath of Elimination: To Bleed but Dust
Oath of Elimination: To Bleed but Dust.description:
Starting at 3rd level, your blood and flesh become unpalatable to all creatures known. Creatures with an Intelligence score of 5 or less never willingly attack you with bite attacks. Your flesh turns to ash and dust in the mouth of any creature that tries to eat you. Additionally, all creatures that drain life force or blood from you with their abilities or features gain no sustenance from you, nor do they gain any benefits. Intelligent creatures sense this and must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC to attack you with bite attacks.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.XIfmkQVJgrNfpX4E]{Oath of Elimination} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Aura of Decay.name: Aura of Decay
Aura of Decay.description:
Starting at 6th level, whenever a hostile creature within 10 feet of you must make a saving throw, the creature takes a penalty to the saving throw equal to your Charisma modifier (with a minimum penalty of –1). You must be conscious to inflict this penalty. At 9th level, the range of this aura increases to 20 feet. At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Improved Verdant Bloom.name: Improved Verdant Bloom
Improved Verdant Bloom.description:
Starting at 6th level, you choose an additional two @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.OvL2DaB8XkpoaNjd]{verdant blooms} to add to your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zC6hqHV2FHTDsuNS]{verdant path} class feature. Additionally, your hulking nature and sticky plant material allow you to ignore your sunlight sensitivity and fire vulnerability racial features while raging.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.hVwXclRCTsemlCOO]{Path of the Fungal Hulk} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{Funglet}

Superior Web of Steel.name: Superior Web of Steel
Superior Web of Steel.description:
Starting at 15th level, you have truly mastered your strange fighting style.

Offensive Whirl. You no longer suffer from disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws until your next turn when you use Offensive Whirl.

Defensive Whirl. You may spend 2 of your defensive dice to gain the @Compendium[dnd5e.classfeatures.a4P4DNMmH8CqSNkC]{Evasion} class feature until your next turn.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.n1Y3DSSQdh03Ihd4]{Hoyrall Shredder}

Poisonous Shadows.name: Poisonous Shadows
Poisonous Shadows.description:
Starting at 8th level, whenever you would lose your shadow due to an effect, spell or similar circumstance, you may use your reaction to regrow your shadow and negate any and all negative effects associated with having no shadow. Additionally, any beneficial spell or ability that requires the use of your shadow that may currently be in effect is not ended by this, allowing you to potentially have more than one spell or ability that uses your shadow in effect at any given time. You can use this feature again after completing a short rest.

Furthermore, as a reaction to being poisoned or to suffering poison damage, you can siphon poison coursing through your veins into your shadow, immediately ending any ongoing poison damage and the poisoned condition. You are still treated as poisoned for the purpose of this domain's abilities for as long as your shadow that absorbed the poison persists. Abrupt exposure to total darkness or magical light ends this boon. Your shadow may only hold one poison at any given time. If your shadow holds a poison and you complete a long rest, it is no longer considered to be holding poison.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.056vVNLR9ay112Y7]{Naraneus Domain}

utility.condition: lose your shadow due to an effect, spell or similar circumstance

Diamond Gem Magic.name: Diamond Gem Magic
Diamond Gem Magic.description:
Beginning at 14th level, your spells become nearly impossible to resist or avoid. When you cast a spell, you may expend 25 gp worth of diamond dust per spell level as an additional material component to add one of the following bonuses to the spell. You may increase saving throw DCs to resist any spell you cast by 2 or you may add +2 to your spell attack bonus for the spell. At 18th level, saving throws made to resist spells you cast with diamond dust increase to 4 and the bonus to your spell attack bonus increases to +4. You may only apply one bonus to a spell cast, and you make the decision of which bonus to apply when you cast the spell. You may only supplement a spell you cast with one of your gem magic features.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

utility.condition: When you cast a spell, you may expend 25 gp worth of diamond dust per spell level as an additional material component

Font of Magic (The Soul Burner).name: Font of Magic (The Soul Burner)
Font of Magic (The Soul Burner).description:
Blood Candle Casting

As a soul burner, you do not gain the Flexible Casting feature. Instead, you can use a @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.items-urc.7YsREErrFT0eUJSn]{blood candle} as an optional material component for your spellcasting. You also gain blood candle points. You gain a number of blood candle points equal to 1/2 your sorcery points, rounded down. These points work like sorcery points, but can only be used for Blood Candle Casting.

Blood candles can be placed in mid-flight or under water—the magic of the spellcasting process lets the candle levitate and burn, if required.

You may spend sorcery points to modify spells: You can spend a number of sorcery points to delay the onset of your magic and modify the wick-length of the blood candle. The wick burns down by one round when it's your turn.

A blood candle's wick-length can delay the onset of a spell—you may delay the onset of a spell cast with a soul candle by up to your proficiency bonus + Charisma modifier rounds ([[@prof+@abilities.cha.mod]]). If a spell that targets one or multiple specific creatures is cast this way, it instead targets any creature in a chosen 5-foot-cube within the spell's original range, determined by you upon placing the blood candle. If no creature is within the chosen square upon the spell triggering, the spell's effects harmlessly dissipates as it affects the chosen square. You have to be able to see and have a line of effect to the target, if any, upon casting the spell.

If the spell targets multiple specific creatures, you can choose multiple 5-foot-cubes equal to the number of creatures affected. Any creature occupying a square chosen by you when the wick burns down is subject to the spell's effects. Spells with a range of Self instead affect the square in which you have cast the spell.

The sorcery point cost shows the cost of modifying a spell with a blood candle.

Blood Candle Casting Table

Spell Slot LevelSorcery Point Cost
1st2
2nd3
3rd5
4th6
5th7
6th8
7th9
8th10
9th11

 

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.XGvmHjVisFgmSmqg]{The Soul Burner} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.classes.6T08zzKtmmpVwlXU]{Sorcerer} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.rD6ClOZUjEUrW6Je]{Gitwerc}

Geomancer's Storm.name: Geomancer's Storm
Geomancer's Storm.description:
At 17th level, you can manipulate the very earth around you to create a churning maelstrom of deadly earth and rock, crushing your foes while leaving your allies unharmed. You can expend 5 uses of your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{exploding earth} as an action to turn the earth in a radius of 60 feet around you into a rumbling, churning zone of destruction. All creatures within the area are subject to your exploding earth ability and also are subjected to all three additional base effects you can generate by expending an additional use of exploding earth (see exploding earth, above). Creatures affected by this ability, even those that successfully save, treat the area as difficult terrain until the end of your next turn. Additionally, you may exempt up to your Wisdom modifier creatures from the effects of this feature.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Pd4p25SGqNLjmsOi]{Geomancer} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Weaponized Evolution: Thrown.name: Weaponized Evolution: Thrown
Weaponized Evolution: Thrown.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 2

Your weaponized evolution is a hefty growth of bone, chitin or a similar substance that you can throw. Use your Constitution modifier for the attack roll and damage roll. However, until you collect and reabsorb your thrown weaponized evolution or complete a long rest, you cannot draw this specific weaponized evolution. Thrown weaponized evolutions cannot be sold and turn into a useless goo after 1 hour if not collected and reabsorbed. If your thrown weaponized evolution is destroyed (or you fail to collect it), you regenerate it after your next completed long rest and may draw it again.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

Earthen Path.name: Earthen Path
Earthen Path.description:
You may, as a reaction to an enemy moving towards you or as an action, duplicate the effects of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.A4RsPuSvB9wFtz1j]{dimension door}, with the restriction that both your current location and destination need to be in contact with earth or rocks. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (with a minimum of once) before requiring a long rest to recharge.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Use Reaction.name: Use Reaction
Use Reaction.condition: as a reaction to an enemy moving towards you

Arachnid Powers: Arachnid Appendages I.name: Arachnid Powers: Arachnid Appendages I
Arachnid Powers: Arachnid Appendages I.description:
At 9th level, all the poison and chemicals you have been subjected allow you to create a frighteningly grotesque display of power. As an action, you may concentrate and expend 2 spider points. If you do, you feel a tingling and suddenly grow a pair of fully functional additional arms on your next turn. This allows you to hold up to two additional objects and you gain an additional extra attack when using the Attack action, but this extra attack is made at disadvantage. For as long as your additional arms persist, you gain advantage on all grapple checks made against creatures of your size or smaller. Alternatively, you may grapple up to two creatures that are smaller than you at once without incurring any penalty. Your arms persist indefinitely or until you take a short or long rest, at which point they grow back into your body, but while they exist, you suffer disadvantage on all Charisma-based checks against just about all creatures from nondrow cultures. Subject to the GM's discretion, most intelligent humanoids will attack you on sight as they consider you an abomination. You may, at any time, meditate for 5 minutes to have your arachnid appendages retreat into your body. Alternatively, you may spend 2 spider points to instantaneously have them disappear within you.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Arachnid Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JC2dZxZKjGpDIyf4]{Arachnid Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

Hail of Missiles.name: Hail of Missiles
Hail of Missiles.description:
Starting at 14th level, you may use your crossover weapon to blast a hail of missiles at enemies. You may either make an Attack action twice, instead of once, when attacking with your crossover weapon. Alternatively, you may fire up to your Charisma modifier ([[@abilities.cha.mod]]) projectiles at foes within range, but you suffer from disadvantage on all attack rolls when you do and are &Reference[stunned] in the round following this use of the Hail of Missiles feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.S52490dx1EU9JEge]{College of The Mirthful Mariachi}

Semi-Precious Stone: Amber.name: Semi-Precious Stone: Amber
Semi-Precious Stone: Amber.description:
Amber

You can create a piece of amber that you may use to change the damage type of any spell to poison damage. You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into a piece of amber worth at least 50 gp.

As a bonus action when you cast a spell, you may use the specially prepared piece of amber as an additional material component to change the type of damage from the spell's normal damage type to poison. A spell thus modified does not induce the poisoned condition. Using the piece of amber in this manner does not destroy the gem.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.RKBHyaqusOyb4L2m]{Semi-Precious Stone} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Prepare Gem.name: Prepare Gem
Prepare Gem.condition: You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into a piece of amber worth at least 50 gp.

Stone Telekinesis.name: Stone Telekinesis
Stone Telekinesis.description:
At 9th level, you learn to feel stone as it literally shifts to your whim. You may, as an action on your turn, duplicate the effects of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.HQfd7jJyULIoGxrZ]{telekinesis} by expending 3 uses of your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{exploding earth}. The save DC is equal to your exploding earth's save DC. Stone telekinesis can only manipulate objects and creatures made of stone or earth. Additionally, you gain additional uses of exploding earth equal to your proficiency bonus ([[@prof]]).

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

Manually edit your Exploding Earth Limited Uses maximum to be:

@classes.stonespeaker.levels+@abilities.wis.mod+@prof

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Pd4p25SGqNLjmsOi]{Geomancer} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Oath of Elimination: Unstoppable Advance.name: Oath of Elimination: Unstoppable Advance
Oath of Elimination: Unstoppable Advance.description:
Starting at 15th level, you become immune against the charmed and frightened conditions. Additionally, you gain advantage on saving throws against all spells and effects that reduce your speed.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.XIfmkQVJgrNfpX4E]{Oath of Elimination} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Improved Prescient Pulse.name: Improved Prescient Pulse
Improved Prescient Pulse.description:
Beginning at 15th level, when maintaining a @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.3QuzpedjD1LTsoyN]{Focused Sonar} on a single creature or object, you may emit a Discerning Pulse focused on the target. If you do, you gain advantage on all saving throws against spells or effects originating from the target.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.4sVXYZpiVZ8A31zD]{Blind Duelist} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.9hk0MrqI67lCzCBG]{Vestraadi}

Hallucinogenic Visions.name: Hallucinogenic Visions
Hallucinogenic Visions.description:
Beginning at 6th level, your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.pnEunsaQFSDObGDp]{explosive caps} contain inert, but hallucinogenic spores over which you can exert a modicum of control. When you throw an @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.items-urc.WuKFFOXNrTH6W5l0]{explosive cap}, it detonates and leaves behind a wispy cloud of spores that lasts until the end of your next turn. The cloud is a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the target and it does not impede sight. As a bonus action on your turn, you can will the spores to coalesce on a target currently within the cloud of spores that you can see. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature succeeds on the saving throw, you can't use this feature on it again until you finish a long rest. If the creature fails its save, it experiences strange hallucinations and must roll [[/r 1d10]] on the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.tables-urc.Y4R6u6AH1MxK3u7a]{Hallucinogenic Visions} table below:

Hallucinogenic Visions

d10Behaviour
1The creature uses all its movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll [[/r 1d8]] and assign a direction to each die face. The creature doesn't take an action this turn.
2-3The creature doesn't move or take actions this turn, instead becoming entranced by the translucent, rococo patterns it sees covering every nearby surface.
4-5The creature is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.zZaEBrKkr66OWJvD]{Charmed}.
6-7The creature must succeed on its choice of either a Dexterity or Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC on each of its turns for the duration or fall prone.
8-9The creature becomes confused, as per @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe]{confusion}, hallucinating crawling swarms of insects on itself and others.
10Suffering only mild hallucinations, the creature can act and move normally.

The effects of hallucinogenic visions last for 1 minute.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.2fFeJlvURReUSxRb]{Mushroom Domain}

Verdant Bloom: Thorny Path.name: Verdant Bloom: Thorny Path
Verdant Bloom: Thorny Path.description:
Razor-sharp fungal matter sprouts from your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zC6hqHV2FHTDsuNS]{verdant path}. Any creature attempting to move through the verdant path takes 1d4 points of piercing damage for each 5 feet of movement through the area. Creatures beginning their turn in a square covered by your verdant path also take this damage.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.OvL2DaB8XkpoaNjd]{Verdant Bloom} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.hVwXclRCTsemlCOO]{Path of the Fungal Hulk} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{Funglet}

Maneuver: Sweeping Flame Arc.name: Maneuver: Sweeping Flame Arc
Maneuver: Sweeping Flame Arc.description:
When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one forge die to attempt to damage another creature with the same attack, as flames extend in a sweeping arc from your original target. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes fire damage equal to the number you roll on your forge die. You may expend an additional forge dice to increase the damage at 7th level and 15th level.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

damage.condition: when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack

Highly Mutagenic Form.name: Highly Mutagenic Form
Highly Mutagenic Form.description:
At 11th level, you can, as a bonus action, spend any number of mutation surges to re-assign your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{body evolutions}. You expend a number of mutation surges equal to the number of evolution points you wish to reassign and may assign them anew, as though you had completed a long rest.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation Surge feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.0PptTkgfQPOELLrf]{Mutation Surge}

Fighting Style: Offense.name: Fighting Style: Offense
Fighting Style: Offense.description:
While wearing armor reduced to 1 hit point via your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.6sAGZUXPm0gvcOk2]{All is Dust} feature, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.052gStdnqtgszV22]{Fighting Style} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Bonus Melee Weapon Damage: +2.name: Bonus Melee Weapon Damage: +2
Bonus Melee Weapon Damage: +2.description: While wearing armor reduced to 1 hit point via your All is Dust feature, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls.

Martial Arts (Master of the Web).name: Martial Arts (Master of the Web)
Martial Arts (Master of the Web).description:
At 1st level, your practice of arachnid-inspired martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that emphasize unarmed strikes and monk weapons, which are shortswords and any simple melee weapons that don't have the two-handed or heavy property. You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only monk weapons and you aren't wearing armor or wielding a shield:

  • You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed attacks and monk weapons.
  • You can roll a d4 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strikes or monk weapon. This die changes as you gain master of the web levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web Advancement} table.
  • When you use the Attack action with an unarmed strike or monk weapon on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action. For example, if you take the attack action and attack with a quarterstaff, you can also make an unarmed strike as a bonus action, assuming you haven't already taken a bonus action this turn.

Masters of the web tend to train with monk weapons that emphasize piercing and slashing damage, featuring a look reminiscent of spiders and similar arachnids. These weapons have a lot of variations in name and specific design, but utilize the game statistics provided for @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.BYFd9hiJGo9L5aOM.JournalEntryPage.AOOs5OrXYgGzwI9d#special-weapons]{simple weapons}, only changing the damage type as appropriate.

Subterranean Song.name: Subterranean Song
Subterranean Song.description:
Starting at 6th level, you become so attuned to the melodies of the wind surging through the caverns, the dripping of water and the rumble of the earth that you become practically impossible to take by surprise, as you can unconsciously read even the minutest modifications of the melody you perceive. While in the underworld, you gain advantage on your first attack in every combat and you cannot be surprised. Additionally, you do not suffer from disadvantage when attacking with your combined music instrument/ranged weapon when only 5 feet from an enemy. Finally, you can expend a bardic inspiration die to completely silence a ranged attack you execute with your crossover weapon.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.S52490dx1EU9JEge]{College of The Mirthful Mariachi}

Verdant Bloom: Grapes of Wrath, Weird.name: Verdant Bloom: Grapes of Wrath, Weird
Verdant Bloom: Grapes of Wrath, Weird.description:
Choose another type of damage from the following list: Acid, Cold, Lightning, Necrotic, Poison, Radiance. Your may choose to inflict this damage instead of fire damage when using @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.oSdEuw2yJsbDWL7v]{grapes of wrath}. You need to know the grapes of wrath verdant bloom to select this verdant bloom.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.OvL2DaB8XkpoaNjd]{Verdant Bloom} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zC6hqHV2FHTDsuNS]{Verdant Path}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.hVwXclRCTsemlCOO]{Path of the Fungal Hulk} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{Funglet}

Mushroom Immunity.name: Mushroom Immunity
Mushroom Immunity.description:
At 6th level, continuous exposure to fungus-based toxins and hallucinogens has changed your body. You become immune to all poisons and diseases based on fungi. Additionally, you gain advantage on all saving throws to resist the effects of plant-based toxins and drugs.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0NoGaw4VYzO8jThb]{Circle of the Mushroom}

Chosen of the Earth.name: Chosen of the Earth
Chosen of the Earth.description:
At 17th level, you are a chosen of a higher elemental power or a deity associated with the earth. As an action, you can expend one use of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{exploding earth} to reinforce this status. Earth elementals, subterranean beasts and creatures from the elemental planes or associated with them (subject to GM's discretion, as a guideline creatures that speak Terran as their native tongue) refuse to attack you and cease all hostility against you and your allies at the display of your might. Unless you or your allies resume hostilities, the creatures will not stand in your way, but neither are they obliged to help you. They do, however, suffer disadvantage on saves against spells and effects by you and your allies to inflict the charmed condition upon them.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.FdgQNu2Mf8KGH0he]{Divine Calling} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Arachnid Powers: Burst of Speed.name: Arachnid Powers: Burst of Speed
Arachnid Powers: Burst of Speed.description:
Beginning at 6th level, you may spend 2 spider points to double your movement speed until the end of your next turn. Additionally, you gain +2 to AC and gain an additional action that you can use for an Attack, Dash, Disengage or Hide action.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Arachnid Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JC2dZxZKjGpDIyf4]{Arachnid Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

Arachnid Powers: Burst of Speed.name: Arachnid Powers: Burst of Speed
Arachnid Powers: Burst of Speed.description: You may spend 2 spider points to double your movement speed until the end of your next turn. Additionally, you gain +2 to AC and gain an additional action that you can use for an Attack, Dash, Disengage or Hide action.

Semi-Precious Stone: Turquoise.name: Semi-Precious Stone: Turquoise
Semi-Precious Stone: Turquoise.description:
Turquoise

You can create a turquoise that you may use to change the damage type of any spell to acid damage. You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into a turquoise worth at least 50 gp.

As a bonus action when you cast a spell, you may use the specially prepared turquoise as an additional material component to change the type of damage from the spell's normal damage type to acid. Using the turquoise in this manner does not destroy the gem.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.RKBHyaqusOyb4L2m]{Semi-Precious Stone} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Prepare Gem.name: Prepare Gem
Prepare Gem.condition: You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into a turquoise worth at least 50 gp.

Mutation Sense.name: Mutation Sense
Mutation Sense.description:
At 15th level, you can see the true form of any shapechanger or creature concealed by illusion or transmutation magic while the creature is within 30 feet of you and within your line of sight.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Potent Sonics.name: Potent Sonics
Potent Sonics.description:
Starting at 8th level, your affinity with the blood drinking ahool and their ilk allow you to add extra power to your sonic attacks. You may add your Wisdom modifier ([[@abilities.wis.mod]]) to the thunder damage you deal with your keening and ironsinging (see @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.feats-urc.NvaY49CbbkZfae4l]{Ironsinger} feat).

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.RzjJuVkYP7DyWSgD]{Ahool Keener Domain}

Semi-Precious Stone: Obsidian Shard.name: Semi-Precious Stone: Obsidian Shard
Semi-Precious Stone: Obsidian Shard.description:
Obsidian Shard

You can create a specially prepared obsidian shard that you may use to change the damage type of any spell to fire damage. You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into an obsidian shard worth at least 25 gp.

As a bonus action when you cast a spell, you may use the specially prepared obsidian as an additional material component to change the type of damage from the spell's normal damage type to fire. Using the obsidian shard in this manner does not destroy the gem.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.RKBHyaqusOyb4L2m]{Semi-Precious Stone} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Prepare Gem.name: Prepare Gem
Prepare Gem.condition: You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into an obsidian shard worth at least 25 gp.

Primordial Frenzy.name: Primordial Frenzy
Primordial Frenzy.description:
Beginning at 6th level, your primitive wrath allows you to enter a frenzy when you @Compendium[dnd5e.classfeatures.VoR0SUrNX5EJVPIO]{rage}. If you do, you may not use any manufactured weapons, but may make a single melee weapon attack with your natural weapons as a bonus action on each of your turns after this one. You may not spare the life of any creature when reducing it to 0 hit points while in a primordial frenzy. While in such a primordial frenzy, you do not suffer from the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.oKvTwxNml1CsFhbG]{profane healing} drawback. When your rage ends, you suffer one level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cspWveykstnu3Zcv]{Exhaustion}.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.qIEZU5kHgolXaB9W]{Kraidyl Bite} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.YMzkMMzWAnmqXvGc]{Kraidyl Tail}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.ZcItMZGxiEjNMR5R]{Path of the Primordial Predator}

Siege Master.name: Siege Master
Siege Master.description:
Like the scions of the earth, you are a powerful force to behold when assaulting the inanimate. You deal double damage to @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.t6scHTmpmHBTZGTX.JournalEntryPage.3RM2KPMlMrSXngN3]{objects} and structures.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

All is Dust.name: All is Dust
All is Dust.description:
Being suffused by the very powers of entropy takes its toll on your equipment. For every total of 24 hours you carry a given item, you reduce its @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.t6scHTmpmHBTZGTX.JournalEntryPage.3RM2KPMlMrSXngN3#object-hit-points]{damage threshold} permanently by 1. If an item's damage threshold is reduced to 0, it instead begins losing hit points with a rate of 1 per day, up to a minimum of one. This is the reason most dour destroyers look like dilapidated vagabonds or beggars, but the fragility is deceptive—while in your possession, only specifically targeted attacks against objects reduced to 1 hit point via this ability will destroy them. When you for example fall on your potions, they are not crushed, in spite of their fragility.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Highly Mutagenic Arsenal.name: Highly Mutagenic Arsenal
Highly Mutagenic Arsenal.description:
At 6th level, you can, as a bonus action, spend any number of mutation surges to re-assign your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{weaponized evolutions}. You expend a number of mutation surges equal to the number of evolution points you wish to reassign and may assign them anew, as though you had completed a long rest. Additionally, your mutation attacks now are treated as magical weapons. You receive +1 to attack rolls and damage rolls with your mutation attacks. Additionally, when successfully striking a creature with a mutation attack that has been customized with the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZU5Pdj6SMFmVYRJF]{energy mutation} customization, you may spend 1 mutation surge to add +1d6 to the damage the attack causes, with the damage type corresponding to the damage type chosen via energy mutation. You may spend a maximum of mutation surges this way equal to your proficiency bonus per turn. ([[@prof]])

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation Surge feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.0PptTkgfQPOELLrf]{Mutation Surge}

damage.condition: when successfully striking a creature with a mutation attack that has been customized with the energy mutation customization

Oath of Destruction: Devouring Instrumen.name: Oath of Destruction: Devouring Instrument
Oath of Destruction: Devouring Instrumen.description:
Upon taking this oath, you may take a magic weapon and ritualistically destroy it in a 1-hour ceremony. Upon destroying the weapon, you add all special features of the weapon apart from its bonuses to attack and damage rolls permanently to your instrument of entropy. Upon destroying a flame tongue, for example, your instrument of entropy would begin shedding light and, when activated, it would deal an extra 2d6 fire damage to any target you hit with it. The number of such abilities an @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.iDGWTA4sLAe6GKYt]{instrument of entropy} may hold at any given time depends on your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{dour destroyer} level and the scarcity of the magic weapon destroyed. At 3rd level, your instrument of entropy can hold the abilities of up to two uncommon magical weapons at a given time.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.BCBJ3r8hDf3eCVtx]{Oath of Destruction}

Weaponized Evolution: Heavy.name: Weaponized Evolution: Heavy
Weaponized Evolution: Heavy.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 2

Your weaponized evolution is cumbersome, but also more powerful. You increase its mutation base damage die by one step. (d4 becomes d6, d6 becomes d8, d8 becomes d10, d10 becomes d12.) However, you may not use this weaponized evolution to make an attack as a bonus action via your mutation class feature. This customization can only be applied to melee weaponized evolutions.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

You will need to manually adjust your weaponized evolution damage dice.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

Body Evolution: Steroid Boost.name: Body Evolution: Steroid Boost
Body Evolution: Steroid Boost.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 1

You develop a gland that enhances your Strength, but makes you irritable and less bright. You increase your Strength score by 2 for as long as this evolution persists, but also are more irritable. You suffer from disadvantage on all Intelligence and Charisma checks for as long as it persists.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{Body Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Body Evolution: Steroid Boost.name: Body Evolution: Steroid Boost
Body Evolution: Steroid Boost.description: You develop a gland that enhances your Strength, but makes you irritable and less bright. You increase your Strength score by 2 for as long as this evolution persists, but also are more irritable. You suffer from disadvantage on all Intelligence and Charisma checks for as long as it persists.

Elusive.name: Elusive
Elusive.description:
Beginning at 18th level, continuous escapes from those you deceived bear fruit. No attack roll has advantage against you unless you are incapacitated or restrained.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Maneuver: Forge's Blessing.name: Maneuver: Forge's Blessing
Maneuver: Forge's Blessing.description:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks and use a bonus action to direct one of your companions to strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you and expend one forge die. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack, adding the forge die to the attack's damage roll. The weapon deals fire damage instead of its regular weapon damage.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

utility.condition: when you take the Attack action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks

Crystal Powers: Flurry of Blows.name: Crystal Powers: Flurry of Blows
Crystal Powers: Flurry of Blows.description:
Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 crystal point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Crystal Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

utility.condition: Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn

Deep Badger Companion.name: Deep Badger Companion
Deep Badger Companion.description:
At 3rd level you gain an unusually intelligent, strong and loyal @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.monsters-urc.R4wdTNtfCgB3PF5h]{Deep Badger} companion that accompanies you on your adventures and is trained to fight alongside you. The deep badger increases its Intelligence to 6 and it gains the ability to understand one language of your choice that you speak. The deep badger obeys your commands as best as it can. It takes its turn on your initiative, though it doesn't take an action to command it to take its turn.

On your turn, you can verbally command the badger to move (no action required by you). You can use your action to verbally command it to take the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#attack]{Attack}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#dash]{Dash}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#disengage]{Disengage}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#dodge]{Dodge} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#help]{Help} action. You may not command the badger to use Multiattack. Once you have the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.classfeatures.XogoBnFWmCAHXppo]{Extra Attack} feature, you can make one weapon attack yourself when you command the badger to take the Attack action. The deep badger serves you as a mount, both in combat and out, and you have an instinctive bond with it that allows you to fight as a seamless unit.

While astride your deep badger, you can travel on top of it through the earth, at its burrow speed. Passengers that are not you must make a Dexterity saving throw at a disadvantage after every minute traveled or be thrown off and buried, taking damage equal to your proficiency bonus times d6. The tunnel you dig collapses almost immediately behind you unless fortified. If the badger dies, you can obtain another one by spending 8 hours magically bonding with another deep badger that isn't hostile to you. You add 1/2 your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to the badger's AC, attack rolls and damage rolls as well as to any saving throws and skills it is proficient in. Its hit point maximum equals its normal maximum or three times your ranger level, whichever is higher.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.1MyYnTPU07HBzzqC]{Underminer}

Exploding Earth.name: Exploding Earth
Exploding Earth.description:
@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeakers} have supreme command over the forces of the rocks and earth and can cause the ground to violently detonate. As an action, you can point at a 5-foot-square of earth, rock, or other solid material (wood and buildings qualify) you can see within 30 feet. Any creature within the square must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier ([[8+@prof+@abilities.wis.mod]]). The explosion inflicts 1d6 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier bludgeoning damage, half as much on a successful save. Creatures flying 5 feet or more above the square you designate are immune to exploding earth. You can expend two uses of exploding earth instead to add one of the following effects to your exploding earth:

  • Creatures that fail their save have their walking speed reduced by 10 feet until they regain at least 1 hit point.
  • The square you targeted with exploding earth is considered to be difficult te rrain thereafter.
  • Creatures that fail their save are knocked prone.

The amount of damage exploding earth inflicts increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the exploding earth column of the Stonespeaker Advancement table. At 8th level, the range of this ability increases to 60 feet. At 14th level, it increases to 100 feet. At 20th level, you can use this ability on any creature you can see, no matter how far away it is. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once) plus your class level. You regain expended uses when you finish a long rest. If you have no uses of exploding earth left and finish a short rest, you regain 1 use of this class feature.

Many of the features you gain utilize your Exploding Earth. They have been configured to use the correct number of points, but you will need to adjust the Item that they use to point to this Expoding Earth feature.

affects.special: Creatures flying 5 feet or more above the square are immune

Svirf Science: Sniper's Assist.name: Svirf Science: Sniper's Assist
Svirf Science: Sniper's Assist.description:
You have a powerful targeting device in a monocle-like structure that connects to your head. On your turn, you can use your action and one science die to aim your ranged weapon at a creature you can clearly see. On your next turn, you add either your Intelligence modifier or Dexterity modifier (your choice) to your next ranged attack roll against the target in addition to your usual bonuses and you add both the result of your science die and the modifier chosen to the damage roll of your attack if you hit.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

Oath of Despair: Nimbus of Decay.name: Oath of Despair: Nimbus of Decay
Oath of Despair: Nimbus of Decay.description:
At 7th level, you extend the radius of your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.Jiswcmnde4yDISiS]{Accelerated Decay} class feature to 40 feet. Additionally, you may expend more than 5 entropic power points. For each additional 5 entropic power points you expend, you reduce the AC of all hostile creatures that failed their saving throw by –1, as your aura starts eroding the armors, be they manufactured or natural. The reduction is permanent, but manufactured armor may be repaired in a workday. If a manufactured armor's bonus to AC is completely negated by this ability, it falls apart and is destroyed. Natural armor can be regenerated naturally over the course of a week or by being subject to a lesser restoration spell or similar magic.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.vBmrL6GhORL4COpo]{Oath of Despair} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Modify Weapon.name: Modify Weapon
Modify Weapon.description:
Starting at 6th level, you gain the ability to modify your weapon by adding your previously created semi-precious stones into the hilt or on the blade of your preferred weapon. These semi-precious stones retain their ability to modify the damage type of your spells, but once placed in your preferred weapon they cause the weapon to do additional elemental damage based on the type of stone as shown in the chart below. At 10th level, you may add another semi-precious stone for a total of two and at 14th level you can add a third stone. The additional damage from these stones is cumulative. You may only add semi-precious stones that you have previously learned to enchant from the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.RKBHyaqusOyb4L2m]{semi-precious stone} feature.

Furthermore, you can also create up to three semi-precious stones of the same type. These semi-precious stones offer no additional benefit for your spellcasting, but you can use them to enhance your preferred weapon. At 14th level, for example, you could add 3 obsidian shards to your weapon so that it inflicts an additional +3d6 fire damage.

You may change out the semi-precious stones in your blade, but doing so requires one day of uninterrupted work per stone that you are exchanging.

Semi-Precious StoneDamage
Amber+1d6 poison damage
Crystal quartz+1d6 force damage
Obsidian Shard+1d6 fire damage
Onyx+1d6 necrotic damage
Pearl+1d6 cold damage
Turquoise+1d6 acid damage

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.xvCPjS7O7KlDHteI]{Gemblade Facet} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Perfect Hybrid.name: Perfect Hybrid
Perfect Hybrid.description:
At 20th level, when you roll initiative and have no spider points remaining, you automatically regain 4 spider points. When you roll initiative and have no web uses remaining, you regain twice your proficiency bonus web uses. You are no longer exhausted by using your dance of the many-legged fiend arachnid power.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

Expert Linguist.name: Expert Linguist
Expert Linguist.description:
Also at 1st level, you have realized the importance of language to get what you want. Your studies render you a true polyglot. You gain an additional language of your choice that you can speak, read and write. At 3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, 11th, 13th, 15th, 17th and 19th level, you learn an additional language. You need to have had some sort of exposure to the language either via writing, communication or similar means to be able choose a language.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Crystal Powers: Tongue of the Mortals.name: Crystal Powers: Tongue of the Mortals
Crystal Powers: Tongue of the Mortals.description:
Starting at 13th level, you learn to touch the primal longing and sense of aesthetics in other minds, so that you can understand all spoken languages of mortal creatures. Any creature that can understand a language can understand what you're saying. However, immortal creatures with no natural maximum life span seem to be curiously exempt from this: You can't communicate with such beings in this way. You may spend 1 crystal point as part of uttering any statement to render your speech completely intelligible gibberish to immortal creatures.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Crystal Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

utility.chatFlavor: render your speech completely intelligible gibberish to immortal creatures

Body Evolution: Unspeakable Feedback.name: Body Evolution: Unspeakable Feedback
Body Evolution: Unspeakable Feedback.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 4

You change something within your brain, which renders making mental contact with you a dire proposal. For as long as this evolution persists, any attempts to contact you via telepathy, discern your thoughts or similarly read your mind become dangerous for the subject. The creature must immediately make a Wisdom saving throw or take your Wisdom modifier times 1d6 psychic damage. You may not suppress this evolution while it persists—even potentially friendly creatures are affected and what they see is nightmare-inducing enough to initiate hostilities. Additionally, you gain resistance to psychic damage while this evolution persists.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{Body Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

save.condition: any attempts to contact you via telepathy, discern your thoughts or similarly read your mind

Body Evolution: Unspeakable Feedback.name: Body Evolution: Unspeakable Feedback
Body Evolution: Unspeakable Feedback.description: You change something within your brain, which renders making mental contact with you a dire proposal. Additionally, you gain resistance to psychic damage while this evolution persists.

Blessing of Poison.name: Blessing of Poison
Blessing of Poison.description:
Starting when you choose this domain at 1st level, you choose either Dexterity (Stealth) or Charisma (Deception). Once made, this choice cannot be reversed, unless you complete an appropriate quest. (Subject to GM's approval.) You can grant yourself or a creature you touch advantage on checks with the chosen skill. This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again. You also gain proficiency with the poisoner's kit.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.056vVNLR9ay112Y7]{Naraneus Domain}

The Eternal Amberstick.name: The Eternal Amberstick
The Eternal Amberstick.description:
Also at 3rd level, you gain a special @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.items-urc.Db0NHoeECovouVCT]{amberstick} that, oddly, is not destroyed upon exploding—instead, it just emits a devastating explosion. After exploding, it simmers and glows with an unearthly light, not unlike amber embers, slowly recharging its violent energies. By completing a short rest and meditating, you may recharge your eternal amberstick. If you lose your eternal amberstick, you may replace it by buying 450 gp worth of material and spending a day's worth of downtime crafting a replacement.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0M9xA5nHnRKxMAcx]{Sapper}

Improved Fortunate Flexibility.name: Improved Fortunate Flexibility
Improved Fortunate Flexibility.description:
Starting at 15th level, you learn to use fortune points assigned in the following ways:

  • Stream of Magic. You increase the damage your Spark of Magic feature does by +1d6, to a total of +2d6. Additionally, you increase the duration to twice your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier rounds ([[@*(@prof+@abilities.int.mod)]]).
  • Shielded by Magic. The wearer of an armor or item with at least two fortune points assigned to this feature may spend two fortune points assigned to cause the item to be set ablaze in a certain type of energy for a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier ([[@prof+@abilities.int.mod]]). The wearer can choose either acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage. The wearer gains immunity to the chosen energy type. A wielder may only be ablaze with one of these protective energies at any given time. Additionally, you increase the duration of Guarded by Magic to twice your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier rounds ([[2*(@prof+@abilities.int.mod)]]).

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.MlhMfrrAFVlXMUPk]{Fortunate Flexibility} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.aWkIotnftg3JJxaS]{My Own Fortune}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.BhqrHkBTC5QCskBe]{Fortune's Smith} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
Also at 2nd level, you gain an almost supernatural awareness of other creatures and their inner workings. You learn the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{detect thoughts} spell. You can use this spell a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier before requiring a long rest to recharge. You do not need a material component for the spell. Your spellcasting attribute is Charisma.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Shake the Earth.name: Shake the Earth
Shake the Earth.description:
At 18th level, you learn to create a truly devastating shock with your explosives. By either using 8 @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.items-urc.Db0NHoeECovouVCT]{ambersticks} or the equivalent of 10 1d4-portions worth of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.wMGScFH374yCQcJT]{ambercaps} in one devastating throw at a strategically-placed locale, you can generate a seismic tremor at a point within range of your explosives. The tremor lasts 1 minute and the ground in a 100-foot circle centered on the point shakes and affects creatures and structures in contact with the ground in that area. The ground in the area becomes difficult terrain. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must make a Constitution saving throw against your amberstick save DC. On a failed save, the creature's concentration is broken.

Additionally, each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked prone. This feature can have additional effects depending on the terrain in the area, as determined by the GM.

Fissures. Fissures open throughout the affected area at the start of your next turn after you activate the detonation. A total of 2d6 such fissures open in locations chosen by the GM. Each is 1d10 x 10 feet deep, 10 feet wide, and extends from one edge of the affected area to the opposite side. A creature standing on a spot where a fissure opens must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your amberstick save DC or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens. A fissure that opens beneath a structure causes it to automatically collapse (see below).

Structures. The tremor deals 50 bludgeoning damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area when you activate the detonation and at the start of each of your turns until the duration ends. If a structure drops to 0 hit points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures. A creature within half the distance of a structure's height must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 5d6 bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone, and is buried in the rubble, requiring a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. The GM can adjust the DC higher or lower, depending on the nature of the rubble. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone or become buried.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0M9xA5nHnRKxMAcx]{Sapper} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.DcAdIDBClNBsJpHq]{Amberstick Sapper}

Tremorsense.name: Tremorsense
Tremorsense.description:
A stonespeaker can feel through the very rocks. You gain tremorsense with a range of 10 feet. Your tremorsense's range increases by +10 feet at 5th level, 8th level, 12th level, 15th level and 18th level.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Maneuver: Melting Attack.name: Maneuver: Melting Attack
Maneuver: Melting Attack.description:
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one forge die to attempt to undermine the creature's resistance to fire. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it loses resistance to fire until the end of your next turn.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

The Saving Throw has been set to use Strength for your maneuver save DC. Change this to use Dexterity if that's what you chose for your Dweorg Prowess feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

save.condition: when you hit a creature with a weapon attack

Blindsense.name: Blindsense
Blindsense.description:
Starting at 14th level, if you are able to hear, you are aware of the location of any hidden or invisible creature within 10 feet of you.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Weaponized Evolution: Light.name: Weaponized Evolution: Light
Weaponized Evolution: Light.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 1

Your weaponized evolution is treated as though it had the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.BYFd9hiJGo9L5aOM.JournalEntryPage.AOOs5OrXYgGzwI9d#weapon-properties]{Light} property. This customization can only be applied to melee weaponized evolutions that do not have the heavy customization.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

Arachnid Powers: Dance of the Many-Legge.name: Arachnid Powers: Dance of the Many-Legged Fiend
Arachnid Powers: Dance of the Many-Legge.description:
At 13th level, you finally learn the legendary martial art that made the master of web feared throughout the known underworld of Aventyr. You can take your action to make a melee attack against any number of creatures within 5 feet of you, with a separate attack roll for each creature. Alternatively, you may expend 3 spider points to move up to your base speed and perform a melee attack against any number of creatures that are within 5 feet of you during any part of the Move, with a separate attack roll for each creature. Your movement potentially incurs opportunity attacks and you may attack a given creature only once during your move. Finally, you may expend 4 spider points as well as up to twice your regular maximum of simultaneous web uses per turn, to perform a number of web attacks against creatures within the maximum range of your web, provided you have enough uses of web to affect the targets. If you use either of the spider point powered uses of this feature, you incur one level of &Reference[exhaustion] at the end of your turn.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Arachnid Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JC2dZxZKjGpDIyf4]{Arachnid Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

Appraisal.name: Appraisal
Appraisal.description:
Beginning at 1st level, you can accurately determine the value of any gemstone that you have the opportunity to study for at least one minute. This feature also allows you to determine if a gemstone is real or a fake. You do not require a magnifying glass for this appraisal. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to notice well-hidden, small details in objects, provided you can study them for at least one minute.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Weaponized Evolution: Ranged & Loading.name: Weaponized Evolution: Ranged & Loading
Weaponized Evolution: Ranged & Loading.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 2

Your weaponized evolution is treated as a ranged mutation attack that has a range equal to a light crossbow (80/320) and can fire up to 20 pieces of ammunition that you generate from your body—whether they are bolt-like shards of bone, lumps of hard, bludgeoning tissue or something stranger still. Once you run out of ammunition, you can replenish it only by completing a short or long rest. Ammunition fired with this evolution cannot be salvaged and is destroyed upon being used, leaving behind strange, organic viscera. Your weaponized evolution is considered to have the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.BYFd9hiJGo9L5aOM.JournalEntryPage.AOOs5OrXYgGzwI9d#weapon-properties]{Loading} property.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

Sapper Specialist.name: Sapper Specialist
Sapper Specialist.description:
Beginning at 15th level, any explosions caused by @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.wMGScFH374yCQcJT]{ambercaps} ignore any damage threshold and resistance to bludgeoning and fire damage. Additionally, you further increase the damage you cause when throwing your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.9nYYsZgpHf2qRS0L]{eternal amberstick} and regular @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.items-urc.Db0NHoeECovouVCT]{ambersticks}, but not ambercaps, by +1d6 fire and +1d6 bludgeoning damage.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0M9xA5nHnRKxMAcx]{Sapper} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.DcAdIDBClNBsJpHq]{Amberstick Sapper}

Extra Attack (URC).name: Extra Attack (URC)
Extra Attack (URC).description:
Colliatur Reaver / Master of the Web / Dour Destroyer

Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

Underterror

Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn to attack with a @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{weaponized evolution}. This number of attacks increases to 3 at 20th level.

Gemblade Facet

Starting at 13th level, you can attack twice instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.xvCPjS7O7KlDHteI]{Gemblade Facet}

Badger Fury.name: Badger Fury
Badger Fury.description:
Starting at 11th level, your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7qTbHfzOBzzRrvSx]{deep badger} can utilize Multiattack when you command it to use the Attack action. Additionally, your deep badger's burrow speed increases by +10 feet and its claws become so hard they can burrow through stone, allowing you to use @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.sayPlFY3vJvJk4TD]{Erupting Charge} to charge through rock while astride your badger.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.1MyYnTPU07HBzzqC]{Underminer}

Martial Arts (Colliatur Reaver).name: Martial Arts (Colliatur Reaver)
Martial Arts (Colliatur Reaver).description:
At 1st level, your skills with deadly, crystalline martial arts grant you mastery of combat styles that emphasize @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J3gxBiFTP5UvRro0]{crystalline claws} and monk weapons, which are shortswords and any simple melee weapons that don't have the two-handed or heavy property. You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only monk weapons and you aren't wearing armor or wielding a shield:

  • You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed attacks and monk weapons.
  • You can roll a d4 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strikes or monk weapon. This die changes as you gain Colliatur Reaver levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver Advancement} table.
  • When you use the Attack action with an unarmed strike or monk weapon on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action. For example, if you take the attack action and attack with a quarterstaff, you can also make an unarmed strike as a bonus action, assuming you haven't already taken a bonus action this turn.

Colliatur Reavers tend to train with monk weapons that emphasize piercing and slashing damage, featuring strange and often alien weaponry. These weapons have a lot of variations in name and specific design, but utilize the game statistics provided for @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.BYFd9hiJGo9L5aOM.JournalEntryPage.AOOs5OrXYgGzwI9d#special-weapons]{simple weapons}, only changing the damage type as appropriate.

Foundry Note: Use the following to automatically scale the damage formula for your unarmed strikes and monk weapons in place of the normal damage:
@scale.colliatur-reaver.martial-arts + @mod

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Pure as Crystal.name: Pure as Crystal
Pure as Crystal.description:
At 10th level, you can touch upon the pristine beauty refracted through your crystal components to destroy your foes. Your may now also choose to deal radiant damage with your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J3gxBiFTP5UvRro0]{Claws of Crystal} class feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Evasion (Mistress of the Web).name: Evasion (Mistress of the Web)
Evasion (Mistress of the Web).description:
Beginning at 7th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or devastating spells. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail. If the effect is prompted by a creature that is currently an eligible target for your deceptive attack feature, you may substitute your Charisma saving throw for your Dexterity saving throw before rolling the saving throw. If you do, however, the target ceases to be an eligible target for your deceptive attack and has to be deceived again.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Body Evolution: Adrenalin Boost.name: Body Evolution: Adrenalin Boost
Body Evolution: Adrenalin Boost.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 1

Adrenalin Boost. You develop a gland that enhances your Dexterity, but makes you irritable. You increase your Dexterity score by 2 for as long as this evolution persists, but also makes you more twitchy. You suffer from disadvantage on all Intelligence and Wisdom checks for as long as it persists.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{Body Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Body Evolution: Adrenalin Boost.name: Body Evolution: Adrenalin Boost
Body Evolution: Adrenalin Boost.description: Adrenalin Boost. You develop a gland that enhances your Dexterity, but makes you irritable. You increase your Dexterity score by 2 for as long as this evolution persists, but also makes you more twitchy. You suffer from disadvantage on all Intelligence and Wisdom checks for as long as it persists.

Reaver's Filaments.name: Reaver's Filaments
Reaver's Filaments.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can generate deadly reaver's filaments—crystalline, fragile and dazzling, the reaver filaments deal the same damage and damage type as the one chosen for the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J3gxBiFTP5UvRro0]{Claws of Crystal} class feature. Reaver filaments are treated as monk weapons. Reaver's filaments are ranged and melee weapons at the same time and may be used to attack adjacent foes without suffering from disadvantage. When used as melee weapons, reaver's filaments have the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.BYFd9hiJGo9L5aOM.JournalEntryPage.AOOs5OrXYgGzwI9d#weapon-properties]{Reach} property. When you use them as ranged weapons, they are subject to cover and all usual modifications for @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.twd4zj7m1n9sBaVG#ranged-attacks]{Ranged Attacks} and have a range of (20/40). You can wield one reaver filament per hand. The usual rules for @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.twd4zj7m1n9sBaVG#two-weapon-fighting]{Two-Weapon Fighting} apply when using two filaments. A filament requires gestures to execute attacks, thus you need to have nothing but the filament in your hands to direct the attacks. Reaver's filaments are not precise enough to open doors, pick locks or perform similar actions.

Reaver's filaments have hit points equal to your Wisdom score, a damage threshold of 0 and, if destroyed, can be reformed as an action that provokes opportunity attacks.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.5SGdeDBS1GkEudpX]{Reaving Vortex}

Amberstick Sapper.name: Amberstick Sapper
Amberstick Sapper.description:
As soon as you take this archetype at 3rd level, you get professional training for handling @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.items-urc.Db0NHoeECovouVCT]{ambersticks}. You add your proficiency bonus and Dexterity or Strength modifier (your choice) to the save DC of ambersticks you throw. You also can craft a steady supply of ambersticks. Upon finishing a long rest, you create a number of ambersticks equal to your proficiency bonus. However, ambersticks you create this way are unstable and don't work for anyone but you and are short-lived. They cannot be sold and become immediately inert after completing a long rest or 24 hours after creation, whichever happens first.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0M9xA5nHnRKxMAcx]{Sapper}

Gem Transmutation.name: Gem Transmutation
Gem Transmutation.description:
At 2nd level you may transmute one or more cut gems of one type and value into any number of gems of a different type, so long as the total value of the gems remains the same. This process requires 10 minutes of uninterrupted concentration. For example, you may transmute 5 emeralds worth 10 gp each into a single emerald worth 50 gp or 2 diamonds worth 25 gp each. You must complete a short rest before you can use this feature again.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Emerald Gem Magic.name: Emerald Gem Magic
Emerald Gem Magic.description:
Starting at 11th level, you can create an emerald that you may use to maximize the results of one of your spells. You spend one hour and one 5th level spell slot to focus your magical energies into an emerald worth at least 200 gp.

As a bonus action when you cast a spell, you may use the specially prepared emerald as an additional material component to maximize all the random elements of the spell. This does not affect saving throws or opposed rolls. You may only have one emerald prepared this way at a time.
