Once you use this emerald you may not use it again until you have completed a short or long rest. You may only supplement a spell you cast with one of your gem magic features.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Prepare Gem.name: Prepare Gem
Prepare Gem.condition: You spend one hour and one 5th level spell slot to focus your magical energies into an emerald worth at least 200 gp

Improved Ambersticks.name: Improved Ambersticks
Improved Ambersticks.description:
Also at 7th level, you increase the damage you cause when throwing your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.9nYYsZgpHf2qRS0L]{eternal amberstick} and regular @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.items-urc.Db0NHoeECovouVCT]{ambersticks}, but not ambercaps, by +1d6 fire and +1d6 bludgeoning damage.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0M9xA5nHnRKxMAcx]{Sapper} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.DcAdIDBClNBsJpHq]{Amberstick Sapper}

Maneuver: Lunging Flame.name: Maneuver: Lunging Flame
Maneuver: Lunging Flame.description:
When you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend one forge die to increase your reach for that attack by 5 feet. If you hit, your attack deals fire damage instead of the regular weapon damage.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

utility.condition: when you make a melee weapon attack on your turn

Legendary Focus.name: Legendary Focus
Legendary Focus.description:
Starting at 18th level, whenever you use @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.3QuzpedjD1LTsoyN]{Focused Sonar}, you do not have to choose a single creature or object—instead, you can focus on up to your proficiency bonus plus your Wisdom modifier number of creatures at any given time, making you a nigh unstoppable force in small altercations.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.4sVXYZpiVZ8A31zD]{Blind Duelist} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.9hk0MrqI67lCzCBG]{Vestraadi}

Maneuver: Forge's Retribution.name: Maneuver: Forge's Retribution
Maneuver: Forge's Retribution.description:
You can expend forge dice whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack. Flames surge forth from your body. The attacker takes fire damage equal to the forge dice you expend.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

damage.condition: whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack

Prescient Pulse.name: Prescient Pulse
Prescient Pulse.description:
Beginning at 7th level, when maintaining a @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.3QuzpedjD1LTsoyN]{Focused Sonar} on a single creature or object, you may emit a Discerning Pulse focused on the target. If you do, you gain a level of prescient knowledge about the target's incoming attacks. The target suffers from disadvantage on all attacks against you for a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus plus your Wisdom modifier. You must finish a short rest before being able to utilize this ability again.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.4sVXYZpiVZ8A31zD]{Blind Duelist} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.9hk0MrqI67lCzCBG]{Vestraadi}

Mutated Movement.name: Mutated Movement
Mutated Movement.description:
Starting at 2nd level, you can grow small additional legs or arms or a particularly frictionless slime to increase your speed by 10 feet while not wearing any boots. At 9th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Mutated Movement.name: Mutated Movement
Mutated Movement.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can grow small additional legs or arms or a particularly frictionless slime to increase your speed by 10 feet while not wearing any boots. At 9th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

Svirf Science: Energy Damper.name: Svirf Science: Energy Damper
Svirf Science: Energy Damper.description:
You have developed a powerful dampening field you can use to mitigate some types of lethal energy. As a reaction to being targeted by an attack, spell or effect that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage, you may expend one science die to gain resistance against the triggering energy type for the purpose of resolving this attack.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

utility.condition: As a reaction to being targeted by an attack, spell or effect that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage

Live by Light.name: Live by Light
Live by Light.description:
At 15th level, your crystalline components support your whole physiology, drawing sustenance from exposure to bright lights like those emitted by the colloid's crystals. If you spend at least 1 hour during a long rest soaking in light from a very bright source, you do not need to eat, drink or sleep for 24 hours.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Arachnid Powers: Weaponized Webbing.name: Arachnid Powers: Weaponized Webbing
Arachnid Powers: Weaponized Webbing.description:
At 14th level, you have learned to harden your webs to clumps, razor-sharp edges or points. When you use the Attack action to attack with your web, you may choose bludgeoning, slashing or piercing damage and expend additional web uses up to your maximum of web-uses per activation. If you hit the target, it takes 1d4 damage of the chosen damage type per additional web use you expended. This damage is in addition to the usual effects of your web.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SLmVud9Ffi7Gpfts]{Web} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JC2dZxZKjGpDIyf4]{Arachnid Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

Eternal Monument.name: Eternal Monument
Eternal Monument.description:
You are one with the earth and every rock and just as enduring—You gain additional uses of exploding earth equal to your stonespeaker class level.

On the Details tab of your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{Exploding Earth} feature, replace the maximum field for Limited Uses with the following formula:

2*@classes.stonespeaker.levels+@abilities.wis.mod

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Filament Maneuver: Filament Web.name: Filament Maneuver: Filament Web
Filament Maneuver: Filament Web.description:
You can expend filament dice whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack. One of the razor-sharp filaments cuts into the attacker, who takes damage equal to the filament dice you expend plus your proficiency bonus.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Filament Superiority. You do not need to roll it as well.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.j8mWJmM260FD3dQJ]{Filament Superiority} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.D3ZThzktnr5oVmok]{Reaver's Filaments}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

damage.condition: whenever a creature within 5 feet of your hits you with a melee attack

Crystal Powers: Colloid's Body.name: Crystal Powers: Colloid's Body
Crystal Powers: Colloid's Body.description:
Beginning at 18th level, you can use your action to spend 4 crystal points to generate a crystalline sheathe of exoskeleton-like armor that lasts for one minute. While this armor is active, you have resistance to all damage types except thunder and you are immune against the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.oreoyaFKnvZCrgij]{Frightened} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.zZaEBrKkr66OWJvD]{Charmed} conditions.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Crystal Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Colloid's Body.name: Colloid's Body
Colloid's Body.description: While this armor is active, you have resistance to all damage types except thunder and you are immune against the &Reference[frightened] and &Reference[charmed] conditions.

Svirf Science: Kinetic Dampener.name: Svirf Science: Kinetic Dampener
Svirf Science: Kinetic Dampener.description:
You have strapped a strange kind of dynamo to your feet, one that powers a small generator that can deflect attacks. When you move, you can expend one science die, rolling the die and adding the number rolled to your AC against attacks while you are moving.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

utility.condition: When you move, you can expend one science die, rolling the die and adding the number rolled to your AC against attacks while you are moving

Verdant Bloom: Corrosive Path.name: Verdant Bloom: Corrosive Path
Verdant Bloom: Corrosive Path.description:
Acidic slime coats the fungal matter of your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zC6hqHV2FHTDsuNS]{verdant path}. Any creature attempting to move through the verdant path takes 1d4 points of acid damage for each 5 feet movement through the area. Creatures beginning their turn in your verdant path also take this damage.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.OvL2DaB8XkpoaNjd]{Verdant Bloom} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.hVwXclRCTsemlCOO]{Path of the Fungal Hulk} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{Funglet}

Improved Weaponized Evolution.name: Improved Weaponized Evolution
Improved Weaponized Evolution.description:
Starting at 7th level, your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{weaponized evolutions} become ever more deadly. You add the following weaponized evolutions to your options.

Improved Weaponized Evolutions

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZU5Pdj6SMFmVYRJF]{Energy Mutation} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.bgXq4wvY8AiTUn0W]{Internal Quiver} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.qMs6jEXhEDmshigL]{Ranged}

 

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Mushroom Whisperer.name: Mushroom Whisperer
Mushroom Whisperer.description:
At 1st level, you learn the language of mushrooms, allowing you to enter a strange form of communication with mushrooms. By touching a mushroom, you can imbue it with limited sentience, allowing it to communicate with you. You can question fungi about events within 30 feet of their location that have transpired within the day, gleaning information about creatures that have passed, weather and similar circumstances. You also become proficient in your choice two of the following skills: Insight, Medicine, Nature, or Survival. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make using either of those skills chosen.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.2fFeJlvURReUSxRb]{Mushroom Domain}

Body Evolution: Energy Dampening.name: Body Evolution: Energy Dampening
Body Evolution: Energy Dampening.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 2, 4, 6 or 8

Your body adapts to one damage type. When you assign evolution points, choose one damage type from the following for each two evolution points you assign: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder. You gain resistance to the chosen damage type(s) while this evolution persists. Alternatively, if you suffer from vulnerability to one of these damage types, instead of its regular benefits, you lose the vulnerability to this damage type for as long as this evolution persists. You may also instead assign 6 evolution points to a single damage type. If you do, you become immune to this damage type for as long as the evolution persists. If are vulnerable to a damage type and want to become immune, you need to assign 8 evolution points.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

The Activities have been set up for a character that does not have any vulnerabilities. If your character does have a vulnerability, you will need to adjust the Activity consumption values.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{Body Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Acid.name: Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Acid
Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Acid.description: Your body adapts to one damage type. When you assign two evolution points you gain resistance to the chosen damage type(s) while this evolution persists. Alternatively, if you suffer from vulnerability to one of these damage types, instead of its regular benefits, you lose the vulnerability to this damage type for as long as this evolution persists.

Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Cold.name: Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Cold
Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Cold.description: Your body adapts to one damage type. When you assign two evolution points you gain resistance to the chosen damage type(s) while this evolution persists. Alternatively, if you suffer from vulnerability to one of these damage types, instead of its regular benefits, you lose the vulnerability to this damage type for as long as this evolution persists.

Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Fire.name: Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Fire
Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Fire.description: Your body adapts to one damage type. When you assign two evolution points you gain resistance to the chosen damage type(s) while this evolution persists. Alternatively, if you suffer from vulnerability to one of these damage types, instead of its regular benefits, you lose the vulnerability to this damage type for as long as this evolution persists.

Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Lightn.name: Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Lightning
Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Lightn.description: Your body adapts to one damage type. When you assign two evolution points you gain resistance to the chosen damage type(s) while this evolution persists. Alternatively, if you suffer from vulnerability to one of these damage types, instead of its regular benefits, you lose the vulnerability to this damage type for as long as this evolution persists.

Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Thunde.name: Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Thunder
Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Thunde.description: Your body adapts to one damage type. When you assign two evolution points you gain resistance to the chosen damage type(s) while this evolution persists. Alternatively, if you suffer from vulnerability to one of these damage types, instead of its regular benefits, you lose the vulnerability to this damage type for as long as this evolution persists.

Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Acid I.name: Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Acid Immunity
Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Acid I.description: Your body adapts to one damage type. When you assign 6 evolution points to a single damage type. If you do, you become immune to this damage type for as long as the evolution persists. If are vulnerable to a damage type and want to become immune, you need to assign 8 evolution points.

Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Cold I.name: Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Cold Immunity
Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Cold I.description: Your body adapts to one damage type. When you assign 6 evolution points to a single damage type. If you do, you become immune to this damage type for as long as the evolution persists. If are vulnerable to a damage type and want to become immune, you need to assign 8 evolution points.

Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Fire I.name: Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Fire Immunity
Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Fire I.description: Your body adapts to one damage type. When you assign 6 evolution points to a single damage type. If you do, you become immune to this damage type for as long as the evolution persists. If are vulnerable to a damage type and want to become immune, you need to assign 8 evolution points.

Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Lightn.name: Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Lightning Immunity
Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Lightn.description: Your body adapts to one damage type. When you assign 6 evolution points to a single damage type. If you do, you become immune to this damage type for as long as the evolution persists. If are vulnerable to a damage type and want to become immune, you need to assign 8 evolution points.

Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Thunde.name: Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Thunder Immunity
Body Evolution: Energy Dampening: Thunde.description: Your body adapts to one damage type. When you assign 6 evolution points to a single damage type. If you do, you become immune to this damage type for as long as the evolution persists. If are vulnerable to a damage type and want to become immune, you need to assign 8 evolution points.

Claws of Crystal.name: Claws of Crystal
Claws of Crystal.description:
Also at 1st level, you learn to exert a level of control over your crystalline claws. You may cause the crystals of your body to cover your hands in razor-sharp claws. You can change the damage type inflicted with your claws as a bonus action. Your claws can inflict either bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage and you are proficient with them. Crystalline Claws are treated as unarmed attacks for the purposes of the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.CNFqjUZmDNxHInAz]{Martial Arts} class feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Crystal Powers.name: Crystal Powers
Crystal Powers.description:
Starting at 2nd level, the structures of crystal underlying your physiology enhance your potency in combat, granting you wondrous powers. These powers are represented by a number of crystal points. Your Colliatur Reaver level determines the number of crystal points you have, as shown in the Crystal Points column of the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver Advancement} table. You can spend these points to fuel various crystal powers. You start knowing three such features: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7oBYtqstIufbU6J8]{Flurry of Blows}, @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.STJe6VCpNpLftnq2]{Patient Defense} and @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.naIsn8oAD1JfSJLw]{Crystal Refraction}. You gain more crystal powers as you gain levels in this class. When you spend a crystal point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which your body regenerates its potent powers. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest to eat and drink, since your metabolism fuels your powers. Some of your features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature's effect. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Crystal Powers save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier ([[8+@prof+@abilities.con.mod]])

The maximum uses section on the Details tab has been set to maintain your Crystal Points.

For each of the "Crystal Powers" features you gain, the "Item Uses" fields on the Activities tab should already be partially configured for you. You will need to select this Item from the dropdown on your character sheet.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.q97X7mD1xXTbTKWP]{Pacifying Strike} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.sd7ODgye5uih8ofi]{Stillness of the Colloid}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.9ABSdKo74ElfEeKB]{Tongue of the Mortals} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.giCmtNIkoG03uDyn]{Diamond Soul}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.H4QEoMdUJ8EZtfqA]{Colloid's Body} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.Vr6CNd0CbY2g3yIn]{Avatar}

Arachnid Powers.name: Arachnid Powers
Arachnid Powers.description:
Starting at 2nd level, all the concoctions of hallucinogens, poisons and spiders, the exposure to the underworld's weird radiation and your own adrenalin levels react and begin to change your physiology, allowing you to gain the effects of strange powers. These powers are represented by a number of spider points. Your master of the web level determines the number of spider points you have, as shown in the Spider Points column of the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web Advancement} table. You can spend these points to fuel various arachnid features. You start knowing three such features: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.T0J8WLmE9HdGkoaU]{Flurry of Blows}, @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SLmVud9Ffi7Gpfts]{Web} and @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.PBgWZj5qk7FOO2nX]{Spider Climb}. You gain more arachnid powers as you gain levels in this class. When you spend a spider point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which your body regenerates its potent powers. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest and eat and drink, since your metabolism fuels your powers. Some of your arachnid features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature's effect. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Arachnid Powers save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier ([[8+@prof+@abilities.cha.mod]])

Many of the "Arachnid Powers" that you gain utilize Spider Points. They have been configured to use the correct number of points, but you will need to adjust the Item that they use to point to this Arachnid Power feature.

Maneuver: Endurance of the Forge.name: Maneuver: Endurance of the Forge
Maneuver: Endurance of the Forge.description:
On your turn, you can use a bonus action and expend one forge die to bolster one of your companions suffering from exhaustion. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you that has at least one level of exhaustion. That creature decreases its exhaustion levels until the start of your next turn by an amount equal to ½ your forge die's result, minimum 1. The exhaustion returns on your next turn, stacking with any exhaustion levels incurred in the meanwhile. An ally may only be affected once by this maneuver before requiring a long rest to be able to benefit from it again.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

affects.special: has at least one level of exhaustion

range.special: choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you

Wrath of the Earth (Divine Calling).name: Wrath of the Earth (Divine Calling)
Wrath of the Earth (Divine Calling).description:
At 1st level, you can cause the very earth to rise up in defense of you, rebuking assailants. When a creature within 5 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to expend a use of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{exploding earth} and cause the creature to make a Dexterity saving throw against exploding earth. On a failed save, the creature takes your exploding earth's damage and falls prone (without requiring you to expend an additional use of exploding earth), half as much damage and no falling prone on a successful save. Additionally, if a creature fails its save against this feature, you may @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#disengage]{Disengage} as a bonus action on your next turn.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

To simplify using this feature, the saving throw and damage for Exploding Earth have been copied to it.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.FdgQNu2Mf8KGH0he]{Divine Calling} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

save.condition: When a creature within 5 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack

affects.special: Creatures flying 5 feet or more above the square are immune

Oath of Despair: Accelerated Decay.name: Oath of Despair: Accelerated Decay
Oath of Despair: Accelerated Decay.description:
Beginning at 3rd level, you gain an additional number of entropic power points equal to your proficiency bonus x 5. At any given time, you may expend 5 entropic power points as a bonus action to accelerate and extend the potency of your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.6sAGZUXPm0gvcOk2]{All is Dust} class feature for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier ([[@abilities.cha.mod]]). Whenever a hostile creature is within 20 feet of you while this is activated, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or be subjected to the effects of an enhanced version of your All is Dust feature, immediately lowering the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.t6scHTmpmHBTZGTX.JournalEntryPage.3RM2KPMlMrSXngN3#object-hit-points]{damage threshold} of all of its items by 5. If an item's damage threshold is reduced to 0, it is subjected to the usual reduction of maximum hit points. Additionally, all creatures within the aura suffer from disadvantage on saving throws versus spells and effects that inflict the &Reference[frightened] condition.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Touch of Entropy.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.vBmrL6GhORL4COpo]{Oath of Despair} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

save.condition: Whenever a hostile creature is within 20 feet of you while this is activated

Accelerated Decay.name: Accelerated Decay
Accelerated Decay.description: You gain an additional number of entropic power points equal to your proficiency bonus x 5.

Topaz Gem Magic.name: Topaz Gem Magic
Topaz Gem Magic.description:
Beginning at 3rd level, you can create a topaz that you may use to enhance the power of one of your spells. You spend one hour to focus your magical energies into a topaz worth at least 150 gp.

As a bonus action when you cast a spell, you may use the specially prepared topaz as part of the material components required to cast the spell as through you had cast the spell in a spell slot one level higher. You may only have one topaz prepared this way at a time. Once you use this topaz you may not use it again until you have completed a short or long rest. You may only supplement a spell you cast with one of your gem magic features.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Prepare Gem.name: Prepare Gem
Prepare Gem.condition: You spend one hour to focus your magical energies into a topaz worth at least 150 gp.

Semi-Precious Stone: Crystal Quartz.name: Semi-Precious Stone: Crystal Quartz
Semi-Precious Stone: Crystal Quartz.description:
Crystal Quartz

You can create a crystal quartz that you may use to change the damage type of any spell to radiant damage. You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into a crystal quartz worth at least 75 gp.

As a bonus action when you cast a spell, you may use the specially prepared crystal quartz as an additional material component to change the type of damage from the spell's normal damage type to radiant damage. Using the crystal quartz in this manner does not destroy the gem.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.RKBHyaqusOyb4L2m]{Semi-Precious Stone} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Prepare Gem.name: Prepare Gem
Prepare Gem.condition: You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into a crystal quartz worth at least 75 gp.

Refraction.name: Refraction
Refraction.description:
Starting at 6th level, as a reaction to taking acid, fire, force, lightning, or radiant damage, you may spend a spell slot to absorb damage of one of these types or any combination thereof equal to 5 times the level of the spell slot spent.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

utility.condition: as a reaction to taking acid, fire, force, lightning, or radiant damage

Enforced by the Earth II.name: Enforced by the Earth II
Enforced by the Earth II.description:
You become immune against the damage type chosen with your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.O4dnN2osIGlY1SKI]{Enforced by the Earth I} feature. If you used enforced by the earth I to eliminate a vulnerability, you gain resistance to the chosen damage type instead.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Filament Maneuver: Filament Push.name: Filament Maneuver: Filament Push
Filament Maneuver: Filament Push.description:
When you hit a creature with a filament attack, you can expend one filament die to attempt to drive the target back. You add the filament die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push the target up to 15 feet away from you.

The Saving Throw has been set to use Constitution for your maneuver save DC. Change this to use Dexterity if that's what you chose for your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.j8mWJmM260FD3dQJ]{Filament Superiority} feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.j8mWJmM260FD3dQJ]{Filament Superiority} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.D3ZThzktnr5oVmok]{Reaver's Filaments}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Tough as Granite.name: Tough as Granite
Tough as Granite.description:
The rocks begin suffusing your being, imbuing you with their vitality. Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level above 5th.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Tough as Granite.name: Tough as Granite
Tough as Granite.description: The rocks begin suffusing your being, imbuing you with their vitality. Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level above 5th.

Flurry of Mushrooms.name: Flurry of Mushrooms
Flurry of Mushrooms.description:
At 6th level, you can use your magic to allow you to throw devastating clusters of detonating mushroom caps. Immediately after you take the Attack action to attack with @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.luEKKueR0pag2wsH]{explosive caps}, on your turn, you can expend spell slots as a bonus action to make an additional attack with an explosive cap. For every 2 levels of spell slots you expend, you may make one such additional attack as part of the bonus action. You may expend a maximum number of spell slots in one such bonus action equal to your proficiency bonus ([[@prof]]).

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0NoGaw4VYzO8jThb]{Circle of the Mushroom}

utility.condition: expend spell slots

Filament Maneuver: Filament Pacification.name: Filament Maneuver: Filament Pacification
Filament Maneuver: Filament Pacification.description:
You may, as a bonus action, expend one of your filament dice to add @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.q97X7mD1xXTbTKWP]{Pacifying Strike}'s effects to all attacks you execute with your reaver's filaments for a number of rounds equal to the number rolled on your filament die.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.j8mWJmM260FD3dQJ]{Filament Superiority} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.D3ZThzktnr5oVmok]{Reaver's Filaments}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Weaponized Evolution: Reach.name: Weaponized Evolution: Reach
Weaponized Evolution: Reach.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 1

Your weaponized evolution is disgustingly amorphous and can extend like rubber. You add 5 feet to your reach when you attack with this weaponized evolution. This customization can only be applied to melee weaponized evolutions.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

Ability Score Improvement (URC).name: Ability Score Improvement (URC)
Ability Score Improvement (URC).description:
When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Aura of Despair.name: Aura of Despair
Aura of Despair.description:
Starting at 10th level, hostile creatures within 10 feet of you suffer from disadvantage when making a saving throw to negate the &Reference[frightened] condition. You must be conscious for the aura to be in effect. At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Weird Movement.name: Weird Movement
Weird Movement.description:
You can spend 1 mutation surge to take the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#dash]{Dash} action as a bonus action on your turn, doubling your @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.aYmUMcQfSIqYWpKk.JournalEntryPage.vR9rCM0UXPM9zl43#jumping]{jump distance} for the turn.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation Surge feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.0PptTkgfQPOELLrf]{Mutation Surge}

Maneuver: Burning Assault.name: Maneuver: Burning Assault
Maneuver: Burning Assault.description:
When you make a weapon attack roll against a creature, you can expend one forge die to change an amount of damage you inflict with your attack, up to a maximum equal to twice the result of your forge die, to fire damage. You can use this maneuver before or after making the attack roll, but before any effects of the attack are applied.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

The Damage Formula has been set to scale the forge die type with your fighter levels.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

utility.condition: weapon attack roll against a creature

Fortunate Flexibility.name: Fortunate Flexibility
Fortunate Flexibility.description:
Starting at 10th level, you learn to use fortune points assigned in the following ways:

  • Spark of Magic. The wielder of a weapon with a fortune point assigned to this feature may spend one fortune point assigned to cause the weapon to be set ablaze in energy for a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier ([[@prof+@abilities.int.mod]]). The wielder can choose either acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage. The weapon deals +1d6 damage of the chosen damage type on a successful hit. A weapon may only be ablaze with one of these energies at any given time.
  • Guarded by Magic. The wearer of armor or an item with a fortune point assigned to this feature may spend one fortune point assigned to cause the item to be set ablaze in a certain type of energy for a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier ([[@prof+@abilities.int.mod]]). The wearer can choose either acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage. The wearer gains resistance to the chosen energy type. A wielder may only be ablaze with one of these protective energies at any given time.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.aWkIotnftg3JJxaS]{My Own Fortune} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.BhqrHkBTC5QCskBe]{Fortune's Smith} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Hel Fire's Body.name: Hel Fire's Body
Hel Fire's Body.description:
At 6th level, your mutating body has already adapted to the rigors of subtle infusions of Hel-energies coursing through your body. When assigning evolution points to the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.IXQRQNXE6zGi0MmN]{energy dampening} body evolution and choosing fire as the damage type you resist, you also gain resistance to necrotic damage. If you instead assign enough evolution points to gain immunity against fire, you also gain immunity against necrotic damage. This is a permanent modification of the energy dampening body evolution. Finally, if you suffer from vulnerability to either fire damage or necrotic damage, you lose one of these permanently upon gaining this class feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.rE0CzmlorGDEQNEc]{Underterror Archetype} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.ZPEdqu0NxJX5Xepy]{Hel Savant} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Spell-powered Caps (Mushroom Domain).name: Spell-powered Caps (Mushroom Domain)
Spell-powered Caps (Mushroom Domain).description:
At 17th level, you can expend spell slots to enhance your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.pnEunsaQFSDObGDp]{explosive caps}, as part of making an attack with an explosive cap. You gain a number of cap-points equal to the level of the spell slot you expended, which you can use to modify the respective attack.

  • 1 point: Increase the damage your cap inflicts by +1d6 force damage, up to a maximum of +5d6 per cap.
  • 1 point: Bigger spore cloud. Increase the radius of the spore cloud your cap leaves behind by 10 feet.
  • 1 point: Aerodynamic caps. Increase the range of your mushrooms by (+10/+30), up to a maximum of (+30/+90).
  • 1 point: Obscuring cloud. Your spore cloud obscures sight at though it were a @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX]{fog cloud}.
  • 2 points: Increase the duration of your cap's spore cloud by 1 round, allowing you to affect up to two creatures with @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.3DfKe7EPSOUjIfxb]{Hallucinogenic Visions}.
  • 4 points: Potent mushrooms. Creatures suffer from disadvantage on saves against the hallucinations caused by your explosive caps' spores.
  • X points: Regrowing cap. Instead of modifying an explosive cap, you can expend a spell slot as an action to regrow your explosive caps. You regain a number of explosive caps equal to the level of the spell slot expended.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.2fFeJlvURReUSxRb]{Mushroom Domain}

Strength of the Forge.name: Strength of the Forge
Strength of the Forge.description:
Starting at 7th level, your carrying capacity is your Strength score multiplied by 30. This is the weight (in pounds) that you can carry. Additionally, you can push, drag or lift up to 60 times your Strength score in pounds.

In addition, you can add half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) to any Strength or Constitution check you make that doesn't already use your proficiency bonus.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Death Roll.name: Death Roll
Death Roll.description:
At 14th level, you may grapple foes of up to two sizes larger than you. While in a @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.6l5BQ2vJCVUaubiC]{primordial frenzy}, you may, as part of moving a creature grappled with your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.qIEZU5kHgolXaB9W]{bite}, elect to render the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.gYDAhd02ryUmtwZn]{Grappled} creature @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.y0TkcdyoZlOTmAFT]{Prone}. You may choose to move only at half your speed while doing so, performing death rolls—if you do, you inflict double bite damage on the target, as you thrash around with it in savage death rolls. For every 2 death rolls performed in a primordial frenzy beyond the first, you increase the level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cspWveykstnu3Zcv]{Exhaustion} suffered after the primordial frenzy has ended by +1. If you also have an ability that enhances grappling at the cost of being &Reference[restrained] while pinning creatures, you no longer are considered restrained while doing so.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.P0EFaFF21egrr0xD]{Savage Grab} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.ZcItMZGxiEjNMR5R]{Path of the Primordial Predator}

Enforced by the Earth I.name: Enforced by the Earth I
Enforced by the Earth I.description:
Your body begins taking on qualities associated with the resilient stones of the underworld. Choose slashing, piercing, fire or acid damage. You gain resistance against the chosen damage type. You may select a damage type against which you are vulnerable, but you do not get the usual benefits. Instead, you lose vulnerability to the damage type chosen.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Amberstick Phase.name: Amberstick Phase
Amberstick Phase.description:
Starting at 10th level, when using an Attack action to throw your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.9nYYsZgpHf2qRS0L]{eternal amberstick}, it immediately rematerializes in your hand after exploding. You must have a free hand for the eternal amberstick to rematerialize in it. If your hands are full, instead rematerializes at your feet. Additionally, your eternal amberstick may explode a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus before needing to recharge ([[@prof]]).

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0M9xA5nHnRKxMAcx]{Sapper}

Arachnid Powers: Web's Defense.name: Arachnid Powers: Web's Defense
Arachnid Powers: Web's Defense.description:
At 17th level, your mastery of your webs allows you to survive what would kill most mortals. Whenever you make a Strength, Dexterity or Constitution saving throw and would fail, you can spend one use of web, up to your maximum of web uses per turn, to reroll the saving throw. Additionally, as a reaction to a spell or effect that requires you to make a Strength, Dexterity or Constitution saving throw, you may expend a use of web, up to your maximum of web uses per turn, to gain advantage on the saving throw. You must choose to do so before rolling the saving throw, though. If you use this feature while it's not your turn, the consumed web uses are deducted from your maximum number of web uses per turn on your next turn.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Web feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SLmVud9Ffi7Gpfts]{Web} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JC2dZxZKjGpDIyf4]{Arachnid Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

utility.condition: Whenever you make a Strength, Dexterity or Constitution saving throw

Your Heart and Soul.name: Your Heart and Soul
Your Heart and Soul.description:
At 20th level, your dominion over those that listen to your promises becomes absolute. Whenever you manage to inflict the charmed condition on an adversary or use your all your heart's desires class feature, you gain permanent and unswerving devotion from the affected. No amount of reasoning can reverse the process or grant additional saves. The affected creature is willing to die and even condemn its soul for you. Magic is powerless to break your hold over a creature thus affected, with the exception of direct divine intervention or the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{wish} spell. Creatures saved from your domination forevermore are immune against being charmed by you.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Oath of the Endtimes.name: Oath of the Endtimes
Oath of the Endtimes.description:
When you reach 3rd level, you swear the oath that forever marks you as a chosen of entropy. Up until now you have committed to the path, but have not yet sworn heart and soul to it. Now you choose the Oath of Destruction, the Oath of Elimination or the Oath of Despair. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level, and again at 7th, 15th and 20th level.

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.BCBJ3r8hDf3eCVtx]{Oath of Destruction} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.XIfmkQVJgrNfpX4E]{Oath of Elimination} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.vBmrL6GhORL4COpo]{Oath of Despair}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Channel Divinity: Poisonous Cunning.name: Channel Divinity: Poisonous Cunning
Channel Divinity: Poisonous Cunning.description:
Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to invoke the divine favor of Naraneus upon those wielding or subject to poison. As an action, you call your deity's name. Up to two allies, one of which may be yourself, who are currently wielding a poisonous weapon or who are suffering from the poisoned condition, may spend their reactions to make an attack with their weapons. If these attacks hit, they add your Wisdom modifier ([[@abilities.wis.mod]]) to the damage dealt.

At 11th level, allies (or yourself) who hit with this attack deal an additional 1d8 poison damage on a hit.

At 17th level, allies (or yourself) who hit with this attack deal an additional 2d8 poison damage.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.056vVNLR9ay112Y7]{Naraneus Domain}

Oath of Destruction: Legendary Devouring.name: Oath of Destruction: Legendary Devouring Instrument
Oath of Destruction: Legendary Devouring.description:
Starting at 20th level, your instrument can be used to assimilate, but not destroy, legendary magic weapons and even artifacts. Your instrument can hold the abilities of an additional four uncommon magic weapons for a total of the abilities of sixteen uncommon magical weapons held. Alternatively, the instrument may hold the abilities of one legendary magic weapon instead of the abilities of five uncommon magic weapons. The instrument may also hold the abilities of one artifact instead of the abilities of twelve uncommon magic weapons. Legendary weapons or artifacts are not destroyed in the ceremony, though—instead, they dematerialize and cease to exist for as long as the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{dour destroyer} lives. Subject to GM approval, a dour destroyer of this level who managed to absorb an artifact may commit ritual suicide with his @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.iDGWTA4sLAe6GKYt]{instrument of entropy} while an artifact is absorbed in it, destroying both in the process.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.BCBJ3r8hDf3eCVtx]{Oath of Destruction}

Gemcaster Facet.name: Gemcaster Facet
Gemcaster Facet.description:
When you reach 3rd level, you choose which facet of the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{gemcaster} that best defines how you practice the magical abilities granted to you.

Your choice grants you new features at 3rd level and again at 9th, 14th, and 18th level.

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.YgXueGKDYDhMsPDA]{Facet of the Flawless Caster} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.xvCPjS7O7KlDHteI]{Gemblade Facet}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Diffusion.name: Diffusion
Diffusion.description:
Starting at 18th level, your counterspells are capable of reflecting your opponents' spells back at them. When you successfully counter a spell, you may expend a spell slot equal to the level of the spell that you are countering to turn the spell back on the original caster. You choose the new target of the spell as if you had originally cast the spell. Use your Spell Save DC and your spell attack modifier for the spell. If the spell has a range of self, you must choose yourself as the new target. If the spell affects an area, you choose the new point of origin and target area.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

utility.condition: When you successfully counter a spell, you may expend a spell slot equal to the level of the spell that you are countering to turn the spell back on the original caster

Oath of Elimination: Inevitable Demise.name: Oath of Elimination: Inevitable Demise
Oath of Elimination: Inevitable Demise.description:
Starting at 20th level, you automatically succeed all skill checks made to track immortal creatures. Creatures you slay cannot be raised from the dead, resurrected or otherwise be brought back from the dead. Creatures with means to return from total destruction like liches and similar beings are destroyed utterly unless they succeed on a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 20 + your Charisma modifier.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.XIfmkQVJgrNfpX4E]{Oath of Elimination} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Verdant Bloom.name: Verdant Bloom
Verdant Bloom.description:
Also at 3rd level, you learn to manipulate the type of plant matter you are shedding. Choose one additional effect from the following. Your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zC6hqHV2FHTDsuNS]{verdant path} also has the chosen effect.

Verdant Bloom Effects

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ms4lWZhZr3NrVY31]{Broadened Path} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.QHN5kLINvHuoeONy]{Clustered Shedding}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.HQdjye7BqMal8fnK]{Corrosive Path} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.yi4jrUF1Hd4KB6uV]{Entangling Path}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.oDWVzHuedbRHB4RC]{Forming Path} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.oSdEuw2yJsbDWL7v]{Grapes of Wrath}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.5KHePsYS99PHzZ2M]{Grapes of Wrath, Weird} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.3RhQdtCactIDt4Ty]{Thorny Path}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.hVwXclRCTsemlCOO]{Path of the Fungal Hulk} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{Funglet}

Savage Grab.name: Savage Grab
Savage Grab.description:
Starting at 10th level, whenever you hit a creature of no more than one size larger than you with your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.qIEZU5kHgolXaB9W]{bite attack}, it is automatically considered to be @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.gYDAhd02ryUmtwZn]{Grappled}. (Escape DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your choice of Strength or Dexterity modifier). Until this grapple ends, the target creature is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cSVcyZyNe2iG1fIc]{Restrained} and you can't bite another target. Unlike other uses of grappling, this does leave the kraidyl's hands free, but any attacks made with them while grappling a creature with the bite are made at disadvantage. Additionally, you increase the base damage of your bite to 2d6 + your Strength modifier and your speed is no longer halved when moving grappled creatures with you.

Note: On the Details page of your Kraidyl Bite weapon, update the die roll in the Damage Formula to 2d6.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.ZcItMZGxiEjNMR5R]{Path of the Primordial Predator}

The Serpent's Tongue.name: The Serpent's Tongue
The Serpent's Tongue.description:
At 3rd level, you learn to worm your way into the hearts and minds of those foolish enough to allow you to speak to them. A non-hostile creature listening to you for 1 minute or longer must make a Wisdom saving throw against DC = 8 + twice your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. On a failure, the creature becomes charmed by you until it has completed a long rest. Since this effect is not magical, it cannot be countered or dispelled, and it can only be thwarted by reasoning with the target. Similarly, the target continues to consider you a friendly acquaintance even after completing a long rest and continues to do so until given sufficient reason to doubt your intentions. Obviously self-destructive requests made from charmed creatures result in this effect immediately ending. Similarly, witnessing you betray one charmed creature automatically ends the charmed condition on all creatures you have charmed with this ability that can witness the betrayal. If you use deceptive attack to attack a creature you have previously charmed with this ability, the stunning realization of your betrayal lets you inflict deceptive attack's bonus damage against the target with all your attacks for a number of turns equal to your proficiency bonus plus your Charisma modifier.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

save.condition: A non-hostile creature listening to you for 1 minute or longer

Arachnid Powers: Spider Climb.name: Arachnid Powers: Spider Climb
Arachnid Powers: Spider Climb.description:
For as long as you have at least one spider point remaining, you are under the constant effects of @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.KJRVzeMQXPj8Gtyx]{spider climb}, as your hands and feet feature miniscule, sticky hairs that allow you to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands (or feet!) free. You also gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed while you have at least 1 spider point. Unlike the spell, this feature is based on your physiological changes and thus cannot be dispelled.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JC2dZxZKjGpDIyf4]{Arachnid Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

Darkvision (Underterror).name: Darkvision (Underterror)
Darkvision (Underterror).description:
At 2nd level, your sight increases as your eyes mutate. You can see in dim light within 60 ft. of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray. If you already had darkvision, you instead increase its range to 120 feet.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Cave-in Master.name: Cave-in Master
Cave-in Master.description:
Also at 7th level, you may spend a minute to properly prepare a tunnel or ceiling with @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.wMGScFH374yCQcJT]{ambercaps} for collapse. If the minimum damage caused exceeds the substance's damage threshold, a cave-in happens. A GM has the ultimate say regarding the extent of the cave-in, but usually, at least a 20-foot radius of terrain is affected.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0M9xA5nHnRKxMAcx]{Sapper} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.feats-urc.c0SBZcMUUvqNVZun]{Dvergr Daredevil}

Riddle of Stones.name: Riddle of Stones
Riddle of Stones.description:
At 6th level, you can attune yourself to the eternal knowledge inherent in the earth itself by sitting in meditation and communing with the rocks. During a short rest, you can choose to expend a use of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{exploding earth} to gain proficiency with a single tool or weapon. You lose this proficiency again when on your next short or long rest.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.FdgQNu2Mf8KGH0he]{Divine Calling} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Filament Maneuver: Extending Filaments.name: Filament Maneuver: Extending Filaments
Filament Maneuver: Extending Filaments.description:
You can expend a filament die when making a ranged attack with a reaver's filament to increase its range. Roll the filament die and then expend a number of crystal points up to or less than 1/2 the number rolled, minimum 1. For each crystal point expended, you increase the range of your reaver's filaments by +(10/20) for a number of rounds equal to the result of your filament die or until you complete a short or long rest, whereupon the range resets to normal.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Crystal Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.j8mWJmM260FD3dQJ]{Filament Superiority} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.D3ZThzktnr5oVmok]{Reaver's Filaments}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Use Crystal Powers.name: Use Crystal Powers
Use Crystal Powers.condition: when making a ranged attack with a reaver's filament

Verdant Bloom: Clustered Shedding.name: Verdant Bloom: Clustered Shedding
Verdant Bloom: Clustered Shedding.description:
Whenever you haven't moved in a given round, the area in a 5-foot-radius directly around you is covered by the effects of your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zC6hqHV2FHTDsuNS]{verdant path}. This radius increases by +5 feet per round spent without movement, up to a maximum distance equal to your Constitution modifier times 5 feet ([[5*@abilities.con.mod]]).

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.OvL2DaB8XkpoaNjd]{Verdant Bloom} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.hVwXclRCTsemlCOO]{Path of the Fungal Hulk} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{Funglet}

It's Science!.name: It's Science!
It's Science!.description:
Scientific Equipment. Starting at third level, your natural carrying capacity is considered to be halved (Your Strength score multiplied by 7.5, rounded down) at all times as you are burdened with the evenly distributed weight of numerous hoses, levers, clamps, beakers, nozzles, cinches, wicks, flasks, gears, sprockets, widgets, and all other sorts of small mechanical devices. You are considered to be proficient with these gizmos and knickknacks, but suffer disadvantage when trying to use them to improvise a function (like a pump or similar devices).

Your scientific equipment grants you your science dice. If you ever lose your scientific equipment, you cannot use any ability that uses science dice until you regain your scientific equipment. You can replenish it in one day of shopping, costing 5 gp x your HD.

Svirf Science. You learn three tricks of svirf science of your choice, which are detailed under "Svirf Science" below. Many types of svirf science enhance another action in some way. You can use only one svirf science trick per attack. You learn two additional svirf science tricks of your choice at 7th, 10th and 15th level. Each time you learn a new svirf science, you can also replace one svirf science you know with a different one. You are proficient with all types of svirf science you know.

Science Dice. You have four science dice, which are d8. A science die is expended when you use it. You regain all your expended science dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another science die at 7th level and 15th level.

Saving Throws. Some of your svirf science tricks require your target to make a saving throw to resist the svirf science's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Svirf Science DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity or Intelligence modifier (your choice)

The maximum uses section on the Details tab has been set to maintain your Science Dice.

For each of the "Svirf Science" features you gain that utilize Science Dice, the "Item Uses" fields on the Activities tab should already be partially configured for you. You will need to select this Item from the dropdown on your character sheet.

Svirf Science

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.Rl3D0APOVgv1BCSR]{Aggressive Pheromones} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.UJDZGE92kB31P2DQ]{Brain-in-a-Jar}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.cQTnuM2k72aciPLv]{Cognatogen Mutation} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.jOt0Tjv0jyvLHmcg]{Combat HUD}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.l4bMXSCPhv4CazQJ]{Counterspell Vacuum} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.oBIDpqsPZ0D6Lcgn]{Dampening Field}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.W34iHaADsXBihjF6]{Discoball of Doom} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.FMCXpx7Cm4wD9hST]{Energy Damper} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.cz56yzLauSHmGTGm]{Escape Hologram}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.feo08Meue9CEe217]{Extending Attack} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.HFPXkT18Q6i148Cr]{Kinetic Dampener} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.eWKe7S0mUHIjxVr5]{Magnets}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.trDOgTr0FpFX9TEQ]{Slug-boots} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.887Cw1VJOJG4SaB8]{Sniper's Assist} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nXoGwv7bB64MRD1Y]{Stimpack}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

Chaotic Form.name: Chaotic Form
Chaotic Form.description:
Beginning at 18th level, your form is in constant flux, as you half sheathe and draw your arsenal of dread mutated weaponry. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated}.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Semi-Precious Stone.name: Semi-Precious Stone
Semi-Precious Stone.description:
At 5th level, you gain the ability to create a semiprecious stone that changes the damage type of your spells. You gain two of the following stones of your choice. You may use your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.DeD3WvIwjl8FBEmW]{gem transmutation} feature to change gems into the semi-precious stones you have chosen. You gain another one at 10th level, and 17th level. Using one of these semi-precious stones while casting a spell not only changes the damage type but also the visual effects of the spell. You may only supplement a spell you cast with one of your gem magic features.

Semi-Precious Stone Options:

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.2VBOh4utfKv7QdHr]{Amber} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JlYiXQY8ppEWXb8f]{Crystal Quartz} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.6SYmLKsWkxTbVc9v]{Obsidian Shard} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.fAGT9v8RoSnlchvt]{Onyx}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.XS4yNwhGK56l8aTt]{Pearl} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.62oyuLyxGpDdBss0]{Turquoise}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Colloid's Blessing.name: Colloid's Blessing
Colloid's Blessing.description:
At 6th level, all your attacks with weapons modified or granted by this class are treated as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. Additionally, any attacks made with the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J3gxBiFTP5UvRro0]{Claws of Crystal} class feature receive +1 to attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 10th level and +3 at 15th level.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Svirf Science: Aggressive Pheromones.name: Svirf Science: Aggressive Pheromones
Svirf Science: Aggressive Pheromones.description:
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one or more of your science die to trigger a small contraption containing a blending of rage inducing spores and irritants. You add the science die to the attack's damage roll. This additional damage is acid damage. The target must also make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is so utterly aggravated by your assault, it has disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the end of your next turn.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

save.condition: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one or more of your science die to trigger a small contraption.

Filament Maneuver: Filament Parry.name: Filament Maneuver: Filament Parry
Filament Maneuver: Filament Parry.description:
When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one filament die to reduce the damage by the number you roll on your filament die + your Dexterity modifier ([[@abilities.dex.mod]]). If you expend 2 crystal points, you may also use this ability to reduce the damage you incur from ranged attacks.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Crystal Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.j8mWJmM260FD3dQJ]{Filament Superiority} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.D3ZThzktnr5oVmok]{Reaver's Filaments}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

utility.condition: another creature damages you with a melee attack

Use Crystal Powers.name: Use Crystal Powers
Use Crystal Powers.condition: another creature damages you with a ranged attack

Jade Gem Magic.name: Jade Gem Magic
Jade Gem Magic.description:
Beginning at 3rd level, you can invest power into a piece of jade so that it mirrors the effects of @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.CKZTpZlxj7hjjo2H]{mage armor}. You spend one day and invest your magical energies into a piece of jade worth at least 30 gp. So long as you carry the piece of jade around, you receive the benefits of the mage armor spell.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.xvCPjS7O7KlDHteI]{Gemblade Facet} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

utility.condition: You spend one day and invest your magical energies into a piece of jade worth at least 30 gp.

Jade Gem Magic.name: Jade Gem Magic
Jade Gem Magic.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Arachnid Powers: Web.name: Arachnid Powers: Web
Arachnid Powers: Web.description:
You have developed subtle spinnerets on your hands (or another part of your body of your choosing) that can produce a strong, resilient web-rope you can use for a variety of options. You get a free number of uses of web equal to your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier ([[@prof+@abilities.cha.mod]]). This total is renewed after a long rest. Alternatively, you may reset this number by expending a spider point as a bonus action. Each use of web produces a line of up to 20 feet. To get a web of 60 feet length, you'd need to expend 3 uses of web, for example. You can spend a maximum of twice your proficiency bonus uses of web per turn (See Maximum Web Uses per Turn/Maximum Web Length column in the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web Advancement} table - [[2*@prof]]). Webs you generate are only sticky in places you want them to be sticky—this is determined upon using the feature and cannot retroactively be determined. You could, for example, not suddenly declare that a non-sticky section of an already deployed web becomes sticky. Webs cannot stick to surfaces that cause any form of damage, nor can they stick to particularly wet, oily or exceedingly hot surfaces.

You can also use your web to try to restrain enemies. You are considered to be proficient with your webs and you treat your webs as monk weapons for the purposes of proficiencies and ability interaction. You can take an Attack action and expend a use of web to try to restrain a single Medium creature. You may try to restrain creatures as a ranged attack as well, but you expend additional uses of web—a creature 30 feet away would, for example, require 3 uses of web (1 base + 2 for range). Creatures with larger sizes can be restrained as well, but you require more web. To try to restrain a Large creature, you need to expend 2 uses of web. You cannot try to restrain creatures that are larger than Large, but you can try to restrain up to two adjacent Small creatures with one use of web or up to 4 Tiny creatures. A target hit must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is restrained by your web until either it or another creature tears it free. A restrained creature may attempt another Strength saving throw on each of its subsequent turns.

Alternatively, you can target a specific body part or piece of equipment with your web attack roll. You have disadvantage on the Attack action you make, but if you hit, you may attempt to trip, hamper or blind your opponent. If you attempt to trip your opponent, he must make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (your choice) or fall prone. If you attempt to blind your opponent, he must make a Dexterity or Constitution saving throw or be blinded. If you attempt to hamper the enemy by targeting a limb, shield or weapon, the enemy must succeed a Strength or Dexterity saving throw or suffer disadvantage when attacking with the webbed limb or weapon. In the case of shields, the creature loses the AC bonus the shield conveys for as long as it is webbed. As above, you can use this feature as a ranged attack, but consume more uses of web when you do so.

Your webs are vulnerable to slashing and fire damage and attacks made with weapons and effects that deal either have advantage against your webs. Your web's break DC and AC is equal to 10 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier ([[10+@prof+@abilities.cha.mod]]). Your webs are considered to have 2 HP per inch of thickness.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Arachnid Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JC2dZxZKjGpDIyf4]{Arachnid Powers}

Touch of Entropy.name: Touch of Entropy
Touch of Entropy.description:
Your weary touch can hasten the inevitable end of all things. You have a pool of entropic power points that replenishes when you take a long rest. This pool has a size equal to your dour destroyer level x 5.

As a bonus action while attacking with your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.iDGWTA4sLAe6GKYt]{instrument of entropy}, you can channel a pulse of your entropic power through it. You expend a number of entropic power points of up to your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{dour destroyer} level and add an amount of necrotic damage to the damage of the attack equal to the entropic power points expended. Undead vulnerable to radiant damage treat this damage as radiant damage instead. When attacking an object of up to your size, you instead reduce its @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.t6scHTmpmHBTZGTX.JournalEntryPage.3RM2KPMlMrSXngN3#object-hit-points]{damage threshold} permanently by an equal amount. An object receiving a whole day of repairs can regain its usual damage threshold.

Additionally, when attacking a construct with touch of entropy, you add +1d6 to your damage roll for every 2 entropic power points you expend in addition to the usual benefits. If the construct has a vulnerability to a damage type, this damage is treated as said damage type. Otherwise, you treat this bonus damage as the same type as your instrument of entropy's damage type. You can choose the alignment of the instrument freely, but it may not be good. Starting at 7th level, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the instrument of entropy. This increases to +2 at 15th level and to +3 at 20th level.

damage.condition: while attacking with your instrument of entropy

Weaponized Evolution.name: Weaponized Evolution
Weaponized Evolution.description:
The underterror, from 1st level on, is defined as a mutated, fiendish synthesis of the demonic and the base creature. You are a master of morphing your body, exhibiting deadly appendages with which you can rip your enemies apart—these mutations are known as weaponized evolutions. You gain an evolution pool containing evolution points, as shown in the Evolution Pool column on the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror Advancement} table.

Attunement. After finishing a long rest, you attune your body to exhibit premade, weaponized evolutions. You can prepare a number of such evolutions equal to your proficiency bonus ([[@prof]]), and choose a damage type for each of them—either bludgeoning, slashing or piercing damage. Your attack with this weaponized evolution deals damage of this type until you complete a long rest and change it. For example, an 11th level underterror could exhibit spikes or stingers that deal 1d8 piercing damage with one weaponized evolution.

Customization. Each weaponized evolution can be customized by assigning evolution points. These points are not expended by assigning them and you are encouraged to be creative regarding the exact shape and form of your weaponized evolutions—whether they be stinger, tentacles or something more alien altogether! You may assign evolution points to change your weaponized evolutions. The cost of evolution points assigned to a given weaponized evolution customization is listed in brackets. Some such customizations can only be applied to certain weaponized evolutions.

Hit Points and Damage Threshold. For the purpose of attacks directed specifically at your weaponized evolutions, treat them as though they had hit points equal to your level + twice your Constitution modifier ([[@classes.underterror.levels+2*@abilities.con.mod]]) and a damage threshold equal to twice your proficiency bonus ([[2*@prof]]). If a weaponized evolution is destroyed, you cannot draw it again until you have completed a long rest, at which point it regenerates and can be drawn again. Weaponized evolutions severed from your body turn into disgusting, noxious goo after 1 hour.

Weaponized Evolutions

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.kA5x04CfIj0Ev7JO]{Alternate Damage Type} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.qP177dosb6Fd6eA6]{Finesse} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.UclxxZTgp6DtIKa2]{Firmly Attached}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.6zKZ3W4QAm2i4yP7]{Heavy} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.AoqXZMhiSxMpyMAa]{Light} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.BIY3TM560st5rA4x]{Ranged & Loading} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.LnZVgGflwkXySDFP]{Reach}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.06cxr2VuViU6jkTd]{Shield} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.27JQxmHA0gbGwlD6]{Thrown}
