This feature tracks the number of attuned evolutions you can prepare. It is not configured to automatically recharge on a Long Rest as you may choose to maintain your damage types.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.HVMBkWgjnuaChkV4]{Improved Weaponized Evolution}

Attune Evolution.name: Attune Evolution
Attune Evolution.condition: After finishing a long rest, you attune your body to exhibit premade, weaponized evolutions.
Attune Evolution.chatFlavor: You can prepare a number of such evolutions equal to your proficiency bonus, and choose a damage type for each of them—either bludgeoning, slashing or piercing damage. Your attack with this weaponized evolution deals damage of this type.

Crystal Powers: Patient Defense.name: Crystal Powers: Patient Defense
Crystal Powers: Patient Defense.description:
You can spend 1 crystal point to take the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#dodge]{Dodge} action as a bonus action on your turn.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Crystal Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Embrace of the Earth.name: Embrace of the Earth
Embrace of the Earth.description:
At 9th level, you may use an action on your turn to talk to the earth to allow you to pass through stone, dirt, or almost any other sort of earth except worked stone and metal as easily as a fish swims through water. If properly protected against the heat, you can even swim through lava. While being embraced by the earth, you move through it at your base speed and can breathe as if the earth were air. You can see clearly up to 5 feet while embraced by the earth. Your transit leaves behind no tunnel or hole, nor does it create a ripple or sign of your presence. Using this feature expends one use of the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{exploding earth} feature and its effects last for concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you are still inside solid earth when the effects of this ability end, you die. However, you may, at any time while being embraced by the earth, expend additional uses of exploding earth to reset the duration.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.FdgQNu2Mf8KGH0he]{Divine Calling} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

The Tongue of the Multiverse.name: The Tongue of the Multiverse
The Tongue of the Multiverse.description:
At 5th level, you have learned that language is not necessarily only conveyed through words, but also gestures, facial expressions and the like. With expert zeal, you have started applying the deceptive craftsmanship of your trade to this form of communication as well. Choose two monster types from the following: Aberration, Beast, Celestial, Construct, Dragon, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, Giant, Monstrosity, Ooze, Plant, Undead. You can use your deceptive attack class feature against creatures of this type without sharing a language. At 10th, 15th and 20th level, you can choose an extra monster type.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Thunder Adaptation.name: Thunder Adaptation
Thunder Adaptation.description:
Starting at 9th level, you lose your racial vulnerability to thunder damage.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Multi-Arm Specialist.name: Multi-Arm Specialist
Multi-Arm Specialist.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you may use melee weapons that do not have the light property in conjunction with your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.OiA3LnjgHXSR0pso]{Multi-Armed} racial feature. Additionally, when using your bonus action to attack with only one additional weapon, you may now add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack. Finally, as soon as you get the @Compendium[dnd5e.classfeatures.XogoBnFWmCAHXppo]{Extra Attack} feature and when you use your bonus action to attack with your additional arms, you are allowed to attack with additional arms on that attack as well.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.n1Y3DSSQdh03Ihd4]{Hoyrall Shredder}

Arachnid Powers: Flurry of Blows.name: Arachnid Powers: Flurry of Blows
Arachnid Powers: Flurry of Blows.description:
Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 spider point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Arachnid Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JC2dZxZKjGpDIyf4]{Arachnid Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

utility.condition: Comes immediately after taking the Attack action.

Body Evolution: Anti-Toxin.name: Body Evolution: Anti-Toxin
Body Evolution: Anti-Toxin.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 3

You develop a gland that allows you to resist all manners of toxins. You gain advantage on saving throws against poisons while this evolution persists and may choose to have your body produce anti-toxins to immediately end the effects of ongoing poison damage as a reaction to being poisoned—if you do, however, you immediately incur one level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cspWveykstnu3Zcv]{Exhaustion}.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{Body Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Fighting Style: Inevitable.name: Fighting Style: Inevitable
Fighting Style: Inevitable.description:
When you see a creature use a feature or spell as a reaction to negate, redirect, or impose disadvantage on an attack roll you make against the target, you may use your own reaction to ignore the effects of the feature or effect that would impede or redirect your attack or impose disadvantage on it.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.052gStdnqtgszV22]{Fighting Style} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

utility.condition: When you see a creature use a feature or spell as a reaction to negate, redirect, or impose disadvantage on an attack roll you make against the target

Improved Entropic Smite.name: Improved Entropic Smite
Improved Entropic Smite.description:
By 11th level, you are so suffused with the forces of entropy, that all your weapon strikes with your instrument of entropy carry the power of decay with them. Whenever you hit a creature with your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.iDGWTA4sLAe6GKYt]{Instrument of Entropy}, the creature takes an extra 1d8 necrotic damage. If a target of the smite has resistance or immunity to necrotic damage or vulnerability to radiant damage, you deal radiant damage instead. If you also use your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHVYhzSf87vGYIfI]{Entropic Smite} with an attack, you add this damage to the extra damage of your Improved Entropic Smite.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

damage.condition: Whenever you hit a creature with your Instrument of Entropy

Amethyst Gem Magic.name: Amethyst Gem Magic
Amethyst Gem Magic.description:
Beginning at 6th level, you can create an amethyst that you may use to cause a spell to target additional creatures. You spend one hour and one spell slot of 3rd level or higher to invest your magical energies into an amethyst worth at least 100 gp.

As a bonus action when you cast a spell that targets a specific number of designated creatures or objects greater than 1, you may use the specially prepared amethyst as an additional material component to hit additional targets determined by the level of the spell slot used to create the amethyst. If a 3rd level spell slot is used when the amethyst is created, your spell may target one additional creature. If an 4th level spell slot is used when the amethyst is created your spell may target two additional creatures. If a 5th level spell slot is used when the amethyst is created, the spell may target three additional creatures.

The spell that you cast using the amethyst must not have a range of self and may not target an area instead of specific creatures.

You may only have one amethyst prepared this way at a time. Once you use this amethyst you may not use it again until you have completed a short or long rest. You may only supplement a spell you cast with one of your gem magic features.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Prepare Gem.name: Prepare Gem
Prepare Gem.condition: You spend one hour and one spell slot of 3rd level or higher to invest your magical energies into an amethyst worth at least 100 gp.

Svirf Science: Brain-in-a-Jar.name: Svirf Science: Brain-in-a-Jar
Svirf Science: Brain-in-a-Jar.description:
You are rather eccentric, to say the least, having prepared for the ultimate eventuality. While you do look normal, you've had massive surgery done on your scarred head. As a reaction to dying due to hit point damage, you may expend any number of science dice. Roll the dice and multiply them with one another. If the total of the result of the multiplication exceeds the number of excess damage you have taken from the attack that has killed you, your head pops open as your brain-in-a-jar is propelled from your body, landing at a point you designate within 100 feet. The container with your brain has a damage threshold of 5 and 10 hit points and is studded with sensors that allow you to still see and hear, but has a speed of 0. The container can fire a limited array of @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.41JIhpDyM9Anm7cs]{magic missiles}, one use of the spell per science die expended when firing your brain from your body. The effective spell slot used is also equal to the number of science dice expended—if you expend 3 science dice, for example, the magic missile would behave as if cast as a third level spell. As long as your body has not been utterly destroyed (such as via immersion in lava or @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.HBHbOGKNVVprSlwn]{disintegrate}), a Wisdom (Medicine) check against DC 20 allows an ally to stitch your body back together again and reinsert your brain-in-a-jar. On a failure, your body requires @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.AGFMPAmuzwWO6Dfz]{raise dead} to become inhabitable again, but only requires half the cost in material components (a diamond worth 250 gp). However, unlike regular uses of raise dead, for as long as your brain-in-a-jar is not destroyed, you do not take the penalties associated with returning from the dead.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

If additional science dice are expended when using this feature, the Situational Bonus field in the Damage Roll dialog can be utilized to add the extra dice, but the dice results will need to be manually multiplied together and the Science Dice resource will need to be adjusted manually on your It's Science! feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

utility.condition: As a reaction to dying due to hit point damage, you may expend any number of science dice.

Weaponized Evolution: Firmly Attached.name: Weaponized Evolution: Firmly Attached
Weaponized Evolution: Firmly Attached.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 1

Whenever an attack, spell or effect would prompt you to "drop" your weaponized evolution, sever it or otherwise affect it negatively, you gain advantage on the saving throw to resist the effect.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

Weaponized Appendage.name: Weaponized Appendage
Weaponized Appendage.description: Use this as the basis for your mutations and weaponized evolutions.

Maneuver: Maneuver Set-up.name: Maneuver: Maneuver Set-up
Maneuver: Maneuver Set-up.description:
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one forge die to maneuver one of your comrades into a more advantageous position. You add the forge die to the attack's damage roll, and you choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature can use its bonus action on its next turn to use the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#disengage]{Disengage} action to retreat from the target of your attack.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

damage.condition: when you hit a creature with a weapon attack

Reliable Deception.name: Reliable Deception
Reliable Deception.description:
By 11th level, you simply make no glaring mistakes when manipulating people and are similarly hard to manipulate or undermine. Whenever you make a Charisma (Deception) or Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10. Additionally, whenever you need to make a Charisma saving throw, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Master of Arachnids.name: Master of Arachnids
Master of Arachnids.description:
Beginning at 18th level, your impressive might makes lesser creatures scuttle and bow to your whim. Arachnid creatures will never attack you or your allies out of their own volition, unless you attack them first. This extends to demons, aberrations and similar creatures. You have advantage on all social interactions with such creatures and can understand them, even without sharing a language. You are treated as though you are under the constant effect of @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.aL1F8fvYLtNzUbKu]{speak with animals}, but can only communicate with any type of arachnid this way.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

Crystal Powers: Avatar.name: Crystal Powers: Avatar
Crystal Powers: Avatar.description:
Beginning at 20th level, you become one of the avatars of the colloid. Whenever you roll for initiative and have no crystal points remaining, you regain 2 crystal points. Additionally, when using your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.H4QEoMdUJ8EZtfqA]{Colloid's Body} class feature, you may expend an additional 2 crystal points (for a total of 6) to become immune against all damage types except thunder for the duration. However, if you do, you incur one level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cspWveykstnu3Zcv]{Exhaustion} once the duration of Colloid's Body elapses.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Crystal Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Initiative.name: Initiative
Initiative.chatFlavor: Whenever you roll for initiative and have no crystal points remaining, you regain 2 crystal points.

Colloid's Body: Avatar.name: Colloid's Body: Avatar
Colloid's Body: Avatar.description: When using your Colloid's Body class feature, you may expend an additional 2 crystal points (for a total of 6) to become immune against all damage types except thunder for the duration. However, if you do, you incur one level of &Reference[exhaustion] once the duration of Colloid's Body elapses.

Svirf Science: Discoball of Doom.name: Svirf Science: Discoball of Doom
Svirf Science: Discoball of Doom.description:
You have developed a scintillating, mirrored ball of glass and light that you can throw by foregoing an attack when you take the Attack action or by foregoing a Move action on your turn. You expend one science die as you charge the discoball of doom and throw it at your target. The discoball of doom is treated as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.3rCO8MTIdPGSW6IJ]{dart} that deals bludgeoning damage, but upon impact, it erupts in a glorious cascade of stroboscope effects and colorful light. The target and all creatures within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity or Constitution (creature's choice) saving throw or the next melee attack against them, provided it is executed within 1 round after throwing the discoball of doom, gains advantage. Discoballs of Doom generate light and thus triggers light sensitivity.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

attack.condition: Forego an attack when you take the Attack action or by foregoing a Move action on your turn

Plague Carrier.name: Plague Carrier
Plague Carrier.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you become immune to the detrimental effects of diseases you have contracted. You still show signs of the diseases you incubate and exposure to you may cause other creatures to contract the diseases you incubate. Starting at 14th level, the saving throw for any disease contracted from you suffers from disadvantage.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Sanguine Supplicant.name: Sanguine Supplicant
Sanguine Supplicant.description:
Also at 1st level, you have shown your devotion to the ahool and similar drinkers of blood. You have advantage on Charisma checks against ahool, ahoolings, bats, vampires and similar creatures associated with bats and drinkers of blood. Additionally, such creatures tend to look favorable on your fawning and thus attack you last or not at all...or at least hear you out before trying to drain you of your blood. Finally, you are treated as an ahooling for the purpose of prerequisites.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.RzjJuVkYP7DyWSgD]{Ahool Keener Domain}

Dweorg Prowess.name: Dweorg Prowess
Dweorg Prowess.description:
When you choose this archetype at 3rd level you forge a tie with the flames of creation. You learn special maneuvers fueled by forge dice.

Maneuvers. You learn two maneuvers of your choice, which are detailed under "Maneuvers" below. Maneuvers enhance your attack or defense in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You learn two additional maneuvers at 7th, 10th and 15th level. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.

Forge Dice. You have four forge dice, which are d8s. A forge die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended forge dice when you finish a long or short rest. You gain an additional forge die at 7th and 15th level.

The Limited Uses on the Details tab has been configured to scale the number of forge dice you have. Use this feature to track all uses of your Forge Dice.

Saving Throws. Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice)

Maneuvers

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.mnHQ66yyUTDWX925]{Bellows Blast} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.MZzucqZXJpNVUihZ]{Burning Assault} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JY3R7d54tTG7mCJX]{Endurance of the Forge}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.hmR24P4sZxYwDTxs]{Flaming Trip Attack} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7gRGbxQSretktIjl]{Forge's Blessing} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.EvojrT2AWGutOvEs]{Forge's Retribution}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.Yu4n6rNMZ7i6odUy]{Forge's Spark} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ghrXMRjepEoPyAts]{Forge's Weapon} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.h1Icrz9dW7Bp07DZ]{Guarded Attack}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.EOKiqCVt4IU1sWtw]{Lunging Flame} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.VOxFI0MDs6Y29QXT]{Maneuver Set-up} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.AVAlqwfiq2SLZCz0]{Melting Attack}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.3zGjL7gtIaVKJ54w]{Sweeping Flame Arc} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.0Op2r4qW4vyV1ZPb]{Take the Hit}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Stealth of the Predator.name: Stealth of the Predator
Stealth of the Predator.description:
Starting when you take this domain at 1st level, you can use your action to grant yourself advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. However, while thus affected, you suffer from disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks as you take on predatory features. This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.RzjJuVkYP7DyWSgD]{Ahool Keener Domain}

Deceptive Uncanny Dodge.name: Deceptive Uncanny Dodge
Deceptive Uncanny Dodge.description:
Starting at 5th level, when an attacker that is an eligible target for your deceptive attack hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to negate the attack's damage.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

utility.condition: when an attacker that is an eligible target for your deceptive attack hits you with an attack

Stone Barrier.name: Stone Barrier
Stone Barrier.description:
At 17th level, you learn to conjure forth devastating barriers of churning stones. As an action, you can expend 3 uses of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{exploding earth} to create a variant of @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.dLJhxDfeyOsc3zsY]{blade barrier} that deals bludgeoning instead of slashing damage, with a save DC equal to your exploding earth feature's DC.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.4GJVF2WNxYkX3Vtb]{Innate Power} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Semi-Precious Stone: Pearl.name: Semi-Precious Stone: Pearl
Semi-Precious Stone: Pearl.description:
Pearl

You can create a pearl that you may use to change the damage type of any spell to cold damage. You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into a pearl worth at least 25 gp.

As a bonus action when you cast a spell, you may use the specially prepared pearl as an additional material component to change the type of damage from the spell's normal damage type to cold. Using the pearl in this manner does not destroy the gem.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.RKBHyaqusOyb4L2m]{Semi-Precious Stone} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Prepare Gem.name: Prepare Gem
Prepare Gem.condition: You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into a pearl worth at least 25 gp.

Oath of Elimination: Dust is Eternal, Im.name: Oath of Elimination: Dust is Eternal, Impeccable
Oath of Elimination: Dust is Eternal, Im.description:
Beginning at 7th level, whenever you suffer from attribute drain due to the attack of an undead or a similar, immortal creature, you may use your reaction to expend entropic power points from your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SO8u5tyxk0XvWVWu]{Touch of Entropy} class feature to reduce this amount by an equal amount. You may also expend entropic power points in this manner to mitigate a reduction of your maximum hit points you incur (such as from a vampire's bite). For each entropic power point used, you decrease the reduction by 2. You only mitigate the reduction of the maximum hit points, not the damage you suffer. You may use this feature again after completing a short rest. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that inflict the &Reference[charmed] and &Reference[frightened] conditions. Finally, you have advantage on all skill checks made to track immortal creatures.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Touch of Entropy.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.XIfmkQVJgrNfpX4E]{Oath of Elimination} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

utility.condition: whenever you suffer from attribute drain due to the attack of an undead or a similar, immortal creature

Bonus Proficiencies (Fortune's Smith).name: Bonus Proficiencies (Fortune's Smith)
Bonus Proficiencies (Fortune's Smith).description:
At 3rd level, choose up to 3 artisan's tools. You gain proficiency with these tools.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.BhqrHkBTC5QCskBe]{Fortune's Smith} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Oath of Destruction: Greater Devouring I.name: Oath of Destruction: Greater Devouring Instrument
Oath of Destruction: Greater Devouring I.description:
Starting at 15th level, your instrument can hold the abilities of an additional four uncommon magic weapons for a total of the abilities of eight uncommon magical weapons held. Alternatively, the instrument may hold the abilities of one very rare magic weapon instead of the abilities of three uncommon magic weapons. Your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.iDGWTA4sLAe6GKYt]{instrument of entropy} could, for example, hold the abilities of one very rare, two rare and one uncommon magic weapon.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.BCBJ3r8hDf3eCVtx]{Oath of Destruction} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Mutation (Underterror).name: Mutation (Underterror)
Mutation (Underterror).description:
At 1st level, the dread powers infusing your body grant you the power to spontaneously mutate and generate a variety of dread appendages, from pseudopods to tentacles, terrible maws, sharp claws and powerful hooves, nothing is impossible. Your flesh is your sheathe and weapon, and as such, you can instantly grow the appendages you wish to use to attack; you do not need to "draw" them as your flesh ripples and changes. Sheathing more than two @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{weaponized evolutions} at once requires you to spend an action, though. You may only have a number of weaponized evolutions drawn at any given time equal to 2 or your Constitution modifier, whichever is higher. The first weaponized evolution you draw always forms from one of your arms (usually the weapon hand), the second from the other arm and thereafter, they grow from somewhere on your body, making the wielding of weapons and shields in conjunction with a fully deployed set of weaponized evolutions impossible. Armor tougher than leather armor interferes with your mutation—you suffer disadvantage on all attack and damage rolls while attacking with a weaponized evolution in armor heavier than leather armor. This does not include shields. You gain the following benefits:

  • You are automatically considered to be proficient in the respective weaponized evolution you exhibit. Unless otherwise specified, weaponized evolutions are treated as natural melee attacks.
  • You can use your Constitution modifier instead of your Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your melee attacks with weaponized evolutions.
  • Your weaponized evolution's base damage changes as you gain underterror levels, as shown in the Weaponized Evolution Base Damage column on the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror Advancement} table.
  • When you use the Attack action with a weaponized evolution on your turn, you can make one melee attack with a weaponized evolution as a bonus action. For example, you can hit a target with your clawed hands and then attack with a pseudopod growing from your brow, assuming you haven't already taken a bonus action this turn. Unless ALL of your weaponized evolutions have the light property, you don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack, unless that modifier is negative. If either weaponized evolution has the thrown customization, you can throw the weapon, instead of making a melee attack with it.
  • The precise nature and statistics of your weaponized evolution attack is determined by your weaponized evolutions chosen.
  • The benefits of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{body evolutions} and armor, whether magical or mundane, do not stack unless otherwise noted.


Saving Throws. Some of your mutations require your target to make a saving throw to resist the mutation's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

     Mutation save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier

Many of the features you gain utilize your Evolution Pool. They have been configured to use the correct number of points, but you will need to adjust the Item that they use to point to this Mutation feature which has been set up to track your available pool.

Your pool is not set to automatically recover. You will need to increase the available pool again manually when you change an evolution.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.HVMBkWgjnuaChkV4]{Improved Weaponized Evolution}

Gem Reuse.name: Gem Reuse
Gem Reuse.description:
Beginning at 13th level you may use any gem prepared as part of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JjsVPFpvccrF8hvP]{topaz gem magic}, @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.UINM7axkuDjBVGGY]{amethyst gem magic} or @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.DkOP65nsfamUVux4]{emerald gem magic} one additional time before you are required to complete a long or short rest.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Maneuver: Forge's Spark.name: Maneuver: Forge's Spark
Maneuver: Forge's Spark.description:
You can expend a forge die to hurl a spark of fire at a creature or object within 120 feet. Make a ranged attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes forge die fire damage. Any flammable objects hit by this ability ignite when not being worn or carried. You may expend an additional forge dice to increase the damage at 7th level and 15th level.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Vitriolic Tongue.name: Vitriolic Tongue
Vitriolic Tongue.description:
As an action on your turn, you can make a Charisma (Intimidation) check against a creature you can see that can hear you. Deaf creatures are immune. The pure spite in your words transcends language barriers and forces the target to make a Wisdom saving throw against DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. On a failure, the target is so incensed by your spite, it has a hard time focusing on attacks on other creatures. The target suffers from disadvantage to attack rolls against all creatures other than you for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier. If a creature successfully saves against this feature, it cannot be affected by it again until you complete a short rest and think about new ways to insult it.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

Glimmer.name: Glimmer
Glimmer.description:
Beginning at 18th level, you may, as a bonus action when casting spells or attacking, begin emitting a scintillating aura that is distracting to your enemies. For the next minute all attacks against you by sighted creatures not relying on blindsight to perceive you suffer disadvantage and all your attacks against such targets have advantage. You may end this ability at any time. Once you use this ability twice, you must complete a short rest before using it again.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.xvCPjS7O7KlDHteI]{Gemblade Facet} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

utility.condition: when casting spells or attacking

Stone Lore.name: Stone Lore
Stone Lore.description:
Different stonespeakers claim different origins for their mastery over earth and rock. Although many variations exist, most of these origins fall in one of three categories: A divine calling, innate power, or the Geomancer's bending of the earth to his whims.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Improved Weaponized Evolution: Energy Mu.name: Improved Weaponized Evolution: Energy Mutation
Improved Weaponized Evolution: Energy Mu.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 2

You grow a claw of ice, shoot acid from your eyes or develop a similarly grotesque form of attack. Choose one damage type upon assigning evolution points to this weaponized evolution (Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder)—whenever you attack with the weaponized evolution, you inflict this type of damage.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.HVMBkWgjnuaChkV4]{Improved Weaponized Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

Pure Spite.name: Pure Spite
Pure Spite.description:
Beginning at 6th level, whenever you are below half of your maximum hit points and suffering from either the &Reference[grappled], &Reference[poisoned] or &Reference[prone] conditions due to the actions of an enemy that has not yet been vanquished, you may treat any result of 1 or 2 as a 3 on dice you roll to determine damage or healing effects for attacks you execute and spells you cast. This immediately ends if the foe is brought to 0 HP or if the condition ends.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.056vVNLR9ay112Y7]{Naraneus Domain}

Body Evolution: Hormonal Boosters.name: Body Evolution: Hormonal Boosters
Body Evolution: Hormonal Boosters.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 3

You develop a gland that allows you to resist control exerted upon your mind. You gain advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that inflict the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.zZaEBrKkr66OWJvD]{Charmed} condition while this evolution persists and may choose to have your body produce a powerful downer to immediately end the effects of ongoing charm effects as a reaction to being charmed—if you do, however, the overload of depressants makes you immediately incur one level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cspWveykstnu3Zcv]{Exhaustion}.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{Body Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

My Own Fortune.name: My Own Fortune
My Own Fortune.description:
Also at 3rd level, you choose a number of item 'slots' such your head or one of the your hands equal to your Intelligence modifier, minimum 1 ([[Math.min(1,@abilities.int.mod)]]). Whenever you wear an item you have crafted yourself in the slot chosen, you gain a number of fortune points equal to your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier ([[@prof+@abilities.int.mod]]). You may assign or reassign any number these points either upon completing a long rest or as a bonus action during your turn. When a fortune point is spent, it can no longer be reassigned until the fortune's smith has completed a long rest, whereupon it regenerates. You may assign these points to do the following features:

  • Fortunate Durability. The wearer may increase the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.t6scHTmpmHBTZGTX.JournalEntryPage.3RM2KPMlMrSXngN3#object-hit-points]{damage threshold} and hit points of all items worn by 5 for every fortune point assigned to this feature.
  • Crafter's Weal. The wearer of an item with a fortune point assigned to this feature may spend one fortune point assigned to use his reaction to reroll an attack roll. He must take the second result, even if it is worse.
  • Fortunate Occurrence. The wearer of an item with a fortune point assigned to this feature may expend two fortune points assigned as part of a reaction to being critically hit. If he does, he treats the hit as a regular hit.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.BhqrHkBTC5QCskBe]{Fortune's Smith} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Improved Dweorg Prowess.name: Improved Dweorg Prowess
Improved Dweorg Prowess.description:
At 10th level, your forge dice turn into d10s. At 18th level, they turn into d12s.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.WW97cWeTjikBQKkD]{Dweorg Prowess} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Superior Fortunate Flexibility.name: Superior Fortunate Flexibility
Superior Fortunate Flexibility.description:
Starting at 18th level, you learn to use fortune points assigned in the following ways:

  • Stream of Magic. You increase the damage your Spark of Magic feature does by a further +1d6, to a total of +3d6. Additionally, you increase the duration to twice your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier minutes ([[2*(@prof+@abilities.int.mod)]]).
  • Shielded by Magic. The wearer of an armor or item with at least two fortune points assigned to this feature may spend two fortune points assigned to cause the item to be set ablaze in a certain type of energy for a number of rounds equal to twice your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier ([[2*(@prof+@abilities.int.mod)]]). The wearer can choose either acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage. The wearer gains immunity to the chosen energy type. A wielder may only be ablaze with one of these protective energies at any given time. Additionally, you increase the duration of Guarded by Magic to thrice your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier rounds ([[3*(@prof+@abilities.int.mod)]]).

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.MlhMfrrAFVlXMUPk]{Fortunate Flexibility} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.aWkIotnftg3JJxaS]{My Own Fortune}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.BhqrHkBTC5QCskBe]{Fortune's Smith} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Perfect Parade.name: Perfect Parade
Perfect Parade.description:
Upon reaching at 10th level, when maintaining a @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.3QuzpedjD1LTsoyN]{Focused Sonar} on a single creature or object and the target damages you with an attack, you can use your reaction to roll your melee attack's damage as though you had hit an opponent. Subtract the number you rolled from the amount of damage you take from the attack.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.4sVXYZpiVZ8A31zD]{Blind Duelist} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.9hk0MrqI67lCzCBG]{Vestraadi}

utility.condition: when maintaining a Focused Sonar on a single creature or object and the target damages you with an attack

Improved Weaponized Evolution: Internal.name: Improved Weaponized Evolution: Internal Quiver
Improved Weaponized Evolution: Internal.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 1, 2 or 3

Your body holds additional pieces of ammunition for use with your ranged weaponized evolutions. You can produce and fire an additional 60 pieces of ammunition per evolution point assigned to this improved weaponized evolution. Ammunition fired with this evolution cannot be salvaged and is destroyed upon being used, leaving behind strange, organic viscera.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.HVMBkWgjnuaChkV4]{Improved Weaponized Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

utility.chatFlavor: You can produce and fire an additional 60 pieces of ammunition per evolution point assigned to this improved weaponized evolution.

Body Evolution: Aerial Adaptation.name: Body Evolution: Aerial Adaptation
Body Evolution: Aerial Adaptation.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 3 or 4

You grow wings that allow you to soar through the air. If you assign 3 points, you gain 1/2 your speed as a flying speed. If you assign 4 points, you gain your full speed as flying speed while this evolution persists.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{Body Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Body Evolution: Aerial Adaptation (Half).name: Body Evolution: Aerial Adaptation (Half)
Body Evolution: Aerial Adaptation (Half).description: You grow wings that allow you to soar through the air. If you assign 3 points, you gain 1/2 your speed as a flying speed.

Body Evolution: Aerial Adaptation.name: Body Evolution: Aerial Adaptation
Body Evolution: Aerial Adaptation.description: You grow wings that allow you to soar through the air. If you assign 4 points, you gain your full speed as flying speed while this evolution persists.

Lure of Hel.name: Lure of Hel
Lure of Hel.description:
Starting at 10th level, when a creature tries to charm you and fails to do so, you can use your reaction to attempt to turn the charm back on that creature. The creature must succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your mutation save DC or be @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.zZaEBrKkr66OWJvD]{Charmed} by you for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

save.condition: when a creature tries to charm you and fails to do so, you can use your reaction to attempt to turn the charm back on that creature

Svirf Science: Cognatogen Mutation.name: Svirf Science: Cognatogen Mutation
Svirf Science: Cognatogen Mutation.description:
You have ingested your fair share of strange substances and concoctions and have begun developing a psychotropic variant of your mutations. You can use your action and expend one or more science die to trigger this mutation to trigger a combination of effects that combine @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.8RTDOt80u8aBv9qx]{alter self}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.7e3QXF10hLNDEdr6]{false life} and your choice of either @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.9eOZDBImVKxbeOyZ]{enhance ability's} eagle's splendor, fox's cunning or owl's wisdom, with the crucial difference that the cognatogen mutation lasts for 1 hour and does not require concentration to maintain. Since the cognatogen mutation is not a magical effect, it cannot be dispelled. The effects are at their minimum spell level, but for each science die beyond the first you use to activate this ability, you treat all of the effects as though you had cast them using one spell slot higher than their minimum. While you are subject to the mutation, you suffer disadvantage on all ability checks using one of your physical ability scores (Strength, Dexterity, Constitution) of your choice. You can only be affected by one mutation at any given time. You must be 15th level to take this svirf science.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

Improved Web of Steel.name: Improved Web of Steel
Improved Web of Steel.description:
Beginning at 11th level, attacks against you after you have used more than two of your arms no longer gain advantage. Additionally, offensive and defensive whirl improve.

Offensive Whirl. You may now engage in an offensive whirl without being in melee range by foregoing one of your attacks and those granted by beginning an Offensive Whirl associated with this attack. When you do, you gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#dash]{Dash} action, but only for the purpose of moving towards an enemy. After the movement, you may still execute your @Compendium[dnd5e.classfeatures.XogoBnFWmCAHXppo]{Extra Attack} and all additional attacks granted by the Offensive Whirl. You may add your ability modifier to the damage of the additional attacks you execute beyond the second, but if you do add it to more than 3 attacks, you suffer from disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws until your next turn.

Defensive Whirl. You may now gain up to 8 defensive dice per round, accounting for your Extra Attack feature. Additionally, a target &Reference[restrained] by the Defensive Whirl feature now remains restrained for a number of rounds equal to your Dexterity modifier or the number of defensive dice used to restrain the target, whichever is lower. Additionally, you may now use defensive dice to reduce damage you take incurred by spells or magic effects, though you cannot restrain opponents by reducing damage thus.

Additionally, you may mix offensive and defensive whirl—you could, for example, forego one attack (and all associated attacks granted by your Offensive Whirl) to move towards an opponent, then execute your Extra Attack and any associated attacks granted you choose to execute. You could, for example, substitute 2 of these attacks to gain 2 defensive dice and execute two attacks. In essence, you may decide for one attack to be an Offensive Whirl and one to be a Defensive Whirl.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.n1Y3DSSQdh03Ihd4]{Hoyrall Shredder}

Svirf Science: Escape Hologram.name: Svirf Science: Escape Hologram
Svirf Science: Escape Hologram.description:
You have mastered a weird little device that generates a flickering image of you in your space that distracts enemies, allowing you to concentrate fully on running away. You may expend one science die when taking the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#disengage]{Disengage} action to also gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#dash]{Dash} action.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

utility.condition: When taking the disengage action.

Cunning Action (Mistress of the Web).name: Cunning Action (Mistress of the Web)
Cunning Action (Mistress of the Web).description:
Starting at 2nd level, your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#dash]{Dash}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#disengage]{Disengage} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#hide]{Hide} action.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Bonus Proficiency (Innate Power).name: Bonus Proficiency (Innate Power)
Bonus Proficiency (Innate Power).description:
When you choose this stone lore at 1st level, you gain proficiency with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.BYFd9hiJGo9L5aOM.JournalEntryPage.PVD47ooQoPqxZqvV#heavy-armor]{Heavy Armor}.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.4GJVF2WNxYkX3Vtb]{Innate Power} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Improved Crossover Crafting.name: Improved Crossover Crafting
Improved Crossover Crafting.description:
Also at 6th level, you have learned to craft quicker and more efficiently. You craft or repair twice as much as usual per workday of downtime. Additionally, you may spend time during a long rest to craft 2 x your Charisma modifier ([[2*@abilities.cha.mod]]) pieces of ammunition for your crossover weapon.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.S52490dx1EU9JEge]{College of The Mirthful Mariachi} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.underworld-races-and-classes-urc.mwFKL7EngNAZbPKP.JournalEntryPage.yyKT4zYV09Whb5tl]{General Firearm Rules}

The Road to Hel.name: The Road to Hel
The Road to Hel.description:
At 17th level, your connection with the forces of Hel makes you the grim reaper of the underworld. Whenever you successfully kill a creature by using @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.qtf7NcGhv6oGxvJN]{Helfire} via your mutation attacks, it is treated as though you had fashioned a @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.items-urc.7YsREErrFT0eUJSn]{blood candle} from it, receiving the benefits of fulfilling the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.rD6ClOZUjEUrW6Je]{Toll of Souls} and gaining the benefits of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.spells-urc.IJrOJ7LfcwTHpyWE]{fashion blood candle}. Additionally, whenever you successfully send someone to hell, you may use your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.uLMs77SZ484qTZtI]{Favor of Hel} class feature again, as though you had completed a short or long rest.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.rE0CzmlorGDEQNEc]{Underterror Archetype} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.ZPEdqu0NxJX5Xepy]{Hel Savant} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Evasion (Colliatur Reaver).name: Evasion (Colliatur Reaver)
Evasion (Colliatur Reaver).description:
Beginning at 7th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or devastating spells due to your enhanced reflexes. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Svirf Science: Magnets.name: Svirf Science: Magnets
Svirf Science: Magnets.description:
When you take the Attack or Move action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks or movement and use a bonus action to expend a science die to draw forth a comically huge magnet. Make either a melee or ranged attack against a creature up to 60 feet away, adding your science die to the attack's attack roll. If you hit, the target takes no damage, but must make a Strength saving throw at disadvantage. On a failed save, it drops a metal object you choose that is then propelled at high velocity up to 100 feet towards your magnet, landing either in your hands or at your feet, your choice. Alternatively, you may target a creature wearing metal armor. If the target creature is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you can drag the target up to 15 feet towards you.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

save.condition: When you take the Attack or Move action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks or movement and use a bonus action

Savage Jaws.name: Savage Jaws
Savage Jaws.description:
Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.qIEZU5kHgolXaB9W]{bite attack} becomes deadlier, increasing its base damage to 1d8 + your Strength modifier. Additionally, your bite attack scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

Note: On the Details page of your Kraidyl Bite weapon, update the die roll in the Damage Formula to 1d8 and the Critical Hit Threshold to 19.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.ZcItMZGxiEjNMR5R]{Path of the Primordial Predator}

Lord of Caverns.name: Lord of Caverns
Lord of Caverns.description:
Beginning at 17th level, you have a flying speed equal to your current walking speed whenever you are underground or indoors.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.RzjJuVkYP7DyWSgD]{Ahool Keener Domain}

Arachnid Powers: Spider Sense.name: Arachnid Powers: Spider Sense
Arachnid Powers: Spider Sense.description:
At 3rd level, the physiological changed within you give you almost preternatural awareness of incoming dangers. When prompted to make a Dexterity saving throw by an effect that you can potentially see incoming (you don't have to look straight at the effect), you can expend one spider point to gain advantage on the saving throw. You must choose to do so before rolling your saving throw and you may not be blinded, deafened, incapacitated, petrified, restrained or unconscious when using this feature.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Arachnid Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JC2dZxZKjGpDIyf4]{Arachnid Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

utility.condition: When prompted to make a Dexterity saving throw by an effect that you can potentially see incoming

Semi-Precious Stone: Onyx.name: Semi-Precious Stone: Onyx
Semi-Precious Stone: Onyx.description:
Onyx

You can create a onyx that you may use to change the damage type of any spell to necrotic damage. You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into an onyx worth at least 50 gp.

As a bonus action when you cast a spell, you may use the specially prepared onyx as an additional material component to change the type of damage from the spell's normal damage type to necrotic. Using the onyx in this manner does not destroy the gem.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.RKBHyaqusOyb4L2m]{Semi-Precious Stone} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Prepare Gem.name: Prepare Gem
Prepare Gem.condition: You spend one hour and focus your magical energies into an onyx worth at least 50 gp.

Bonus Proficiencies (Mirthful Mariachi).name: Bonus Proficiencies (Mirthful Mariachi)
Bonus Proficiencies (Mirthful Mariachi).description:
When you join the mirthful mariachis at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with 1 skill of your choice as well as ranged, simple, and martial weapons.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.S52490dx1EU9JEge]{College of The Mirthful Mariachi} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.underworld-races-and-classes-urc.mwFKL7EngNAZbPKP.JournalEntryPage.yyKT4zYV09Whb5tl]{General Firearm Rules}

Truth of the Mushrooms.name: Truth of the Mushrooms
Truth of the Mushrooms.description:
Starting at 2nd level, when you fail an Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma saving throw, you can take your reaction to escape into the psychotropic visions that have become second nature to you. Instead of being subjected to the usual effects that prompted the saving throw, you roll [[/r 1d10]] on the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.tables-urc.vUfs8ZjmM2rhRpTo]{Hallucinogenic Visions} table:

Hallucinogenic Visions

d10Behaviour
1You use all your movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll [[/r 1d8]] and assign a direction to each die face. You can't take any other action this turn.
2-3You don't move or take actions this turn, instead becoming entranced by the translucent, rococo patterns you see covering every nearby surface.
4-5You become @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.zZaEBrKkr66OWJvD]{Charmed} by the creature.
6-7You must succeed on your choice of either a Dexterity or Wisdom saving throw against your own spell save DC on each of your turns for the duration or fall prone.
8-9You become confused, as per @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe]{confusion}, hallucinating crawling swarms of insects on yourself and others.
10Suffering only mild hallucinations, you can act and move normally.

Your behavior persists until the end of your next turn. Once you have used this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

You also become proficient in your choice two of the following skills: Insight, Medicine, Nature, Stealth or Survival. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make using either of those skills chosen.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0NoGaw4VYzO8jThb]{Circle of the Mushroom}

Sapphire Gem Magic.name: Sapphire Gem Magic
Sapphire Gem Magic.description:
Beginning at 3rd level, you can invest a sapphire with a bit of magic that you can later use to cast a spell. You spend one hour to focus your magical energies into a sapphire worth at least 50 gp.

When you cast a spell, instead of using a spell slot, you may draw on the stored energies from this sapphire to cast the spell. The casting of the spell consumes the gem. At 3rd level, you may have only one sapphire prepared and it can only hold enough magical energy to cast a 2nd level spell, but as you level up, you may prepare more sapphires and invest them with the power to cast higher level spells. See the table below:

Level Number of
Sapphires		 Highest
Level Spell
3rd 1 2nd
7th 2 3rd
11th 3 4th
15th 4 5th

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Prepare Gem.name: Prepare Gem
Prepare Gem.condition: You spend one hour to focus your magical energies into a sapphire worth at least 50 gp.

Mutating Flurry.name: Mutating Flurry
Mutating Flurry.description:
Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn to attack with a mutation attack, you can spend 1 mutation surge to make two mutation attacks as a bonus action.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation Surge feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.0PptTkgfQPOELLrf]{Mutation Surge}

utility.condition: Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn to attack with a mutation attack

Body Evolution: Arachnid Adaptation.name: Body Evolution: Arachnid Adaptation
Body Evolution: Arachnid Adaptation.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 1 or 2

You grow tiny, sticky hairs that allow you to cling to walls with ease. You ignore any movement restrictions caused by webbing and, while in contact with a web, you know the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web. Additionally, if you assign 1 point, you gain 1/2 your speed as a climbing speed. If you assign 2 points, you gain your full speed as climbing speed while this evolution persists.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{Body Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Body Evolution: Arachnid Adaptation (Hal.name: Body Evolution: Arachnid Adaptation (Half)
Body Evolution: Arachnid Adaptation (Hal.description: You grow tiny, sticky hairs that allow you to cling to walls with ease. If you assign 1 point, you gain 1/2 your speed as a climbing speed.

Body Evolution: Arachnid Adaptation.name: Body Evolution: Arachnid Adaptation
Body Evolution: Arachnid Adaptation.description: You grow tiny, sticky hairs that allow you to cling to walls with ease. If you assign 2 points, you gain your full speed as climbing speed while this evolution persists.

Svirf Science: Extending Attack.name: Svirf Science: Extending Attack
Svirf Science: Extending Attack.description:
You have a stretching mechanism attached to your weapons. When you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you may expend one science die to increase your reach for that attack by 15 feet. You suffer disadvantage on this attack, but you add your science die to the attack's damage roll.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

utility.condition: When you make a melee weapon attack on your turn

Crystalline Crossbows.name: Crystalline Crossbows
Crystalline Crossbows.description:
Also at 3rd level, you learn to have your crystalline structures grow over a crossbow you wield as a bonus action, fusing it to your hand. While fused to your hand, you can't hold objects or manipulate objects with the hand that is fused with your crossbow. It is possible to fuse one crossbow to each of your hands, but when you do, you obviously can't use your hands. You may use your bonus action on your turn to separate one of your hands from one crossbow fused to you.

When thus fused to your body, crossbows lose the two-handed property and expend no ammunition, as your body has a small reservoir of crystalline bolts and reloads the crossbow with crystalline bolts specifically generated for the respective weapon. Your crystalline crossbows have a Capacity of 2 (see crystalline crossbow rules below) while fused to your hands. These crystalline bolts change the damage type inflicted by the crossbow to the type you inflict with your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J3gxBiFTP5UvRro0]{Claws of Crystal} class feature. You can generate an infinite amount of these crystalline bolts, but they melt away to a sludge after 1 minute, so they can neither be sold, nor scavenged from the battlefield.

Starting at 5th level, your crystalline ammunition receives +1 to attack and damage rolls and is treated as ammunition+1 for all intents and purposes. This bonus increases to +2 at 10th level and +3 at 15th level.

After completing a long rest, you may spend 5 minutes in meditation to modify one of your hand's capacity to hold bolts for your crystalline crossbows. Whenever you do, you may expend a number of crystal points of up to your Constitution modifier. For each crystal point spent, you increase the Capacity of one of your crystal crossbows by 1 until you next complete a long rest. (So if you want to enhance the capacity of 2 crystal crossbows, you have to pay the costs separately.) This way of spending crystal points reduces your maximum of crystal points by the amount of crystal points spent until you complete a long rest.

Crystalline Crossbow Rules

Capacity. Each crystalline crossbow has a Capacity to hold a number of bolts before requiring a reload. This is denoted by the firearm's Capacity rating.

Reload. Each crystalline crossbow holds a different amount of ammunition, as denoted by the Capacity value of the crossbow. Reloading a crystalline crossbow once its Capacity is emptied requires focused concentration and takes an action during combat.

Rates of Fire

Spread (6th Level Required). Crystalline crossbows with the spread property allow the wielder to affect more than one creature or object per shot, but only at normal range. When firing the crossbow, any creatures adjacent to the target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + wielder's proficiency bonus + wielder's choice of either Intelligence or Dexterity modifier) or take damage equal to one die step lower than the base damage die of the firearm used. A crossbow with a base damage of 1d6 would for example deal 1d4 piercing damage to targets affected by such shrapnel, while a crossbow with a base damage of 1d10 would deal 1d8 piercing damage from spread fire. (see @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.v4NcmyxPh0xmIMNU]{Crystalline Shrapnel})

Burst (11th Level Required). The crystalline crossbow can fire short bursts, improving its damage. A burst consumes at least 3 bolts, but allows you to increase the damage inflicted on a successful attack by an additional damage die. A hand crossbow would deal +1d6 damage, for example, while a light crossbow would deal + 1d8 damage. (see @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.qUwUX0YqJ9IUydLU]{Lethal Crystal Bursts})

Automatic Fire (17th Level Required). Instead of shooting at a single target, crossbows with this rate of fire property can target a 10-foot cubical area within long range with bullets. Every creature in that area must succeed a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + wielder's proficiency bonus + wielder's choice of either Intelligence or Dexterity modifier) or suffer the damage of the attack. Creatures take no damage on a successful save. Targets have advantage on their saving throw if the distance is equal to or greater than the weapon's normal range. An attack with an automatic fire crystalline crossbow consumes at least 10 bolts. (see @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.w6HS3ELtVLOjRYE8]{Crystalline Barrage})

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.3yAijek34AJgLsQ5]{Crystal Cannonade}

Exquisite Gem Magic.name: Exquisite Gem Magic
Exquisite Gem Magic.description:
Starting at 20th level, you may use more than one gem when casting a spell.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Shared Fortune.name: Shared Fortune
Shared Fortune.description:
At 7th level, you may choose an additional magic item slot. You also increase your fortune points by +1. Additionally, your allies may now benefit from fortune points assigned. They are known as either wearers or wielders.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.aWkIotnftg3JJxaS]{My Own Fortune} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.BhqrHkBTC5QCskBe]{Fortune's Smith} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Spell-powered Caps (Circle of the Mushro.name: Spell-powered Caps (Circle of the Mushroom)
Spell-powered Caps (Circle of the Mushro.description:
At 10th level, you can expend spell slots to enhance your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.luEKKueR0pag2wsH]{explosive caps}, as part of making an attack with an explosive cap. You gain a number of cap-points equal to the level of the spell slot you expended, which you can use to modify the respective attack.

  • 1 point: Increase the damage your cap inflicts by +1d6 force damage, up to a maximum of your proficiency bonus times 1d6.
  • 1 point: Aerodynamic caps. Increase the range of your mushrooms by (+10/+30), up to a maximum of (+30/+90).
  • 1 point: Obscuring cloud. You generate a spore cloud centered on you that obscures sight at though it were a @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX]{fog cloud}.
  • 2 points: Hallucinogenic Cap. When you throw an explosive cap, it detonates and leaves behind a wispy 5-ft. cloud of spores that lasts until the end of your next turn. A target hit must save against you spell save DC or roll on the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.tables-urc.Y4R6u6AH1MxK3u7a]{Hallucinogenic Visions} table.
  • 2 points: Increase the duration of your hallucinogenic cap's spore cloud by 1 round, allowing you to affect up to potentially affect more creatures (those that walk through the cloud) with hallucinogenic visions.

Note: The Mushroom Domain version of the Hallucinogenic Visions table is used for this particular feature instead of the Circle of the Mushroom version because the verbiage is more appropriate ("the creature" vs. "you"). Both tables are basically the same.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0NoGaw4VYzO8jThb]{Circle of the Mushroom}

Crossover of Destruction.name: Crossover of Destruction
Crossover of Destruction.description:
Also at 3rd level, you learn to tinker with ranged weapons. You may, with a day's work, combine an instrument you are proficient with and a ranged weapon you are proficient with. You can make hornbows, violin-slings, guitar-crossbows or any other combination you can think of. The combination retains the properties of the ranged weapon and is known as a crossover weapon. You are automatically proficient with the resulting crossover weapon, though all other creatures suffer disadvantage when trying to use your modified instrument. Additionally, when firing this weapon, you do not gain disadvantage for firing at long range and gain your Charisma modifier as a bonus to the attack roll to hit your targets.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.S52490dx1EU9JEge]{College of The Mirthful Mariachi} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.underworld-races-and-classes-urc.mwFKL7EngNAZbPKP.JournalEntryPage.yyKT4zYV09Whb5tl]{General Firearm Rules}

Maneuver: Forge's Weapon.name: Maneuver: Forge's Weapon
Maneuver: Forge's Weapon.description:
You may expend a forge die to draw upon the fire within your body to evoke a fiery battleaxe or warhammer, which manifests in your hand. If you let go of the weapon, it dissipates, but you can evoke it again as a bonus action. Attacks performed with this weapon deal fire damage. The forge's weapon sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Crystal Powers: Diamond Soul.name: Crystal Powers: Diamond Soul
Crystal Powers: Diamond Soul.description:
Beginning at 14th level, your strange physiology grants you proficiency in all saving throws. Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 crystal point to reroll it and take the second result.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Crystal Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Maneuver: Guarded Attack.name: Maneuver: Guarded Attack
Maneuver: Guarded Attack.description:
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one forge die to attempt to goad the target into attacking you. You add the forge die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target treats your AC as though as though it had a bonus equal to your forge die's result until the end of your next turn.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

The Saving Throw has been set to use Strength for your maneuver save DC. Change this to use Dexterity if that's what you chose for your Dweorg Prowess feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

save.condition: when you hit a creature with a weapon attack

range.special: hit a creature with a weapon attack

Exploding Pebble.name: Exploding Pebble
Exploding Pebble.description:
At 6th level, you can expend a use of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{exploding earth} as part of a ranged attack. You throw a pebble infused with your exploding earth. The pebble behaves like a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.3rCO8MTIdPGSW6IJ]{dart}, but a target hit takes damage as though you successfully affected it with exploding earth. The target hit does not receive a saving throw to halve the damage, but may save against additional effects granted by exploding earth.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Pd4p25SGqNLjmsOi]{Geomancer} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Reach of the Hulk.name: Reach of the Hulk
Reach of the Hulk.description:
Beginning at 14th level, whenever a creature takes damage from your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zC6hqHV2FHTDsuNS]{verdant path} or moves into or out of it or moves more than 5 feet over your path, you may use your reaction to make a melee attack against the target, as though the target was within reach of your melee weapons: A mossy arm grows quickly from the path, attacks and withers away in the span of seconds.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.hVwXclRCTsemlCOO]{Path of the Fungal Hulk} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{Funglet}

attack.condition: whenever a creature takes damage from your verdant path or moves into or out of it or moves more than 5 feet over your path

Maneuver: Flaming Trip Attack.name: Maneuver: Flaming Trip Attack
Maneuver: Flaming Trip Attack.description:
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one forge die to attempt to knock the target down. If the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw, On a failed save, you knock the target prone and flames erupt from the ground below the creature, dealing fire damage to the target equal to double the result of your forge dice. You may expend an additional forge dice to increase the damage at 7th level and 15th level.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

The Damage Formula has been set to scale the forge die type with your fighter levels.

The Saving Throw has been set to use Strength for your maneuver save DC. Change this to use Dexterity if that's what you chose for your Dweorg Prowess feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

save.condition: hit a creature with a weapon attack

range.special: hit a creature with a weapon attack

Instrument of Entropy.name: Instrument of Entropy
Instrument of Entropy.description: You have one weapon that is the channeling tool and physical representation of your power, the fervent belief in entropy and destruction. Choose one of your starting weapons. You hear whispers and instructions from this weapon, sent to you in dreams of desolation or a pernicious whisper in your head. This is your instrument of entropy and it is, for all intents and purposes, indestructible for as long as you are alive and following the creed of the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{dour destroyer}. The instrument of entropy is exempt from your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.6sAGZUXPm0gvcOk2]{all is dust} feature. If you ever lose your instrument of entropy, you may gain a new one after a week of meditation on the nature of decay. Your instrument of entropy is a sentient magic item that can only communicate telepathically or whisper to you. This communication sounds like unintelligible gibberish to all but you. The instrument's Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores are equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus and it has normal hearing and vision out to 30 feet. The range of the instrument's senses increase to 60 feet at 7th level, and again to 120 feet at 15th level.

Crippling Focus.name: Crippling Focus
Crippling Focus.description:
When a blind duelist uses the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.3QuzpedjD1LTsoyN]{Focused Sonar} racial feature to focus on a single creature or object, willfully blinding himself against all other dynamic objects and creatures, he scores a critical hit against that target on a roll of 18–20.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.4sVXYZpiVZ8A31zD]{Blind Duelist} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.9hk0MrqI67lCzCBG]{Vestraadi}

Filament Superiority.name: Filament Superiority
Filament Superiority.description:
Beginning at 6th level, you may perform devastating tricks with your razor-sharp filament wires.

Maneuvers. You learn two maneuvers of your choice, which are detailed under "Maneuvers" below. Maneuvers enhance your attack or defense in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack with a filament and may only use them when attacking with a filament. You learn one additional maneuver at 11th and 17th. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.

Filament Dice. You have four filament dice, which are d6s. A filament die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended filament dice when you finish a long or short rest. You gain an additional filament die at 11th and 17th level.

Saving Throws. Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
