8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity or Constitution modifier (your choice)

This item tracks the number of Filament Dice you have. The maximum value is already configured to automatically scale with your colliatur reaver class levels.

Your other abilities that utilize these dice should target this item to track consumption.

 

Maneuvers

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.Q4rd7vXxfGswApuD]{Extending Filaments}, @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.kmk2pFXXUtQASMbc]{Filament Exchange},

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.LkVXpNqieoDd1vca]{Filament Pacification}, @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.RnRxoW1j44yN8OGK]{Filament Parry},

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.Kr09ptoM6ZU3NUjR]{Filament Push}, @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.wtcdL9jR9OYVPfF7]{Filament Reposition}, 

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.GSsfUlEM74zX4wpT]{Filament Web}, @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.kR2yMNBxCpPC4HtO]{Whirling Trip Attack}

 

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.D3ZThzktnr5oVmok]{Reaver's Filaments} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.5SGdeDBS1GkEudpX]{Reaving Vortex}

Svirf Science: Combat HUD.name: Svirf Science: Combat HUD
Svirf Science: Combat HUD.description:
When you take the Attack or Move action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks and use a bonus action to flap down your stylish combat HUD to predict the actions of a creature you can clearly see, while also directing your allies to strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you and expend one science die. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack against an enemy you can see, adding the science die to the attack's damage roll.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

utility.condition: When you take the Attack or Move action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks

Eternal Hunter.name: Eternal Hunter
Eternal Hunter.description:
At 15th level, your body no longer works as that of most mortals. You do not suffer (or stop suffering) the frailties of old age, and you can't be aged magically. You do not die of old age and no longer require air, food or water. You can hold your breath indefinitely without suffocating. However, you also no longer are wholly a humanoid. All effects that would only affect aberrations or that affect aberrations to a greater degree now treat you as an aberration.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

Arachnid Powers: Poison Glands.name: Arachnid Powers: Poison Glands
Arachnid Powers: Poison Glands.description:
At 10th level, you develop poison glands. When you successfully hit another creature with an unarmed attack, you may spend 3 spider points to inject your poison into that creature in addition to the normal effects of your attack. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or take 3d6+10 poison damage. On a successful save, the target only takes half damage. You may increase the potency of your poison by expending additional spider points, with a maximum equal to your proficiency bonus. For each additional point expended, your poison deals an additional 1d6+5 damage. You are immune against your own poison.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Arachnid Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JC2dZxZKjGpDIyf4]{Arachnid Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

save.condition: When you successfully hit another creature with an unarmed attack

Weaponized Evolution: Alternate Damage T.name: Weaponized Evolution: Alternate Damage Type
Weaponized Evolution: Alternate Damage T.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 1

You grow a stinger that has also a sharp edge, a trunk that also has spikes, or a similarly grotesque appendage. Choose one additional base damage type (piercing, slashing, bludgeoning)—whenever you attack with the weaponized evolution, you may choose which of the two damage types you want to inflict—the default or the additional damage type granted by this weaponized evolution.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

Armor of Stone.name: Armor of Stone
Armor of Stone.description:
Also at 1st level, you can enhance your armor by calling forth rocks or earth to further enhance your armor. After completing a long rest, you may meditate for 1 minute and expend a use of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{exploding earth} to fashion armor from the earth or enhance your existing armor. Armor fashioned or enhanced using armor of stone lasts until you take a long rest. You can upgrade your armor by 4 steps, expending one use of exploding earth for each step, up to the equivalent of plate mail. The stone-enhanced armor behaves as the armor the ability emulates. Alternatively, the stones can also emulate less powerful armors, up to 4 steps. For example, a stonespeaker not wearing any armor could duplicate padded, leather, studded leather or hide armor. Emulating padded armor would result in the stonespeaker treating the armor of stone as light armor as well as suffering from disadvantage on Stealth checks and provide an AC of 11 + Dexterity modifier. Emulating hide armor would count as wearing medium armor and provide the equivalent of an AC of 12 + Dexterity modifier (maximum 2). A stonespeaker must meet the Strength requirements for heavy armors to use this ability to upgrade an existing armor to heavy armor. Armor of Stone is treated as stone, not as metal for the purpose of interaction with features, spells such as @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.2yHXEcrRbadZDr5M]{heat metal}, etc. Magical properties of armor you wear are not changed by this ability.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

For simplicity, add the appropriate Armor to your character sheet, set the weight to 0 and toggle the Equipped state as appropriate.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.4GJVF2WNxYkX3Vtb]{Innate Power} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Filament Maneuver: Whirling Trip Attack.name: Filament Maneuver: Whirling Trip Attack
Filament Maneuver: Whirling Trip Attack.description:
When you hit a creature with a filament attack, you can expend one filament die to attempt to knock the target down. If the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you knock the target prone and it can be moved around by your filament for 5 feet times the result of your filament die. You may expend an additional filament dice to increase the damage at 11th level and 17th level.

The Saving Throw has been set to use Constitution for your maneuver save DC. Change this to use Dexterity if that's what you chose for your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.j8mWJmM260FD3dQJ]{Filament Superiority} feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.j8mWJmM260FD3dQJ]{Filament Superiority} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.D3ZThzktnr5oVmok]{Reaver's Filaments}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

save.condition: When you hit a creature with a filament attack

Fighting Style: Great Weapon Fighting (D.name: Fighting Style: Great Weapon Fighting (Dour Destroyer)
Fighting Style: Great Weapon Fighting (D.description:
When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee instrument of entropy you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. The instrument of entropy must have the two-handed or versatile @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.BYFd9hiJGo9L5aOM.JournalEntryPage.AOOs5OrXYgGzwI9d#weapon-properties]{property} for you to gain this benefit.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.052gStdnqtgszV22]{Fighting Style} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Filament Maneuver: Filament Exchange.name: Filament Maneuver: Filament Exchange
Filament Maneuver: Filament Exchange.description:
You may, as an action, roll one of your filament dice. You gain a temporary number of crystal points equal to the number you rolled. These temporary crystal points last for a number of minutes equal to your proficiency bonus plus your Constitution modifier ([[@prof+@abilities.con.mod]]).

Any Crystal Points gained as part of this maneuver will need to be adjusted manually.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.j8mWJmM260FD3dQJ]{Filament Superiority} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.D3ZThzktnr5oVmok]{Reaver's Filaments}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Reaving Tradition.name: Reaving Tradition
Reaving Tradition.description:
There are two commonly known types of mutations and paths taken by colloid reavers, known as reaving traditions. There may well be more out there and all of them require the unique physiology that blends living crystal with hot-blooded flesh and thus can only be practiced by the colliatur most adept at manipulating their own body, the truth of the information resonating forth from the colloid and changing the bodily structure of the colliatur reaver to accomplish feats otherwise deemed impossible. Some colliatur reavers must make a pilgrimage to a node of colloid containing the respective information, while others already have the required impulses dormant within their very bodies. These modifications generally require a certain aptitude and thus, a colliatur reaver chooses a tradition only upon reaching 3rd level.

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.3yAijek34AJgLsQ5]{Crystal Cannonade} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.5SGdeDBS1GkEudpX]{Reaving Vortex}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Spellcasting (Dour Destroyer).name: Spellcasting (Dour Destroyer)
Spellcasting (Dour Destroyer).description:
By 2nd level, you have learned to draw upon the divine magic inherent in the dissolution of all things to cast spells. You only can cast a very select number of spells, drawn from the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.underworld-races-and-classes-urc.mwFKL7EngNAZbPKP.JournalEntryPage.0JyJNATBMIKuTsmU#dour-destroyer-spell-list]{dour destroyer spell list}. To cast one of your dour destroyer spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest. You prepare the list of dour destroyer spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the dour destroyer spell list. When you do so, choose a number of dour destroyer spells equal to your Charisma modifier + half your dour destroyer level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. Casting a spell does not remove it from your list of prepared spells. You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of dour destroyer spells requires time spent in communion with your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.iDGWTA4sLAe6GKYt]{instrument of entropy}; at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

Level—  Spell Slots per Spell Level  —
1st2nd3rd4th5th
1st-----
2nd2----
3rd3----
4th3----
5th42---
6th42---
7th43---
8th43---
9th432--
10th432--
11th433--
12th433--
13th4331-
14th4331-
15th4332-
16th4332-
17th43331
18th43331
19th43332
20th43332

Spellcasting Ability

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your dour destroyer spells, since their power is derived directly from the strength of your nihilist convictions and personality. You use Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a dour destroyer spell you can cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Spell Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

Spellcasting Focus

Your instrument of entropy is your spellcasting focus for your dour destroyer spells.

Svirf Science: Counterspell Vacuum.name: Svirf Science: Counterspell Vacuum
Svirf Science: Counterspell Vacuum.description:
Whenever you witness a spell being cast that has you as its direct target, as one of the targets or that includes you among the creatures in the spell's area of effect, you may use your reaction to draw forth the equivalent of a powerful, unreliable magic vacuum cleaner that looks disturbingly like a metal proboscis. You expend any number of science dice. Roll each of the dice. If one of the rolls exceeds the spell level of the spell that prompted your reaction, you instead suck it into your counterspell vacuum, negating its effects entirely. For example, if you expend two science dice to try to counter a level 6 spell and roll a 4 and a 6, you cannot absorb the spell. If your science dice fail to exceed the spell's level, its effects are resolved normally.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

utility.condition: Whenever you witness a spell being cast that has you as its direct target, as one of the targets or that includes you among the creatures in the spell's area of effect

Evasion (Master of the Web).name: Evasion (Master of the Web)
Evasion (Master of the Web).description:
Beginning at 7th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or devastating spells due to your mutation-enhanced reflexes. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

Wild Shape: Explosive Caps.name: Wild Shape: Explosive Caps
Wild Shape: Explosive Caps.description:
Starting at 2nd level, you can use your @Compendium[dnd5e.classfeatures.swK0r5TOIxredxWS]{Wild Shape} on your turn as a bonus action to grow special, magically imbued explosive mushroom caps on yourself. Explosive caps are drawn as part of the Attack action. You gain a total number of explosive caps equal to twice your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier. Explosive caps last for 1 day or until you complete a long rest before withering and becoming inert. Thrown explosive caps detonate and cannot be salvaged after combat. You treat explosive caps as simple ranged weapons with the finesse and thrown (range 20/60) properties. You are proficient with explosive caps. Explosive caps deal your proficiency bonus times 1d6 points of force damage on a successful hit. While in this mushroom-growing form, you can expend one spell slot to regain 1 use of explosive caps per level of the spell slot expended.

Note: The Consumption fields on the Activity tab should already be partially configured for you. Select the "Wild Shape" item from the drop down so the resource consumption properly utilizes your Wild Shape resource.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0NoGaw4VYzO8jThb]{Circle of the Mushroom}

Bonus Proficiencies (Crystal Cannonade).name: Bonus Proficiencies (Crystal Cannonade)
Bonus Proficiencies (Crystal Cannonade).description:
At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with light, hand and heavy crossbows.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.3yAijek34AJgLsQ5]{Crystal Cannonade}

Evasion (Underterror).name: Evasion (Underterror)
Evasion (Underterror).description:
Beginning at 9th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or devastating spells due to your mutation-enhanced reflexes. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Potent Visions.name: Potent Visions
Potent Visions.description:
At 8th level, any creature affected by your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.3DfKe7EPSOUjIfxb]{hallucinogenic visions} must roll twice on the table. You choose which of the two effects affect the creature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.2fFeJlvURReUSxRb]{Mushroom Domain}

Master Deceiver.name: Master Deceiver
Master Deceiver.description:
At 1st level, you gain skill proficiency in Deception and Persuasion. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability checks you make that uses either of these two proficiencies. At 6th level, you can choose two more proficiencies (in skills or with tools) you have to also get this benefit.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Superior Entropic Smite.name: Superior Entropic Smite
Superior Entropic Smite.description:
At 17th level, when you elect to expend a dour destroyer spell slot to use your smite feature, you may elect to inflict extra force or psychic damage instead of the regular damage type.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Arachnid Powers: Arachnid Appendages II.name: Arachnid Powers: Arachnid Appendages II
Arachnid Powers: Arachnid Appendages II.description:
At 20th level, all the poison and chemicals you have been subjected, reach the culmination of their mutating capabilities. When activating your arachnid appendages feature, you can expend an additional 2 spider points (for a total of 4) to grow a third set of arms. If you do, you feel a tingling and suddenly grow two pairs of fully functional additional arms on your next turn. This allows you to hold up to four additional objects and you gain two additional extra attacks when using the Attack action, but these extra attacks are made at disadvantage. For as long as your additional arms persist, you gain advantage on all grapple checks made against creatures of your size or smaller and such creatures suffer from disadvantage on grapple checks made against you. Alternatively, you may grapple up to four creatures that are smaller than you at once without incurring any penalty or one creature at advantage and two without penalty. Your arms persist indefinitely or until you take a short or long rest, at which point they grow back into your body, but while they exist, you suffer disadvantage on all Charisma-based checks against just about all creatures from non-drow cultures. Subject to the GM's discretion, most intelligent humanoids will attack you on sight, considering you a horrid abomination. You no longer need to meditate to retract your additional arms into your body and can do so as a bonus action that requires no expenditure of spider points.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Arachnid Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JC2dZxZKjGpDIyf4]{Arachnid Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.PcyxgSI7HuNCMC6A]{Master of the Web}

Maneuver: Bellows Blast.name: Maneuver: Bellows Blast
Maneuver: Bellows Blast.description:
As a reaction to you or an adjacent ally being attacked with a ranged weapon, you can huff and puff like a great bellows. You can expend one forge die. If the ammunition or projectile is Large or smaller, the attacker trying to hit must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the projectile harmlessly falls to the ground in a square of your choosing within 15 feet of you.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Dweorg Prowess.

The Saving Throw has been set to use Strength for your maneuver save DC. Change this to use Dexterity if that's what you chose for your Dweorg Prowess feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

save.condition: you or an adjacent ally being attacked with a ranged weapon

Verdant Bloom: Broadened Path.name: Verdant Bloom: Broadened Path
Verdant Bloom: Broadened Path.description:
The shedding of fungal matter spreads further. When raging, the 5-foot cubes adjacent to your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zC6hqHV2FHTDsuNS]{verdant path} are also treated as difficult terrain.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.OvL2DaB8XkpoaNjd]{Verdant Bloom} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.hVwXclRCTsemlCOO]{Path of the Fungal Hulk} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{Funglet}

Deceiver's Gambit.name: Deceiver's Gambit
Deceiver's Gambit.description:
When you reach 17th level, you have become adept at striking for maximum effect after deceiving creatures. You can take two turns during the first round of any combat that you initiate or that begins due to a creature successfully saving against one of your class features. You take your first turn at your normal initiative and your second turn at your initiative minus 10. During this round, all creatures are considered to be eligible targets for your deceptive attacks and you gain advantage on attack rolls made against such creatures. You can't use this feature when you are surprised.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Entropic Smite.name: Entropic Smite
Entropic Smite.description: Starting at 2nd level, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{dour destroyer} spell slot to deal necrotic damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 5d8. If a target of the smite has resistance or immunity to necrotic damage or vulnerability to radiant damage, you deal radiant damage instead.

damage.condition: when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack

Body Evolution.name: Body Evolution
Body Evolution.description:
The @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{underterror}, from 5th level on not only is capable of exhibiting powerful, deadly natural weapons. You learn to affect your body with unusual changes that allow you to adapt to your environments. Your evolution pool now also applies to your very own body.

Attunement. After finishing a long rest, you attune your body to exhibit a premade underterror form that differs greatly from your inconspicuous form. You can only prepare one such form at any given time.

Customization. Each body evolution can be customized by assigning evolution points. These points are not expended by assigning them and you are encouraged to be creative regarding the exact shape and form of your body evolutions—whether they be feathered wings, exhausts that propel you via gas bladders, additional centipede-legs or something more alien altogether! You may assign evolution points to change your body evolution. The cost of evolution points assigned to a given body evolution customization is listed in brackets. Body evolutions do not increase your weight, since they represent a transformation of your own organic material.

Body Evolutions

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.CwNFLH8f5ZN69Iaw]{Adrenalin Boost} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.bipc5gqyG0ZlUw3L]{Aerial Adaptation} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.T1pvlOIH8NxvSVFD]{Anti-Toxin}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nL9nHFI14UOXyNwl]{Aquatic Adaptation} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.fb6PRtLRfwYZBQwV]{Arachnid Adaptation} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.rBZPk0XvZh5MLVK5]{Armor}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.IXQRQNXE6zGi0MmN]{Energy Dampening} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.aUMv1cy0ayBJBtTa]{Hormonal Boosters}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.rW1H9pEvP490EPZd]{Immune System-Boosters} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zC2nicluVwfrrcU7]{Nictitating Membrane}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7RGpdwgJfERSyLsf]{Steroid Boost} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.yK1g1lQjrGj5AHhm]{Tremorsense}

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.9F6bnpmjSZGjolGB]{Unspeakable Feedback} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ydluS98BI6hbbePg]{Upper World Adaptation}

Body Evolution: Aquatic Adaptation.name: Body Evolution: Aquatic Adaptation
Body Evolution: Aquatic Adaptation.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 1 or 2

You grow gills and fins and your hands and feet become webbed. You no longer risk suffocation in water and can breathe water as though it was air. Additionally, if you assign 1 point, you gain 1/2 your speed as a swimming speed. If you assign 2 points, you gain your full speed as swimming speed while this evolution persists.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{Body Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Body Evolution: Aquatic Adaptation (Half.name: Body Evolution: Aquatic Adaptation (Half)
Body Evolution: Aquatic Adaptation (Half.description: You grow gills and fins and your hands and feet become webbed. You no longer risk suffocation in water and can breathe water as though it was air. If you assign 1 point, you gain 1/2 your speed as a swimming speed.

Body Evolution: Aquatic Adaptation.name: Body Evolution: Aquatic Adaptation
Body Evolution: Aquatic Adaptation.description: You grow gills and fins and your hands and feet become webbed. You no longer risk suffocation in water and can breathe water as though it was air. If you assign 2 points, you gain your speed as a swimming speed.

Academic Fieldworker.name: Academic Fieldworker
Academic Fieldworker.description:
At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with 2 types of tools of your choice.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

Svirf Science: Stimpack.name: Svirf Science: Stimpack
Svirf Science: Stimpack.description:
You have developed a powerful combat stimulant that you can inject into yourself or allies adjacent to you. On your turn, you can use your action and expend any number of science dice to inject a stimpack into yourself or an ally. When you do so, that creature gains temporary hit points equal to the total sum of science dice rolled + your Intelligence modifier. The target also gains advantage on Strength checks and his carrying capacity doubles for the duration. The stimpack's effects last for 1 hour per science die expended. After the duration has worn off, the recipient automatically incurs 1 level of &Reference[exhaustion].

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

Svirf Science: Stimpack.name: Svirf Science: Stimpack
Svirf Science: Stimpack.description: The target also gains advantage on Strength checks and his carrying capacity doubles for the duration. The stimpack's effects last for 1 hour per science die expended. After the duration has worn off, the recipient automatically incurs 1 level of &Reference[exhaustion].

Crystal Powers: Crystal Refraction.name: Crystal Powers: Crystal Refraction
Crystal Powers: Crystal Refraction.description:
You may expend a crystal point as a bonus action on your turn to recharge your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.Ao6VK0Zg8qDsPSSX]{Crystal Refraction} racial feature and use it an additional time before requiring a long rest. When you do, you also negate the exhaustion level increase incurred by using your Crystal Refraction racial feature.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab that has a value of "1" to select your Crystal Powers.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab that has a value of "-1" to select your Crystal Refraction.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

New Weapon Proficiency.name: New Weapon Proficiency
New Weapon Proficiency.description:
At 3rd level you may choose one melee weapon that has the slashing or piercing quality; you are now proficient with that weapon. This is your preferred weapon. You may also use this weapon as your arcane focus.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.xvCPjS7O7KlDHteI]{Gemblade Facet} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.AyzGZsf9I1e45xf7]{Gemcaster}

Svirf Science: Dampening Field.name: Svirf Science: Dampening Field
Svirf Science: Dampening Field.description:
You have installed a field of unreliable force on your person. When another creature damages you with a melee or ranged attack, you can use your reaction and expend one roll of your science dice to reduce the damage you take by the number you roll on your science die + either your Dexterity or Intelligence modifier (your choice).

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

The roll formula is set up to utilize your Intelligence modifier. Change this in the Activities tab if you would prefer Dexterity.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

utility.condition: When another creature damages you with a melee or ranged attack

Web of Steel.name: Web of Steel
Web of Steel.description:
Beginning at 7th level, you learn how to weave a web of steel with your blades. Whenever you use a bonus action to gain additional attacks with weapons held in hands other than the one used during the Attack action, you may choose to begin an offensive or defensive whirl that lasts until your next turn. You may only begin one type of whirl per turn.

Offensive Whirl. When you engage in an offensive whirl, you may add your ability modifier to the damage of the additional attacks you execute beyond the second, but if you do, you suffer from disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws until your next turn.

Defensive Whirl. When you engage in a defensive whirl, you gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#dodge]{Dodge} action. Additionally, you may choose to forego any number of your attacks during this round. Attacks foregone this way are treated as performed attacks for the purpose of interaction with the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.OiA3LnjgHXSR0pso]{Multi-Armed} racial feature. For each attack you do not execute, you gain one defensive die, which is a d8.

You cannot have more than 4 defensive dice in any given round. These dice last until your next turn. When a creature damages you with a melee or ranged attack, you can use your reaction to raise your defensive whirl. If you do, at any time until your next turn, you may spend any number of defensive dice to reduce the damage incurred by an attack by the number you roll on your defensive die or dice, + your Dexterity modifier. You add your Dexterity modifier once to the total per die rolled. If you manage to reduce the damage to 0 or below and the attack negated was a melee attack, you gain an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.twd4zj7m1n9sBaVG#opportunity-attacks]{Opportunity Attack} against the opponent and the opponent's weapon is caught in your web of steel and the opponent has a choice: He may, as a reaction, drop the weapon to the ground, or be &Reference[restrained] for 1 round.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.n1Y3DSSQdh03Ihd4]{Hoyrall Shredder}

Reduce Damage.name: Reduce Damage
Reduce Damage.condition: When a creature damages you with a melee or ranged attack

Defensive Whirl.name: Defensive Whirl
Defensive Whirl.condition: For each attack you do not execute, you gain one defensive die

Verdant Bloom: Forming Path.name: Verdant Bloom: Forming Path
Verdant Bloom: Forming Path.description:
You may exert control over your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zC6hqHV2FHTDsuNS]{verdant path}. As an bonus action during your turn, you may direct your verdant path to move on its own accord. You may move up to your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier ([[@prof+@abilities.con.mod]]) 5-foot cubes of the verdant path a total number 5 feet times your class level ([[5*@classes.barbarian.levels]]). The verdant path still has to form an uninterrupted line from its end to you. All creatures that are in the verdant path once the movement concludes, immediately are subject to the effects of the verdant path.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.OvL2DaB8XkpoaNjd]{Verdant Bloom} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.hVwXclRCTsemlCOO]{Path of the Fungal Hulk} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{Funglet}

Inconspicuous Form.name: Inconspicuous Form
Inconspicuous Form.description:
Each @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{underterror}, from 1st level onwards, can assume the appearance of other creatures—a necessity to avoid being executed in most societies. After a long rest, you decide what you look like, including height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration and distinguishing characteristics, if any—this is your inconspicuous form and you can change into it and back into your normal shape by using an action. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this ability to become quadrupedal, for example. You may remain in your inconspicuous form indefinitely and it does not require concentration.

If you, for whatever reason, are identified in your inconspicuous form, you can use your action to change your appearance into another by following the above guidelines. However, since you did not have enough time to attune your body to this new form, the change is strenuous: You suffer disadvantage on all Strength, Dexterity and Constitution checks and have to concentrate on the change to maintain it. Upon changing your shape into a form that is not your original form or inconspicuous form, you also incur one level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cspWveykstnu3Zcv]{Exhaustion}. You gain an additional level of exhaustion for each full hour during which you maintain an alternate form you had to improvise thus, which is why most underterrors, once found out, try to lay low and rest. In most cultures and societies, underterrors can expect to be hunted down once exposed. At the very least, you suffer disadvantage on all Charisma checks when a creature from a less tolerant culture knows what you are. (Subject to GM's discretion.)

Unstoppable.name: Unstoppable
Unstoppable.description:
Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no forge dice remaining, you regain 2 forge dice.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.WW97cWeTjikBQKkD]{Dweorg Prowess} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Bp5XkttP1GIht8X5]{Smithkin} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{Dweorg}

Verdant Bloom: Grapes of Wrath.name: Verdant Bloom: Grapes of Wrath
Verdant Bloom: Grapes of Wrath.description:
You can focus the rampant power of your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.zC6hqHV2FHTDsuNS]{verdant path} and expend one of your rages as a bonus action taken on your turn to grow a number of explosive fruits from your body equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1). The fruit is treated as a thrown ranged weapon you are proficient with and has a range of (20/60) and explodes in a 10 foot radius upon impact. Creatures affected must succeed a Dexterity save equal to DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. On a failure, the creatures within the radius take 5d6 fire damage, half as much on a successful save. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Rage item.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.OvL2DaB8XkpoaNjd]{Verdant Bloom} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.hVwXclRCTsemlCOO]{Path of the Fungal Hulk} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{Funglet}

Shredding Badger.name: Shredding Badger
Shredding Badger.description:
Starting at 15th level, when you make a melee attack as a result of your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.sayPlFY3vJvJk4TD]{Erupting Charge} you may command your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7qTbHfzOBzzRrvSx]{deep badger} to use the Attack action as a bonus action.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.1MyYnTPU07HBzzqC]{Underminer}

Monument to the Ages.name: Monument to the Ages
Monument to the Ages.description:
Your body is so suffused with the powers of the stones, you become nigh unbreakable. You gain resistance to bludgeoning damage and may expend one use of your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{Exploding Earth} as a reaction to being hit to reduce the damage you take from the attack by 1d10 + your Constitution modifier + your stone speaker level. If you reduce the damage to 0 and it is inflicted by a nonmagical weapon or attack by a creature with a challenge equal to 15 or less, the weapon breaks upon ineffectually trying to injure you. If the attack thus negated was inflicted by a creature's natural attack, said creature suffers disadvantage to attacks made with it until it finishes a long rest.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

utility.condition: reaction to being hit

Hulking Adaptation.name: Hulking Adaptation
Hulking Adaptation.description:
Beginning at 10th level, you become immune to fire damage due to the moist, sticky, fungal nature of your body. You also never catch fire.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.hVwXclRCTsemlCOO]{Path of the Fungal Hulk} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{Funglet}

Channel Divinity: Explosive Caps.name: Channel Divinity: Explosive Caps
Channel Divinity: Explosive Caps.description:
Starting at 2nd level, you can use your @Compendium[dnd5e.classfeatures.YpiLQEKGalROn7iJ]{Channel Divinity} to grow special, magically imbued explosive mushroom caps on either yourself or the immediate vicinity. Explosive caps are drawn as part of the Attack action. You gain a total number of explosive caps equal to twice your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier ([[2*(@prof+@abilities.wis.mod)]]). Explosive caps last for 1 day or until you complete a long rest before withering and becoming inert. Thrown explosive caps detonate and cannot be salvaged after combat. You treat explosive caps as simple ranged weapons with the finesse and thrown (range 20/60) properties. You are proficient with explosive caps. Explosive caps deal your proficiency bonus times 1d6 points of force damage on a successful hit.

Note: The Consumption fields on the Activity tab are partially configured for you. Choose your @Compendium[dnd5e.classfeatures.YpiLQEKGalROn7iJ]{Channel Divinity} item from the "Item Uses" drop down so it properly utilizes your Channel Divinity resource.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.2fFeJlvURReUSxRb]{Mushroom Domain}

Entropy's Sense.name: Entropy's Sense
Entropy's Sense.description:
The mere presence of immortal creatures, those who have cheated death and decay, are garish to your eyes, their smell an assault on your senses. As an action, you can open your awareness to detect such foes. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any celestial, fey, fiend, or undead within 30 feet of you that is not behind total cover. You know the type of any being whose presence you sense thus, but not its identity. Within the same radius, you also detect any place or object that has been magically repaired or reassembled. You can use this feature a number of times equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier. When you finish a long rest, you regain all expended uses.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Crystal Powers: Pacifying Strike.name: Crystal Powers: Pacifying Strike
Crystal Powers: Pacifying Strike.description:
Starting at 5th level, you can interfere with an opponent's body and mind, instilling a sense of the profound quietude and calmness of the colloid inside them. When you hit another creature with a weapon granted or modified by the class features of the colliatur reaver, you may spend 1 crystal point to attempt to calm the creature. The target must succeed on a Constitution or Wisdom saving throw (target's choice) or become @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.zZaEBrKkr66OWJvD]{charmed} until the end of your next turn. If the creature is subject to a spell or effect that instills murderous rages, subject to the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe]{confusion} spell or similar effects that are based on an emotional response, the target receives another save against these effects. Additionally, barbarian rages and similar features are suppressed for as long as the target is charmed.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Crystal Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

save.condition: When you hit another creature with a weapon granted or modified by the class features of the colliatur reaver

Improved Weaponized Evolution: Ranged.name: Improved Weaponized Evolution: Ranged
Improved Weaponized Evolution: Ranged.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 4

Your weaponized evolution is treated as a ranged mutation attack that has a range equal to a light crossbow (80/320) and can fire up to 20 pieces of ammunition that you generate from your body—whether they are bolt-like shards of bone, lumps of hard, bludgeoning tissue or something stranger still. Once you run out of ammunition, you can replenish it only by completing a short or long rest. Ammunition fired with this evolution cannot be salvaged and is destroyed upon being used, leaving behind strange, organic viscera.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.HVMBkWgjnuaChkV4]{Improved Weaponized Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

Weaponized Evolution: Finesse.name: Weaponized Evolution: Finesse
Weaponized Evolution: Finesse.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 1

Your weaponized evolution is treated as though it had the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.BYFd9hiJGo9L5aOM.JournalEntryPage.AOOs5OrXYgGzwI9d#weapon-properties]{Finesse} property. This customization can only be applied to melee weaponized evolutions.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{Weaponized Evolution}

Crystalline Crossbows: Lethal Crystal Bu.name: Crystalline Crossbows: Lethal Crystal Bursts
Crystalline Crossbows: Lethal Crystal Bu.description:
Beginning at 11th level, you can add the Burst Rate of Fire to a crystalline crossbow with a Capacity of 3 or higher when customizing it after a long rest. Adding Burst to a crystalline crossbow reduces your crystal points maximum by 3 per hand modified. Additionally, you increase the base Capacity of your crystalline crossbows to 3.

Burst . The crystalline crossbow can fire short bursts, improving its damage. A burst consumes at least 3 bolts, but allows you to increase the damage inflicted on a successful attack by an additional damage die. A hand crossbow would deal +1d6 damage, for example, while a light crossbow would deal +1d8 damage.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.fw5aSWUAXAK7PiQf]{Crystalline Crossbows} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.3yAijek34AJgLsQ5]{Crystal Cannonade}

Hel Fire's Assault.name: Hel Fire's Assault
Hel Fire's Assault.description:
At 11th level, your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SRNPsEMfydemTXZP]{weaponized evolutions} brim with the powers of Helfire. When assigning evolution points to the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZU5Pdj6SMFmVYRJF]{energy mutation} improved weaponized evolution and choosing fire as the damage type you inflict with the evolution, you may choose to instead have your weaponized evolution cause Helfire damage, which is half fire and half necrotic damage. Additionally, when you hit a creature with a mutation attack that deals Helfire damage, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.rE0CzmlorGDEQNEc]{Underterror Archetype} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.ZPEdqu0NxJX5Xepy]{Hel Savant} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Secrets of the Stone.name: Secrets of the Stone
Secrets of the Stone.description:
Stonespeakers do not prepare or cast spells as other wielders of magic do. Instead, you possess a repertoire of abilities known as secrets of the stone that require you to focus the earthen energies suffusing you. You can use each secret of the stone you know 3 times before requiring a long rest to recharge your uses for that particular secret of the stone. The secrets of the stone column in the stonespeaker table shows the maximum level of secret of the stone you can learn. At 7th level, for example, a stonespeaker knows 2 secret of the stone cantrips, one 1st-level secret of the stones and one 2nd-level secret of the stones. Secrets of the stones behave like spells otherwise, with one notable difference—if a given secret of the stone has an "At Higher Levels" line, a stonespeaker may not use the secret of the stone's higher level version, unless he learned the secret at that level as well. Uses of the same secret of the stone learned at different levels are tracked independently from one another.

Spellcasting Ability

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your secrets of the stone, since your power stems from insight into the foundations of the world. You use your Wisdom whenever a secret of the stone refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a secret of the stone you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Secret of the Stone save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.

Spellcasting Focus

You can use a druidic focus, an arcane focus or a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for your stonespeaker secrets of the stone. Once chosen, this choice cannot be reversed.

Secrets of the Stone Spells

Cantrips (0 level): @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.JLTQyqXEaJDrTXyW]{acid splash} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.dl8YwvMboBqX2OC4]{resistance} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.CAxSzHWizrafT033]{dancing lights} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Bnn9Nzajixvow9xi]{light} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.kjmjY0zlE6IEiQVL]{mending} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.icZokbgV1jIMpNCv]{message} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.udsLtG0BugXHR2JQ]{prestidigitation}

1st Level: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.gMrWeG8fMDPRFiVe]{entangle} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.zPGohqJRir6MyQ3U]{expeditious retreat} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.7e3QXF10hLNDEdr6]{false life} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.pub0OWVEB71XQx1n]{feather fall} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{identify} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.B0pnIcc52O6G8hi8]{longstrider} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.z1mx84ONwkXKUZd7]{shield}

2nd level: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.UDUnlfPsOAbq2RSE]{blur} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.WahI41a3goVUg0x1]{enlarge/reduce} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.KrM3oHVv13RAALrS]{find traps} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{locate object} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.pRMvmknwLf2tdMTj]{pass without trace}

3rd level: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.GSvLWcdCZLQkilXT]{blink} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.spells-urc.X1S8IAlHUpxYgVev]{earthen crush} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.64uo4fHriHLjRUrX]{meld into stone} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.j8NtLXOOJ3GAKF8I]{protection from energy} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.yqUDoxk4x0NWG5Bz]{slow} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.YBda6nLKjxdT1LbS]{water walk}

4th level: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.KgEw3sDr39C6g8nY]{conjure minor elementals} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.da0a1t2FqaTjRZGT]{freedom of movement} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.04nMsTWkIFvkbXlY]{polymorph} (earth elemental only), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.QvGcdRUSNRKEQJlK]{stone shape} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.ReMbjfeOKoSj3O79]{stoneskin}

5th level: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.ATo0Eb63TDtnu6iA]{animate objects} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.dp6xny4v8PDoIGjh]{commune with nature} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.1LkZvINag7KqBmDR]{conjure elemental} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.MBMaQLwoy05qzMJ3]{mislead} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.d9MwcXi7Il3HROXd]{passwall} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.NmoRmM1mhuM3pqnY]{wall of stone}

6th level: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.cYI4RNNjI5GAmLhy]{find the path} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.kozNy29b0X6exFhY]{flesh to stone} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.yI0XWIgI0IGGsR3R]{move earth} @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.s7nXgot5gGZVcMrv]{transport via plants} (uses rocks instead of plants), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.XzkJpE6XpZfKjODD]{true seeing}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Oath of Despair: Sticks and Stones.name: Oath of Despair: Sticks and Stones
Oath of Despair: Sticks and Stones.description:
At 15th level, a lifetime of decay and disillusion has rendered you immune to the taunts of others. You are treated as though you were deaf and blind for the purpose of spells and class features when being deaf or blind would be beneficial to you. You count, for example, as though you have averted your eyes, even while staring right into a basilisk's eyes. Additionally, creatures that fail their saving throw against your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.Jiswcmnde4yDISiS]{Accelerated Decay} class feature immediately incur one level of &Reference[exhaustion].

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.vBmrL6GhORL4COpo]{Oath of Despair} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Body Evolution: Armor.name: Body Evolution: Armor
Body Evolution: Armor.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 1 to 8

Whether via plates of bone or chitin, rubbery flesh or similar means, your body has learned to protect itself from the rigors of the adventuring life. If you assign only 1 point, your armored body behaves as though you were wearing leather armor. For each additional point you assign, up to a maximum equal to your Wisdom modifier, your body evolution instead increases your AC by an additional +1, mimicking the respective armor. You do not suffer disadvantage to Dexterity (Stealth) checks due to this body evolution but the maximum bonus to AC for your Dexterity modifier still applies. If, for example, you assigned 5 points, your armor body evolution would mimic a half-plate in protective capability, granting you an AC of 15 + Dexterity modifier (maximum 2). However, unlike when wearing a real half plate, you would not suffer from disadvantage on Stealth checks.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

For simplicity, add the appropriate Armor to your character sheet, remove the Stealth Disadvantage from the Details tab, set the weight to 0 and toggle the Equipped state as appropriate.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{Body Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Underterror Archetype.name: Underterror Archetype
Underterror Archetype.description:
Not all underterrors are alike—there are some that focus on gaining more control over their strange, twitching forms, while others prefer dabbling in the powers granted to them by the forces of Hel.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Grasp of the Earth.name: Grasp of the Earth
Grasp of the Earth.description:
Starting at 1st level, you can petition the earth to hold the fools that dare challenge you. As an action, you can expend a use of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{exploding earth} to cause each creature in a 10-foot cube originating from you to make a Constitution or Strength saving throw (your choice) against your exploding earth save DC. The creatures that fail their saving throws are all @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.gYDAhd02ryUmtwZn]{grappled} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.y0TkcdyoZlOTmAFT]{prone} until the end of your next turn.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.Pd4p25SGqNLjmsOi]{Geomancer} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Body Evolution: Immune System-Boosters.name: Body Evolution: Immune System-Boosters
Body Evolution: Immune System-Boosters.description:
Evolution Point Cost: 2

You develop a gland that makes your body less susceptible to diseases and the rigors of physical exertion. You gain advantage on saving throws against diseases while this evolution persists and may choose to have your body produce fatigue-suppressants and ignore the effects of one level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cspWveykstnu3Zcv]{Exhaustion} for a number of hours equal to your Constitution modifier—if you do, however, you incur two levels of exhaustion after the suppressant ceases to function.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Mutation (Underterror) feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nHrUgwlpVStYdkGQ]{Body Evolution} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Deadly Mutation.name: Deadly Mutation
Deadly Mutation.description:
At 17th level, your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.umvciE7cr4wgAbrj]{mutation} capability is greatly enhanced. You choose two of the following @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.9eOZDBImVKxbeOyZ]{enhance ability} effects on each activation: bear's endurance, bull's strength or cat's grace. Additionally, you add @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.9kGrFXnLiRg3Xnbo]{regenerate} to the effects of your mutation and you only suffer disadvantage on all ability checks using one of your mental ability scores (Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma) of your choice. Additionally, when you roll initiative and have no science dice remaining, you regain 1 science die.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

Erupting Charge.name: Erupting Charge
Erupting Charge.description:
At 7th level, if you take the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.6PfYpwxkdQkyS6b7.JournalEntryPage.t0XXMmv014K4vV3p#dash]{Dash} action while astride your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7qTbHfzOBzzRrvSx]{deep badger}, you may burrow through earthwork, mud, soil or loosely packed stones as part of the Dash. Additionally, if you move at least 10 feet in a straight line while astride your deep badger, you can use your bonus action to gain a +5 bonus to the attack's damage roll (if you choose to make a melee attack and hit) or push the target up to 10 feet away from you (if you choose to shove and you succeed). The target of your erupting charge must succeed a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone, regardless of whether you succeed with the attack or shove. You also increase the burrow speed of your deep badger by +10 feet.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.1MyYnTPU07HBzzqC]{Underminer}

Chemical Stamina.name: Chemical Stamina
Chemical Stamina.description:
At 9th level, your explorations have yielded a sufficient amount of odd samples, from strange rhizomes to troll's brains to allow you to create a unique, tailor-made diet of potions, draughts and pills that enhances your health and endurance. You may add your Intelligence modifier in place of your Constitution modifier to your hit point total at each level, as well as when expending Hit Dice to recover hit points. This effect is retroactive to 1st level.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

Crystal Powers: Stillness of the Colloid.name: Crystal Powers: Stillness of the Colloid
Crystal Powers: Stillness of the Colloid.description:
Also at 7th level, you can use your action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.oreoyaFKnvZCrgij]{frightened}. Additionally, you may spend 1 crystal point as part of using this feature to immediately end one type of ongoing damage you suffer from, as your crystalline physiology supports your mortal parts.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Crystal Powers.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.J4I6f7GzLOoJetPh]{Crystal Powers} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

utility.condition: end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be frightened

End Ongoing Damage.name: End Ongoing Damage
End Ongoing Damage.condition: Uses the same action as the other half of this feature.

Stonestride.name: Stonestride
Stonestride.description:
Moving through unworked, nonmagical difficult terrain made of earth and rocks costs you no extra movement. You can also pass through unworked, nonmagical rock or earth obstacles without being slowed by them or taking damage from them, even if they are hazardous. In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against rocks or earthen material that is magically created or manipulated to impede movement.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Pact with Hel.name: Pact with Hel
Pact with Hel.description:
Your conduct with the forces of Hel has granted you limited access to magic most dire.

Cantrips

Starting at 3rd level when you take this archetype, you know two cantrips of your choice from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.QvPDSUsAiEn3hD8s.JournalEntryPage.mx4TsSbBIAaAkhQ7]{warlock spell list}. You learn additional warlock cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as show in the Cantrips Known column of the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.ZPEdqu0NxJX5Xepy]{Hel Savant} table.

Spell Slots

The Hel Savant table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your Hel Savant spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.

Spells Known of 1st level and Higher: At 3rd level, you know 1 1st-level spells of your choice from the Warlock spell list. The Spells Known column of the Hel Savant table shows when you learn more warlock spells of your choice of 1st level or higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the warlock spells you know and replace it with another spell from the warlock spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Spellcasting Ability: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your warlock spells, so you use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a warlock spell you cast when making an attack roll with one.

Spell Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + Wisdom modifier

Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.rE0CzmlorGDEQNEc]{Underterror Archetype} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.ZPEdqu0NxJX5Xepy]{Hel Savant} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

Hunter in the Dark.name: Hunter in the Dark
Hunter in the Dark.description:
Beginning at 17th level, you can use your action to spend 4 mutation surges to become resistant to all damage types but radiance for 1 turn. Additionally, all creatures in a 10-foot cube originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your mutation save DC. The creatures that fail their saving throw are @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.oreoyaFKnvZCrgij]{Frightened} by you for 4 rounds.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.0PptTkgfQPOELLrf]{Mutation Surge}

Svirf Science: Slug-boots.name: Svirf Science: Slug-boots
Svirf Science: Slug-boots.description:
You have mastered an almost frictionless formula for svirf slug slime. When you take a Move action, you may expend one science die to coat your boots in this slime. The slime increases your speed by 30 feet for 1 round and allows you to glide effortlessly over difficult terrain (excluding that resulting from moving through creatures' spaces). This svirf science allows you to even glide at full speed while prone and allows you to move over water and other non-damaging liquids...however, stopping tends to be an issue. At the end of your movement, you must succeed a Dexterity saving throw (DC 15) or continue moving for [[/r 1d6*5]] feet and fall prone at the end of this additional movement. If you collide with anything during this additional movement, you take bludgeoning damage equal to 1/2 the additional feet you slid.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

save.condition: When you take a Move action

Svirf Science: Slug-boots.name: Svirf Science: Slug-boots
Svirf Science: Slug-boots.description: The slime increases your speed by 30 feet for 1 round and allows you to glide effortlessly over difficult terrain (excluding that resulting from moving through creatures' spaces). This svirf science allows you to even glide at full speed while prone and allows you to move over water and other non-damaging liquids...however, stopping tends to be an issue.

Stone Spikes.name: Stone Spikes
Stone Spikes.description:
At 9th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with razor sharp stone shards. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 bludgeoning or piercing damage (your choice, chosen every turn) to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8. Additionally, as a bonus action, you may expend one use of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7ysMAvUZBoJnyER8]{exploding earth} to make this ability's effects apply to all your attacks for 1 minute.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your Exploding Earth.

The Damage Formula on the Details tab is configured to scale with your stonespeaker class levels. The damage type has been set to piercing, but you can change this manually to bludgeoning if that's what you choose.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.4GJVF2WNxYkX3Vtb]{Innate Power} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

damage.condition: when you hit a creature with a weapon attack

Favor of Hel.name: Favor of Hel
Favor of Hel.description:
At 13th level, you can call upon the forces of Hel to alter fate. When you make an ability check or a saving throw, you can use this feature to add a [[/r 1d10]] to your roll. You can do so after seeing the initial roll, but before the roll's effects occur. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.2bvzM1zNIGdqKDlA]{Underterror}

utility.condition: When you make an ability check or a saving throw

Mutation (Svirf Scientist).name: Mutation (Svirf Scientist)
Mutation (Svirf Scientist).description:
At 13th level, you have ingested your fair share of strange substances and concoctions and have begun developing a latent mutation in your own body. You can use your action and expend one or more science die or dice to cause this mutation to trigger a combination of effects that combine @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.8RTDOt80u8aBv9qx]{alter self}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.7e3QXF10hLNDEdr6]{false life} and your choice of either @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.9eOZDBImVKxbeOyZ]{enhance ability's} bear's endurance, bull's strength or cat's grace, with the crucial difference that the mutation lasts for 1 hour and does not require concentration to maintain. Since the mutation is not a magical effect, it cannot be dispelled. The effects are at their minimum spell level, but for each science die beyond the first you use to activate this ability, you treat all of the effects as though you had cast them using one spell slot higher than their minimum. While you are subject to the mutation, you suffer disadvantage on all ability checks using two of your mental ability scores (Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma) of your choice. You can only be affected by one mutation at any given time.

Adjust the Item Uses portion of the Activities tab to select your "It's Science" feature.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.jtpgyzaHLFUe21fs]{Svirf Scientist}

Crystalline Crossbows: Crystalline Shrap.name: Crystalline Crossbows: Crystalline Shrapnel
Crystalline Crossbows: Crystalline Shrap.description:
At 6th level, you may add the Spread Rate of Fire to a crystalline crossbow when customizing it after a long rest. Adding Spread to a crystalline crossbow reduces your crystal points maximum by 2 per hand modified.

Spread. Crystalline crossbows with the spread property allow the wielder to affect more than one creature or object per shot, but only at normal range. When firing the crossbow, any creatures adjacent to the target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + wielder's proficiency bonus + wielder's choice of either Intelligence or Dexterity modifier) or take damage equal to one die step lower than the base damage die of the firearm used. A crossbow with a base damage of 1d6 would for example deal 1d4 piercing damage to targets affected by such shrapnel, while a crossbow with a base damage of 1d10 would deal 1d8 piercing damage from spread fire.

Note the Dexterity saving throw is configured for Intelligence and may need manual adjustment.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.fw5aSWUAXAK7PiQf]{Crystalline Crossbows} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.3yAijek34AJgLsQ5]{Crystal Cannonade}

range.special: any creatures adjacent to the target within normal range

Channel Divinity: Keening.name: Channel Divinity: Keening
Channel Divinity: Keening.description:
Starting at 2nd level, you can use Channel Divinity to emit a haunting keening at a target within 120 feet that tears foes asunder. Make a ranged spell attack for the keening. If you hit, the target creature takes 2d6 thunder damage, 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, 5d6 at 16th level. You can use this ability up to your Constitution modifier times. It recharges upon taking a long rest. If you also have the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.feats-urc.NvaY49CbbkZfae4l]{Ironsinger} feat, you can use your bonus action to emit the feat's destructive vibration as though it originated from a target hit by your keening, using the creature as the point of origin.

Note: You will need to set the Activity Consumption to use your Channel Divinity item charges. At higher levels, you will need to adjust the damage dice manually.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.RzjJuVkYP7DyWSgD]{Ahool Keener Domain}

All of your Heart's Desires.name: All of your Heart's Desires
All of your Heart's Desires.description:
At 13th level, you have learned to capitalize on the discord and doubt you have sown and turn enemies into allies. As an action, you can promise all of a creature's heart's desires to help you—whether you intend to keep your promise or not determines whether you use Deception or Persuasion when using this feature. The DC for this check is equal to the target's AC or 8 + the target's proficiency  bonus + the target's Wisdom modifier, whichever is higher, and you may only target creatures that are eligible targets for your deceptive attack or currently charmed by you. Creatures thus affected must make a Wisdom saving throw against DC = 8 + twice your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. On a failure, they switch allegiances and fight for your cause. This is a nonmagical effect and as such has no duration, but having to go against one's convictions, attack erstwhile allies, etc. allow the creature to reroll the saving throw. Similarly, heartfelt arguments roleplayed by other characters may allow for a reroll, subject to the GM's discretion. If you fail to deliver on your promises, the effect will end as well. A creature that successfully saves against this ability cannot be affected again until you have completed a long rest. Since these promises usually entail morally questionable suggestions, it is not uncommon for creatures that have resisted you to become weary of you. If you use this ability on a charmed creature and it successfully saves against it, the creature is no longer is charmed and becomes immune to your deceptive attack feature until you have completed a long rest. Note that this ability also allows you to end charm effects of other creatures; the victims may actually be grateful to you.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.6on7tckTmPMFCXT8]{Mistress of the Web}

Smashing Keening.name: Smashing Keening
Smashing Keening.description:
At 6th level, when you deal thunder damage to a Large or smaller creature, you can choose to also push it up to 10 feet away from you.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.RzjJuVkYP7DyWSgD]{Ahool Keener Domain}

Crystalline Crossbows: Crystalline Barra.name: Crystalline Crossbows: Crystalline Barrage
Crystalline Crossbows: Crystalline Barra.description:
At 17th level, you can add the Automatic Fire Rate of Fire to a crystalline crossbow with a Capacity of 10. Adding Automatic Fire to a crystalline crossbow reduces your crystal points maximum by 4 per hand modified.

Automatic Fire. Instead of shooting at a single target, crossbows with this rate of fire property can target a 10-foot cubical area within long range with bullets. Every creature in that area must succeed a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + wielder's proficiency bonus + wielder's choice of either Intelligence or Dexterity modifier) or suffer the damage of the attack. Creatures take no damage on a successful save. Targets have advantage on their saving throw if the distance is equal to or greater than the weapon's normal range. An attack with an automatic fire crystalline crossbow consumes at least 10 bolts.

Note the Dexterity saving throw is configured for Intelligence and may need manual adjustment.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.fw5aSWUAXAK7PiQf]{Crystalline Crossbows} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.3yAijek34AJgLsQ5]{Crystal Cannonade}

Ambercaps.name: Ambercaps
Ambercaps.description:
Starting at 7th level, you learn to prepare a special type of amber explosive after completing a long rest, so-called ambercaps. You may create one or more ambercaps that deal varying amounts of damage in a 20-foot-radius; in total, the daily accumulated ambercaps from this ability can deal a number of 1d4s of both fire damage and bludgeoning damage equal to twice your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier ([[2*(@prof+@abilities.int.mod)]]). You may freely distribute the damage caused and portion the ambercaps as you see fit. The minimum damage of an ambercap is 1d4 fire and 1d4 bludgeoning damage. For example, an 8th level sapper with an Intelligence score of 14 can prepare one ambercap that deals 8d4 fire and 8d4 bludgeoning damage, two that deal 4d4 fire and 4d4 bludgeoning damage, etc. Ambercaps are more volatile than @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.DcAdIDBClNBsJpHq]{ambersticks} and become immediately inert after completing a long rest or 24 hours after creation, whichever happens first. You treat ambercaps as ambersticks for all other intents and purposes, including saving throw DCs, range, etc. You may prepare ambercaps and place them strategically without immediately blowing them up. You may trigger ambercaps you have set as a bonus action or as a reaction for as long as you can see them.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0M9xA5nHnRKxMAcx]{Sapper}

Oath of Despair: End of All Hope.name: Oath of Despair: End of All Hope
Oath of Despair: End of All Hope.description:
At 20th level, all creatures within the aura granted by your @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.Jiswcmnde4yDISiS]{Accelerated Decay} class feature lose any immunity to the &Reference[charmed], &Reference[frightened] and &Reference[poisoned] conditions. If a target creature's armor is completely destroyed by Accelerated Decay, it is immediately &Reference[incapacitated] for [[/r 1d4]] rounds.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.vBmrL6GhORL4COpo]{Oath of Despair} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour Destroyer}

Explosive Belch (60' Cone).name: Explosive Belch (60' Cone)
Explosive Belch (60' Cone).description:
By 14th level, your body has adjusted to the destructive potential of your own explosive caps. You can, as an action on your turn, eat an explosive cap and generate a small, volatile burp, that emits in a 15-foot-cone from your mouth. All creatures within this area must succeed a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take damage as though they were hit by your explosive cap. Creatures that successfully save against your burp instead take half damage. Alternatively, you may stuff 5 explosive caps into your mouth, generating a massive 60-foot-cone originating from your mouth. All creatures within this area must succeed a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take damage as though they were hit by your explosive cap. Creatures that successfully save against your burp instead take half damage. This amount of explosive caps does take its total on your body, though—you suffer from disadvantage on all ability checks and your speed is halved until the end of your next turn after eating 5 caps at once.

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.luEKKueR0pag2wsH]{Wild Shape: Explosive Caps} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.subclasses-urc.0NoGaw4VYzO8jThb]{Circle of the Mushroom}

Spellcasting (Gemcaster).name: Spellcasting (Gemcaster)
Spellcasting (Gemcaster).description:
You have studied the special qualities of gems and learned to incorporate them into your natural spellcasting abilities.

Level Cantrips
Known		 Spells
Known		 — Spell Slots per Spell Level —
1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9
1st 4 2 2 — — — — — — — —
2nd 4 3 3 — — — — — — — —
3rd 4 4 4 2 — — — — — — —
